loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Olinda; es  conviviente; la socia tiene 30 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de (8, 4) años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y elaboración de panes, la socia alquila un local para poder elaborar los panes, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar harina, levadura y otros insumos; la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Olinda, age 30, lives with her partner and has two children aged eight and four. She is member of the communal bank  “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; the bank is located in the Oropesa settlement of the Quispicanchis province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Olinda divides her time between her household work and her bread baking business; she rents a space where she does her baking work. Olinda is seeking a loan to purchase supplies such as flour, yeast, and other items. She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it in the timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for a bakery (flour, yeast, etc)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, es un hombre seguro de si mismo, tiene 48 años y vive en concubinato con Nidia, de 37 años, ambos tienen a Henry de 18 años, que es su único hijo. En armonía familiar ellos viven solos en la comunidad rural de Santa Clara. Hace algunos años, su hijo ingreso a la universidad de Ica (costa del Perú), y según Carlos, en ese momento cambiaron sus deseos y aspiraciones; pues su prioridad es sacar adelante a su hijo y verlo como todo un profesional. Cuando tenia 17 años se dedicó a la agricultura, en ese entonces trabajaba con ahínco para que su producción de papa, arveja y habas sean rentables y generen muchas ganancias, con el tiempo, consolidó una familia y desde ahí pudo adquirir mayores ganancias y con el dinero ahorrado compró más terrenos agrícolas. A pesar de tener dificultades no existe nada imposible, si bien tiene que enviar dinero mensual para los estudios de su hijo, continuó sembrando y trabajando con mucho optimismo. Cuenta que tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “yungay”, que dentro de unos meses cosechará. Ahora vende papa en grandes cantidades, “con mi producción puedo educar a mi hijo”, afirma. Sin embargo, él, planea comprar una pequeña casa en la ciudad de Ica, ya que quiere estar en compañía de su hijo, ahí piensa abrir una pequeña bodega de comestibles. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo obtenido en todo este tiempo, asegurando conseguir muchos éxitos y alegrías. Carlos, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá en su próxima siembra de papa de la variedad “yungay” y “única”.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very confident man who is 48 years old and lives with his partner, Nidia, age 37.  Their only son, Henry, is 18.  They live alone harmoniously in the rural community of Santa Clara.  A few years ago their son went off to college in Ica (Peruvian Coast) and, according to Carlos, at that time they changed their dreams and goals since their main priority was to make sure he received his education to become a professional.

When he was 17, Carlos began his farming activity, working hard so his potato, pea and lima bean crops would be profitable and generate a good income.  Over time he formed a family and was able to earn more money and save enough to buy farmland.  Despite the difficulties, nothing was impossible even though he had to send money every month to his son to cover education costs.  But he continued planting and working with optimism.

His "yungay" potato variety will soon be ready for harvest.  He is now selling large quantities, "with my production I am able to educate my son", he says.  However, he would like to buy a small house in the city of Ica so he can be close to his son, and there he plans to open a grocery store.  He belongs to the communal bank "Trabajemos unidos" and this is his fifth loan through MFP.  He is grateful for the support he has received all this time, which has helped him attain success and happiness.

Carlos plans to use the loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer which he will use on his future "yungay" and "unica" potato varieties.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Doña Vicenta R. S., tiene 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos, 3 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración de canastas de plastico, lleva 6 años de experiencia en este oficio, cuenta con el epoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la artesanía también a la satreria y la confección de tejidos.

Deciden solicitar un prèstamos para compra de terreno, el préstamo será para ajustar el precio que tendrá el predio que van a adquir, lo cual no dudan que es una inversión rentable. Ya que de esta forma de incrementar su patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Doña Vicenta R. S., age 46, did not have the opportunity to get an education.  She has five children, three of which are in school.  She makes plastic baskets for a living and has been in this business for six years.  Her husband, who produces fabric and is a tailor, also helps her with her craft.

They decided to request a loan to purchase land.  The loan will be used to adjust the price for the property they buy, which they believe will be a profitable investment.  They hope to increase their family assets in this manner.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; es  conviviente, la socia tiene 24 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de (6, 1) años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, la socia tiene sus terrenos de cultivo, ella produce maíz, papa, cebolla, verduras y también tiene ganados, la socia se dedica desde muy niña a la agricultura actividad que sus padres le enseñaron muy bien. La socia ahora desea invertir el préstamo solicitado en la compra de semillas, abono para una nueva siembra. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para un nuevo cultivo de tierras.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA” community bank. This bank is located in the town of en Oropesa, province of Quispicanchis and  departament de Cuzco.

This member's name is Ana. She is in a common law marriage and is 24 years old. She has 2 children, aged 6 and 1. She alternates between her household duties and farming. She has her crops, which produce corn, potatoes, onions, and vegetables. She also has cattle. She has worked in agriculture since she was very young and her parents taught her very well. Ana wants to invest the loan she asked for in buying seed for new plantings. 

Ana is very grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments on the in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to invest in buying seeds for new crops.

loans.name: Reymundo Ricardo

texts.es:
Reymundo de oficio zapatero, con más de veintiún años, dando sus servicios, a sus clientes, que gracias a las experiencias ha logrado la captación de sus clientes, a si como las mejoras  a su negocio ya que, no solo repara zapatos, también hace. y gracias a Dios día a día le llega trabajo.
Ha invertido en su negocio y en mejoras a su vivienda con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado mediante el préstamo, lo que está contento por lograr el objetivo para un bienestar familiar.
Con este nuevo préstamo hará una cera y reparación del techo, el cual cambiara catorce laminas de zinc, compra de madera, cemento, bloques, arena para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Reymundo is a shoemaker by trade, with more than twenty one years experience offering his services to his customers. He has been able to build up a customer base and improve his business where he not only repairs shoes, but makes them. Thank God, he gets work day to day. He has invested in his business and in home improvement with the loan that Afodenic has given him. He is happy to achieve his goal for his family's wellbeing. 

With this new loan, he will make a sidewalk and repair the roof, where he will replace fourteen zinc sheets. He will buy wood, cement, blocks, and sand to start the work.

loans.use: to invest in home improvement, in building a sidewalk, and putting on a new roof.

loans.name: Florentin

texts.es:
Florentín, reside San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 21 y 23 años de edad, es agricultor, siembra maíz y frijol, desde hace 25 años, aprendió el oficio de su padre, trabaja todos los días en las actividades agrícolas.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, esta compra le ayudara a adquirir todo lo necesario para realizar su labor agrícola.
Su objetivo es continuar trabajando, apoyar a su familia para sacarlos adelante, que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Florentín resides in San Rafael Oriente in the Department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 21 and 23.

Florentín is a farmer who grows corn and beans. He has been working for 25 years and learned this trade from his father. Florentín works every day in his farming activities.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for cultivating corn and beans. This purchase will help him acquire everything he needs for his farm work. His goals are to continue working, help his family get ahead, and see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Carlota Irma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota; es  casada, la socia tiene 65 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos  y todos ellos son independientes, la socia alterna sus actividades frecuentes del hogar con la elaboración y venta de panes, ella vende en el paradero principal, aprovechando que esta carretera lleva a la ciudad de Arequipa y Puno, y antes de llegar a estas ciudades hay pueblitos pequeños que también paran para adquirir sus panes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de panes.


La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Carlota, age 65, is married and has three children who are already independent. She is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; the bank is located in the Oropesa settlement of the Quispicanchis province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Carlota divides her time between her household work and her business of baking and selling bread. She sells her products at the main bus stop, taking advantage of the fact that this road goes to the cities of Arequipa and Puno, and on the way there are various small towns whose residents also make a stop to purchase their bread. Carlota is seeking a loan to purchase supplies for baking bread. She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase bakery supplies

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora L. tiene 58 años, su negocio es la compra y venta de ropa. Tiene más de 12 años en este medio de vida. Inicio este negocio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos que diariamente tiene en su hogar. La mayoría de sus clientes son personas jóvenes que le solicitan una gran variedad de productos.  Ella siempre sale a vender sus productos pues tiene que realizar ciertos recorridos muy extensos ya que la mayoría de sus clientes les gusta que Teodora los visite. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes y ropa para niños.
texts.en: Teodora L. is 58 years old.  Her business is buying and selling clothes.  She has been in this line of work for more than 12 years.  She started her business because she needed to cover her daily household expenses.  Most of her customers are young people who ask her for a wide variety of products.  She is always going out to sell her products.  She has to cover some very lengthy routes as most of her customers like her to visit them.  Teodora would like this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and children's clothes

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es una persona muy responsable y creativa, es originaria de la poblacion de Melchor Ocampo. Ella se dedica hacer bordados artesanales hace costuras como servilletas, almohadones, carpetas, manteles, dice que desde muy pequeña su mamá le enseño hacer ese tipo de costuras, ella las vende en las localidades aledañas a su población como Angangueo y en la ciudad de Zitacuaro, con el préstamo comenta que comprara marquice, agujas, ganchos, hilos de diferentes colores, tela etc. Ella esta casada con el señor Servando el cual es taxista y tienen 3 hijos estudiantes de secundaria y primaria. La meta que tiene la señora Guadalupe es hacer crecer su negocio poner un puesto en el tianguis de su localidad o poner una mesita fuera de su casa y ofrecerlas a las personas que pasan por su casa. Guadalupe esta agradecida con la financiera porque con este prestamo podra comprar un poco mas de material para hacer un poco mas de sus costuras artesanales.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a very responsible and creative person.  She is originally from the town of Melchor Ocampo.  Guadalupe embroiders products by hand.  She makes napkins, pillow cases, place mats and tablecloths.  She tells us that when she was very young her mom taught her how to do this type of work.  She sells her products in neighboring towns such as Angangueo and in the city of Zitacuaro.  She tells us that she will use her loan to buy material, needles, hooks, different colored threads, fabric, etc.

Guadalupe is married to Servando, who is a taxi driver, and they have three children who are attending high school and elementary school.  Guadalupe's goal is to grow her business and to either set up a stall in the street market in her town or set up a small table outside her home so that she can offer her products to people who pass by her house.  Guadalupe is grateful to Fundación Realidad because this loan will enable her to buy a little more material so that she can do a little more embroidery work.

loans.use: to make embroidered products to sell

loans.name: Jose Aquilino

texts.es:
José, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 3 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 7 años, aprendió de su padre el proceso de la siembra, trabaja todos los días de la semana y actualmente está iniciando la preparación del terreno,  para la milpa de este año.
El solicita un préstamo para compra abono y fertilizantes, esta inversión le ayudara para tener completo los materiales para el cultivo.
Su objetivo es tener trabajo para ayudar a su esposa y a su hijo, también cubrir todo lo que demande el hogar.
texts.en:
José resides in San Rafael Oriente in the Department of San Miguel. He is a farmer and lives with his wife and three-year-old son. José has been farming for seven years and learned the process of planting from his father. He works every day of the week and is currently preparing his land for this year’s crop of corn.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy compost and fertilizers. This investment will help to complete the materials needed for cultivation. His goal is to have work so that he can help his wife and son, as well as cover all of the household demands.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA D. OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado D. Oropesa,  provincia D. Quispicanchis y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; es  viuda; la socia tiene 58 años D. edad; la socia tiene 4 hijos los cuales son ya independientes, la socia tiene un pequeño kiosco D. venta D. golosinas y pasteles en el colegio D. la comuna, la socia elabora tortas y sándwich, ella también hace gelatinas, pasteles, jugos y refrescos. La socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra D. productos para implementar el kiosco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. golosinas y otros para el kiosco.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Estrella D. Oropesa” which is located in the village of Oropesa in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 58 years old, widowed, and has four children who are already independent. Guillermina has a small kiosk at the local school where she sells candy and pastries. She also makes cakes, sandwiches, gelatin, juices, and soft drinks. Guillermina needs a loan to invest in the purchase of products for her kiosk. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy candy and other products to restock her kiosk.

Guillermina is extremely grateful for this loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase candy and other food products.

loans.name: Juntos Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS POR EL PROGRESO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a L. provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

L. socia es L. Sra. Natalia; elL. es casada y tiene 40 años y tiene 4 hijos; L. socia trabaja con su negocio D. venta D. ropa, elL. venD. ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y trae D. L. ciudad D. Lima y también venD. zapatos en forma independiente, por medio D. este negocio L. socia saca adelante a sus hijos, L. socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. ropa y D. zapatos. L. socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como zapatos, polos, blusas y pantalones al por mayor.


Los otros socios  se dedican a L. venta D. habas saladas, tienda D. plastiqueria, venta D. cds, negocio D. carpintería metalica y venta D. huevos.


L. socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Juntos Por El Progreso” (Together for Progress) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

Sra. Natalia is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She works at her business selling clothes. Natalia offers clothing for women, men, and children and brings in her merchandise from the city of Lima. She also sells shoes as an independent merchant. Through this business, Natalia has been able to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand and improve her business of selling clothes and shoes. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as shoes, polo shirts, blouses, and trousers in bulk.

The other members sell salad beans, manage a plastics store, sell CDs, engage in metal work, and sell eggs.

Sra. Natalia is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, polo shirts, blouses, and trousers in bulk.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 26 y 28 años de edad, él trabaja desde hace muchos años, aprendió de su padre y hoy día realiza sus propios cultivos, para mantener a su familia.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, ya que son parte importante para sembrar el maíz, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para iniciar bien los cultivos.
Gerardo quiere mantenerse en el negocio de la comercialización de maíz, por lo que se esmera todos los años a realizar una buena siembra y tener una buena cosecha y abúndate.
texts.en:
Gerardo resides in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. He grows corn and raises cattle. Gerardo lives with his wife and two children, ages 26 and 28. He has worked for many years and learned his trade from his father. Today he has his own farmland that helps to support his family.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, which are an important component for growing corn. The funds will be a great help to getting his crop off to a good start.

Gerardo wants to maintain his business of selling corn, so he strives every year to produce a good crop and have a successful and abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 52 años, es una mujer simpática. Ella cuenta que hace 15 años se divorció de su esposo Humberto, con quien tuvo 7 hijos, de los cuales ahora solo vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca. Hace no menos de 14 años que se dedica a la producción de papa, arveja, y maíz. Los cuales se ubican en terrenos amplios en la zona alta de su localidad. Asimismo cuenta que siempre fue independiente, pues también se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de papa y verduras. Los cuales compra a un menor precio a los agricultores de la ciudad de Tarma, donde abundan estos productos; para luego viajar cada 8 días a la ciudad de Chanchamayo (selva central peruana), vendiendo en el mercado modelo de la ciudad a un mayor precio, pues no crecen en esta zona del país. Su principal preocupación son los gastos de educación, vestimenta y alimentación de sus hijos, donde invierte la mayor parte de sus ganancias. Pero no se amilana y sigue trabajando con mucho esmero, ya que sus planes son llevar cantidades de hortalizas, para la capital “Lima”, donde podrá ampliar sus ventas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, ya que constantemente realizan charlas educativas que le estimulan a mejor su calidad de vida. María, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de verduras para su negocio, asimismo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir en sus cultivos de arvejas.
texts.en:
Maria is 52 years old and is a friendly woman.  She’s been divorced from her husband, Humberto, for 15 years and has seven children, but only three of them still live with her.  Her home is located in the Villa Visca settlement.  She’s been raising potatoes, peas, and corn on land within her zone, for the past 14 years or so.  In this way she’s always been independent.  She also buys and sells potatoes and vegetables from farmers in Tarma, where there is plenty of product, and then travels to Chanchamayo every week (Central Peruvean Jungle) and sells them at the main marketplace.  These things will not grow in that part of the country.  Her main concerns are tuition, clothing, and food for her children.  Here is where she spends most of her income, but she is not discouraged and continues to work with great hope.  She plans to take large quantities of crops to the capital city, Lima, where she can expand her sales.

She is part of the “Villa Visca” communal bank and this will be her seventh loan through MFP, where she feels fulfilled because they often hold educational talks and this helps improve her quality of life.

She will use the money from this loan to buy vegetables for her business.  She will also buy various sacks of fertilizers to spread on her crop of peas.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofia; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos nutricionales, la socia vende en forma independiente y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos nutricionales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos nutricionales al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sofia, age 49, is married and has one son. She is a member of the communal bank  “LOS ANGELES”; the bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Sofia divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling nutritional products. She works as an independent saleswoman and this business provides her with the means to raise her son. Sofia would like to expand her sales business and is seeking a loan in order to purchase nutritional products from a wholesaler. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase nutritional products

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria, es casada; la socia tiene 50 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos los cuales son ya independientes, la socia se dedica a la elaboración de gallardetes ella borda a mano todo tipo de pedidos que le hagan la socia realiza estantes, estandartes, capas para los santos y las vírgenes con hilo de oro, estandartes, insignias, banderas y disfraces para bailes típicos con atuendos llamativos y bordados a mano y a todo color. La socia es muy conocida en el pueblo y su fama a trascendido la región, ella desea ahora el crédito para poder abastecer su taller de bordado y comprar hilos, gemas y todos los materiales para elaborar sus pedidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus bordados a pedido.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Virgen Estrella de Oropesa" community bank which is located in the town of Oropesa, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Maria is 50 years old, married, and has three children who are grown up and live independently.  Maria makes pennants.  People place orders with her for different products and she embroiders them by hand.  She makes banners, capes with gold thread for celebrating saints and virgins, standards, flags and costumes for traditional dances, striking outfits which are embroidered by hand and made in all different colors.

Maria is very well known in her village and her fame has spread beyond her region.  She would like this loan so that she can stock her embroidery workshop and buy threads, gems and all the materials she needs to fill her orders.

Maria is requesting this loan to invest in buying materials for making her embroidered products to order.  She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for making her embroidered products to order

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite entre otros productos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 54, is married and has five children. She is a member of the communal bank “LOS ANGELES”; the bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Marcelina divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, cooking oil, and others. Marcelina would like to expand her grocery store and is seeking a loan in order to purchase store supplies from a wholesaler. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase grocery store supplies wholesale

loans.name: Transito Edenilson

texts.es:
Transito, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y crianza de ganado, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta labor,  trabaja todos los días de la semana y su padre fue quien le enseño el proceso, él vive con sus padres, es soltero y no tiene hijos.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, ya que para iniciar el proceso de la siembra debe tener a disponibilidad estos materiales.
Su objetivo es tener esta fuente de ingreso por un largo tiempo para ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Transito lives in "El Transito", in the department of San Miguel, and grows corn and raises livestock for a living.  He has been in this business for 10 years and works every day of the week.  His father was the one who taught him the trade.  He lives with his parents and is single, with no children.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer because he has already begun the planting process and needs the supplies available.  His goal is to have a strong source of income for a long period of time to help his parents.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, ella vende papa en el mercado de San Sebastian, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LOS ANGELES", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Gregoria, age 28, is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling potatoes.  She sell them in the San Sebastian market where she works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  Through her business she has been able to care for her children.  She wants to increase her potato sales and plans to use the loan to buy wholesale potatoes.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes and to strengthen a new area in which she is working - hiring out table linen. Her loan will allow her to incorporate working capital into her business in order to improve her customer service

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA D. OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado D. Oropesa,  provincia D. Quispicanchis y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria, es casada; la socia tiene 54 años D. edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos dos D. los cuales son ya independientes, y la otra D. sus hijas tiene 20 años, la socia se dedica a la administración y atención D. su tienda D. abarrotes, la socia desea implementar su negocio ella requiere el dinero para invertir en la compra D. mercadería tales como son harina, fideos, azúcar, arroz, leche y todo al por mayor para así poder vender al por menor y adquirir una ganancia significativa. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería. 

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN ESTRELLA D. OROPESA" which is located in the village of Oropesa, province of Quispicanchis, in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Victoria, age 54, is married and has three children, two of which are already independent and another daughter who is 20.  

Victoria owns and manages a grocery store which she wants to improve by buying goods wholesasle such as flour, pasta, sugar, rice and milk.  Selling them retail would give her significant earnings.  She has requested the loan to buy these items.

She is very grateful for the loan and commited to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale goods

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lida; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende verduras como tomates, cebollas, zanahorias, pepinos entre otras verduras, la socia vende las verduras en forma independiente llevando a lugares como huaypetu que queda en la selva de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This client, Mrs Lida, is a member of the communal bank "Los Angeles", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco. She is 40 years old and has one child. She alternatives her daily activities with sales of vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, carrots and peppers. She sells these vegetables on her own, traveling to areas such as Huaypetu in the tropical region near the city of Cusco. She uses the revenues from this business to provide for her child, and is hoping to increase her volume of sales through this loan. She is looking forward to receiving this loan and promises to adhere to the loan repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, vive en compañía de su esposa y tres hijos de 6, 9 y 12 años de edad, el señor Marcelino se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comenzó hace 20 años, trabaja todos los días y más que todo en tiempo de siembra.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes, pues inicia el invierno y es el tiempo propicio para iniciar el cultivo, este préstamo le ayudara muchísimo a tener todo lo necesario.
El objetivo de Marcelino es mantenerse con este trabajo, ayudar a su familia y que sus hijos se formen académicamente.
texts.en: Marcelino lives in the El Transito department of San Miguel, El Salvador. He is a farmer, and lives with his wife and three children aged 6, 9 and 12. For the past 20 years, he has been dedicated to cultivating and selling corn and kidney beans, working every day and more than just during sowing season. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase fertilizer in order to begin cultivating these crops during the Winter season. This loan would tremendously help him in accomplishing this. Marcelino's objective is to continue with this work, and help his family by providing for the eduction of his children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Jorge Fructuoso

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge Fructuoso; el tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller de carpintería metalica, el realiza trabajos en puertas, ventanas, techos entre otros trabajos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de carpintería metalica.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los trabajos como metal y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs the “LOS ANGELES” communal bank. This bank is located in the Cusco district, in the Cusco province and department.

The member’s name is Jorge Fructuoso. He is 40 years old, lives with his partner and he has four children. He alternates his daily activities with a metalwork workshop. He works on doors, windows and roofs along with other projects. Jorge wants to expand his metalwork business. He is requesting a loan to purchase materials for his work like metal and tools. 

The member is happy about this loan and he promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his work like metal and tools

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel, es conviviente; la socia tiene 32 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 7 meses, la socia se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y ceviches, la socia elabora estos potajes e su casa, ella hace el recado correspondiente y lo lleva en su carreta a vender a la plaza principal o al a carretera para esto ella requiere comprar insumos, tales como para la salchipapa, pasa para freír, sal, aceite, y salchichas, también cremas para acompañar al plato, para el ceviche que vende por las mañanas y tardes compra pescado fresco, lo limpia pica y acompaña con cebollas, limón y otros ingredientes y también los lleva a vender; la socia requiere l préstamo para comprar los diferentes insumos para los diferentes paltos. La socia solicita el préstamo para la elaboración de sus platillos.


La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the "Virgen Estrella de Oropesa" community bank which is located in the village of Oropesa, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Maribel is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children aged 4 and 7 months.  Maribel sells salchipapas (sliced, fried sausage and potatoes) and 'ceviches' (fish marinated in citrus juice).  She makes these meals at home and then takes them on her cart to sell in the main square or on the main road.  To do this, she needs to buy supplies such as (for the salchipapa) potatoes, salt, oil and sausages, and also creams to accompany the dish.  For the ceviche that she sells in the mornings and afternoons, she needs to buy fresh fish which she cleans, chops up and serves with onions, lemon and other ingredients.

Maribel needs this loan to buy the different ingredients for making her different dishes.  She is requesting this loan to make her meals.  She is grateful to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to make her dishes

loans.name: Omar Roman

texts.es:
Omar es un hombre trabajador, con su propio negocio, en su casa de habitación, una pulpería que logro poner hace nueve años, el cual trabaja junto a su esposa.
Y que  junto  han logrado el bienestar para sus cinco hijos mediante la educación. Con el crédito anterior desvió el crédito, y lo invirtió en la pulpería, ya que las ventas estaban bajas y logro aumentar el inventario para mejorar sus ventas y equilibrar sus gastos.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo podrá mejorar el techo de su vivienda el cual espera terminar esta mejora, ya que las reglas están en mal estado, a si como el zinc. Contento por poder optar al financiamiento el cual es de gran beneficio a pagar en plazos.
texts.en:
Omar is a hard-working man with his own business - a grocery store - which is located in his home.  He set up his business nine years ago and runs it together with his wife.

Together, Omar and his wife have managed to look out for their five children's well-being, providing them with an education.  Omar invested his previous loan in his grocery store since his sales were low.  He managed to increase his inventory, improve his sales and balance his expenses.

Omar will use this new loan to improve the roof in his home.  He hopes to finish off this improvement since the beams and metal sheeting are in a bad state of repair.  He is happy to receive this loan.  It is a great help to him to be able to pay in instalments.

loans.use: to buy sheets of corrugated metal and wood to replace his roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delfina, es casada; la socia tiene 54 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ella solo vive con uno de 13 años, ala socia tiene un negocio independiente ella al igual que su prima tiene un negocio de comidas caseras, la socia vende ceviches y comidas caseras de forma independiente en la plaza principal y por las tardes en la carretera, la socia luego de elaborar sus potajes se va en su carreta a vender y cuando termina se va a casa, ella también desea a futuro tener un restaurante y poder implementarlo y que se haga conocido y le vaya muy bien para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Delfina is part of “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” communal bank, located in the Oropesa village and in the Quispicanchis province of Cusco department.  She is married and is 54 years old.  Delfina has two children of which only the 13 year old lives with her.  

She has her own business, just like her cousin who has a business selling home made food.  Delfina independently sells ceviches and home made food in the main plaza, and on the road in the afternoon.  Having made her vegetable stews, she goes out with her cart to sell, and when she finishes she goes home.

In the future, Delfina would also like to have a restaurant, to be able to set it up and have it become well-known.  She would like things go very well for her so that she can give her children a better quality of life.  

Delfina asks for this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of supplies.  She is very grateful for the loan and commits to completing the loan payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of supplies.

loans.name: Delcy

texts.es: Delcy, de 23 años es una trabajadora madre soltera. A pesar de su corta edad, tiene muchos objetivos, pues su motivación es su hijo Renzo, al que cuida en un cuarto que alquila en el caserío de Villa Visca. Desde hace 2 años, comenzó a sembrar papa, alverja y maíz en terrenos arrendados que se ubican a las afueras de su localidad. Todas las mañanas en compañía de su pequeño Renzo se dirige a cuidar de sus cultivos, donde encuentra paz y las fuerzas para salir adelante, sabe que el camino por la agricultura es muy difícil pues no tiene apoyo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder sacar la maleza que crece entre sus cultivos. “Gracias a Dios, tengo habilidad en la comercialización de mis cosechas. Obtengo buenas ganancias en la venta a los mayoristas del mercado de Tarma”, afirma.  Su principal dificultad es no contar con un capital de trabajo, “con el tiempo y las buenas dediciones lo lograré”, menciona con una sonrisa en el rostro. Por ahora sus planes son adquirir un terreno agrícola propio para que pueda obtener mayores ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera lograr sus objetivos. Delcy, muy pronto cosechará papa de la variedad “única” y “amarilis”, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizante natural, para esparcirlo en su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Delcy is 23 years old and is a hardworking single mother.  Despite her young age, she has many goals.  Her son Renzo, whom she cares for in her rented room in the Villa Visca settlement, is her motivation.  Two years ago she began raising potatoes, peas, and corn on rented land located on the outskirts of her area.  Every morning, in company of her little Renzo, she goes out to care for her crops.  Here she finds peace and the strength to get ahead.  She knows that the farming path is very difficult, but she has no other means of support.

What she enjoys most about her work is being able to remove the weeds from among her crops.  “Thanks to God, I am able to sell my harvest.  I have good earnings by selling to the wholesalers in the Tarma markets,” she says.  Her main challenge is not having any working capital.  “Eventually and with dedication, I will achieve this,” as she says with a smile on her face.  For now her plans are to acquire some farmland of her own so that she can obtain better earnings.

She is part of the “Villa Visca” communal bank and this will be her first loan through MFP, which she expects will help her meet her goals.

Delcy will harvest her potatoes soon.  She will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of organic and natural fertilizer to spread on her next crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Dominga Antonieta

texts.es:
Doña Dominga Antonieta C. G., tiene 40 años de edad, tiene un hijo que no esta estudiando, estudio sus estudios primarios, tiene un hijo que no esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio y a la tejeduria, en la tejeduria lleva 10 años de experiencia, a sido este su trabajo desde que inció.

Solicita un préstamo a ASDIR para compra de hilo que les servirá para elaborar mas tejido de todo tipo, ya que elabora servilletas, fajas, cortes, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio aun mas grande y con mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Dominga Antonieta C. G. is 40 years old. She has one son who is not in school, he completed primary school. Doña Dominga weaves and sells the pieces she makes. She has ten years of experience weaving, this has been her job since she started weaving. 

She is asking for a loan from ASDIR to buy the thread that she uses to make all kinds of fabrics, for example napkins, belts, shorts, etc. Her hopes for the future are to have a bigger business with a larger income.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Juvenal Antonio

texts.es:
A sus 43 años de edad y después de separarse de su esposa y quedar a cargo de sus hijos, Juvenal Antonio B. a sus 43 años y conociendo desde pequeño las labores propias del campo, este campesino emprendedor aprovechando sus conocimientos y debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales y su poca escolaridad, decidió convertir su pequeña finca en un negocio que le permitiera generar ingresos para que en el futuro sus hijas puedan asistir a la Universidad, ilusión que expresa con gran felicidad en su rostro. 

Café, cítricos y mango, son algunos de los cultivos que este emprendedor tiene en su finca, así como la cría y engorde de ganado, lo que hace que su situación sea más llevadera y que el sueño de educar a sus hijas sea posible. 

Los cambios climáticos y el fuerte invierno por el que atraviesa el país son algunas de las dificultades que este luchador enfrenta. Actualmente, Juvenal necesita de un préstamo para comprar dos vacas lecheras que le permitan incrementar sus ingresos y diversificar hacia otro aspecto del campo con el que considera mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juvenal Antonio B. is 43 years old, separated from his wife and responsible for their children.  Since he was a young child he has been no stranger to farm work.  This enterprising farmer is taking advantage of his knowledge. Due to the lack of work opportunities and education he decided to convert his small farm into a business that will allow him to generate income and thereby, allow him to send his daughters to college.  One can see this optimism expressed as immense happiness on his face.  
 
He grows coffee, citrus and mangoes on his farm as well as raising and fattening livestock, which makes their situation more tolerable and makes his dream of educating his daughters possible.  Changes in the weather and the harsh winters here are some of the difficulties he faces.  Currently, Juvenal needs a loan to buy two milking cows that will help him to increase his income and expand into other areas of farming.  This will help him improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase two milking cows.

loans.name: La Beneficiencia 2, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Silvenie is the group coordinator of L. Beneficiencia 2, 4 & 5 (Beneficence),  which is maD. up of fifteen micro-entrepreneurs. She said that her most difficult challenge is to improve her business.

Silvenie operates a "colmado", a grocery store, where most of her neighbors buy their daily meals. She will use the loan to purchase many items like rice, sugar, cooking oil, canned meal, vegetables, flour, etc. to increase her business inventory. She is excited to receive her 7th loan with Esperanza, as with each loan she has been able to make good investments in her business.

Silvenie represents women who decided to start small businesses to supplement the insufficient incomes their households receive. She started her business when she received her first Esperanza loan, almost four years ago. This group is located in the city of San Pedro D. Macoris, in one of the rural villages surrounding the main city. She enjoys attending church and working in her grocery store.

She thanks all of you for your support to her business and her group.

This group has two photos because there were too many to be in just one, and we tried to have the most visible faces by having two photos.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, canned meal, vegetables, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing to stock her store.

loans.name: Martha Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Martha Alejandra S. es madre de tres hijos uno ya mayor de edad, el mediano estudiante de preparatoria y uno pequeño de 8 años lo cual lleva muchos gastos escolares, Ella trabaja como cocinera en una guardería y  para obtener más ingresos vende  ropa usada en una de las colonias de esta misma ciudad donde ya varios comerciantes se instalan para ofrecer variedad de producto, pero este lugar se encuentra retirado de la casa de Martha y por el momento no cuenta con automóvil propio para trasladar la mercancía lo cual le esta afectando en su economía. 
A Martha se le esta presentando la oportunidad de comprar una camioneta a un precio muy accesible por lo cual solicita de capital para que su ingresos incremente y de esta manera ofrecer a sus una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha Alejandra S. is the mother of three children, one adult, one a high school student, and one eight year old with many school expenses.  She works as a cook in a day care center and, in order to earn extra money, she also sells second hand clothing in an area of town where lots of salespeople set up.  This area is far from her home and she doesn’t have her own car to transport her merchandise.  This is affecting her financially.

Martha has the opportunity to buy a van at a good price, so she is requesting this loan.  This will allow her to increase her income and be able to provide a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a van for her business

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
Su amor por los animales, su origen campesino y sus deseos de ofrecerle una mejor calidad a sus dos hijos impulsaron a Adriana María Gutiérrez a crear su propio negocio, una cría de cerdos que se ha convertido en una fuente de ingresos para la familia. 

A sus 35 años de edad, Adriana sueña con tener su casa propia y poder construir un criadero grande que le permita mantener más cerdos y aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente, Adriana necesita de un préstamo para adecuar el corral de los cerdos y comprar otro de estos animalitos con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos. 

Humilde, sencilla y trabajadora, así es como se define esta campesina emprendedora que espera hacer su sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Her love of animals, her country origin, and her desire to offer a better quality of life to her two children inspired Adriana María Gutiérrez to create her own business raising hogs.  This has become a source of income for her family.

At 35, Adriana dreams of having her own home and being able to build a large farm where she can keep more hogs and increase her income and quality of life.

She needs a loan to acquire a pig pen and another hog.

Humble, simple and hardworking is how we can describe this enterprising country girl who hopes to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy a hog and a pen

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Desde Hace 10 años la hija de Gloria decidió montar una papelería con ayuda de su madre, para así mejorar la economía de su casa y generar ingresos mientras ella estaba en la universidad, sin embargo los horarios no le permitían estar pendiente del negocio por lo que su madre, Gloria del Carmen P. se apropió del negocio para hacerlo crecer y poco a poco e ir generando más ingresos para su familia, con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y aportar a los gastos del hogar y a cubrir los altos costos de la Universidad en la que continuaba estudiando su hija.

Si bien es cierto que una papelería es un buen negocio, Gloria es consciente que en temporada de vacaciones sus ventas son muy pocas, por lo que a medida del tiempo ha incrementado la variedad de productos, actualmente vende también, accesorios de dama, dulces, helados y un poco de ropa. 

Su propósito es poder comprar calzado y poco a poco seguir creciendo pues también espera generar empleo y así aportar a la comunidad, sin embargo, el capital es mucho para ella ya que no posee la cantidad necesaria y por ello necesita de un préstamo.
texts.en:
Ten years ago, Gloria’s daughter decided to open a paper goods store, with the help of her mother, in order to improve the financial situation in her home, and generate an income while she was in university.  Never the less, the schedules did not allow her to attend to her business, so her mother, Gloria del Carmen P., appropriated the business in order to grow it little by little, and to generate more income for the family.  She wanted to improve the family’s quality of life, pay the household expenses, and cover the high cost of her daughter’s university tuition.

It turns out that a paper goods store is a good business.  Gloria is aware that sales are low during vacation times, and so she has increased the variety of products.  Now she also sells ladies’ accessories, candy, ice cream, and some clothing.

She wants to begin buying shoes in order to grow her business a little at a time.  She also hopes to create some jobs and in this way support the community.  Never the less she does not have enough working capital, so she needs this loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes to grow her business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es: Felicia, D. 55 años es una mujer sencilla y luchadora. Se separó desD. hace 15 años con su esposo; quedando sola al cuidado D. sus 8 hijos, a los que sacó adelante. Ahora vive con su hija Isabel, D. 15 años. En su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Villa Visca. DesD. que su esposo la dejó; aprendió a valerse por si misma. Por ello comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura, poniendo en práctica las enseñanzas que sus padres le dieron. Sus principales sembríos constan D. arveja, papa, maíz, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero. “Es mi única distracción, no tengo televisión ni energía eléctrica”, afirma. Asimismo señala que se dedica al lavado D. ropa, donD. le pagan D. acuerdo a la cantidad D. ropa lavada. “Lavando ropa saque adelante a mis hijos”, menciona con orgullo. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es poder ver crecer sus cultivos, ya que es símbolo D. una buena negociación con los proveedores del mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. comercializa sus cosechas. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha D. arveja, que muy pronto dará fruto. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donD. le enseñaron a salir adelante para el desarrollo D. su familia. Felicia, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono orgánico; que le servirán para la siembra D. papa que comenzará dentro D. estos meses, con el apoyo D. una socia que brindará terreno y semilla.
texts.en:
Felicia, 55, is an unassuming, hard working woman.  She’s been separated from her husband for the last 15 years and caring for her 8 children by herself; she’s raised them all.  She now lives with her daughter, Isabel, 15, in her own house located in the hamlet of Villa Visca.  

Since her husband left her she learned how to get ahead on her own.  She started our working in farming putting into practice the skills her parents taught her.  Her main crops are peas, potatoes and corn which she cares for very diligently.  “It’s my only distraction; I don’t own a television set or even have electricity,” she affirms.  She also states that she’s been taking in laundry where she’s paid according to the amount of clothes washed.  “I supported my children washing clothes,” she mentions proudly.  What she likes best about her work is being able to see her crops grow because that’s a symbol of the good negotiations with wholesalers in Tarma’s market where she sells her crops.  She is currently getting ready for the pea harvest which will soon bear fruit.

She is a member of the “Villa Visca” communal bank and this is the tenth loan with MFP where she learned to get ahead for her family’s development.  Felicia will use the requested loan to buy several sacks of organic manure that will be used for the potato planting that will start within these months with support from another member who will proviD. the land and the seeds.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida, de 46 años, es una mujer soltera, alegre y con mucha vida. Ella vive junto a su mamá Romilda, de 70 años y su abuela Bernarda, de 94 años. A las que quiere mucho y cuida con amor en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca. Desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra y ha dedicar la mayor parte de su vida a ella. Pero el apoyo de su madre le sirvió para realizar estudios de pedagogía, ahora se dedica a la enseñanza de niños memores de 6 años, en una escuela del estado. Pero su mayor pasión es la siembra de papa y arveja en sus 15 hectáreas de terreno agrícola que posee. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son los momentos que dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos, ya que su trabajo como profesora le impide poder dedicar el tiempo completo; “para ello contrato peones que limpian la maleza y fertilizan constantemente”, asegura. Además cuenta que hace poco incursiono en la crianza de cuyes, con lo que podrá obtener un dinero extra. Su principal preocupación es su mamá y abuela, ya que requieren un cuidado especial por su edad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad de integrar a una asociación respetada y querida. Aida, invertirá el crédito  solicitado en la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja, asimismo en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Aida is 46 years old and is a happy single lady full of life.  She lives with her mother, 70 year old Romilda, and her 94 year old grandmother, Bernalda.  She loves them very much and gently cares for the home, located in the Villa Visca settlement.

She learned to work the land when she was very young and had dedicated a good portion of her life to it, but thanks to her mother’s backing she was able to study to be a teacher and now teaches to six year old children at a public school.  Her greatest passion is still raising potatoes and peas on her 15 hectares of farmland.  What she enjoys most about her work is the time she spends caring for her crops, even though her work as a teacher prevents her from doing it fulltime.  “For that I count on field hands who take care of the weeds and fertilize regularly.”  She also tells us that she recently began raising Guinea pigs so that she could earn extra money.  Her main concerns are her mother and grandmother who require special care because of their ages.

She is a member of the “Villa Visca” communal bank.  This will be her second loan through MFP, and she is grateful for the opportunity to be part of this respected and admired group.  Aida will use the money from this loan to buy three bags of pea seed and some sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, footwear, clothing in general, lotions, creams and hair treatments.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Durante 6 años, Luz Dary P. trabajó con una amiga en la venta de mercancía, lo que le permitía contribuir a cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues con lo que su esposo gana no era suficiente para abastecer dichos gastos. 

Desde hace algún tiempo y motivada con la ilusión de tener un gran almacén que les genere buenos ingresos a la familia, Luz Dary decidió montar su propio negocio, allí trabaja de domingo a domingo y aunque es un gran esfuerzo esta emprendedora de 43 años de edad considera que este es el camino para alcanzar su sueño y mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente, Luz Dary necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido y pagar algunas deudas, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos. 

Luz Dary afirma que desde que trabaja se siente una parte importante del hogar, pues su aporte permite alivianar los gastos que mensualmente se generan.
texts.en:
For 6 years, Luz Dary Patino worked with a friend selling merchandise, and this allowed her to contribute toward the household expenses, since her husband's earnings were not sufficient to cover all of those expenses.

After some time, and motivated by the dream of having a large store that would generate good income for her family, Luz Dary decided to start up her own business.  Now she works there every day, and even though this takes great effort, this enterprising 43 year-old considers that this is the way for her to achieve her dream and improve her quality of life.

Now Luz Dary needs a loan to buy merchandise and pay off some debts, which will allow her to improve her earnings.

Luz Dary feels that her work makes an important contribution to the household, since she can cover some of the household's monthly expenses

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to pay off debts related to her business

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Valientes (Brave women) 1, located in the rural area surrounding La Romana. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Santa is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she sells chicken, pork and corn bread by purchasing various pounds of them. She will use the profits to buy a battery for her power generator, and to save to buy her own house. She said that her most difficult challenge is to travel, as she would like to visit other countries like Hawaii. Her future plans are to have her house and to travel to different countries.

She started doing her business almost two years ago with some money she saved, and she is taking Esperanza´s loan because they are comfortable to do business with. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy chicken, pork and corn to sell.

loans.name: Danilo Esteban

texts.es:
Danilo es un joven luchador que desde hace un año decidió montar su propio negocio después de haber vivido una tragedia familiar en la mina donde él y su padre trabajaban, y donde prometió no volver después de haber visto a su padre morir en este mismo lugar. Danilo es emprendedor y sueña con tener un almacén que sea reconocido por muchas personas en el municipio donde él vive ubicado en el departamento de Antioquia, convirtiéndolo en un legado que le dejará a su familia generación tras generación. 

Danilo trabaja 5 días a la semana con mucho empeño, le gusta atender bien a sus clientes y tener constantemente el negocio surtido para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que necesitan. Actualmente Danilo quiere ampliar de cierta manera su microempresa por lo que quiere invertir un capital que le permita comprar  mercancía a su negocio, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para cumplir sus metas, quiere así brindarle proyección al almacén, atraer más clientes e incrementar las ventas, igualmente generar mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Danilo is a determined young man who decided to set up his own business one year ago after having lived through a family tragedy in the mine where he and his father both worked.  He promised himself that he would not go back to the mine after having seen his father die there.  Danilo is an entrepreneur and he dreams of owning a store which will become well known by many people in the town where he lives, in Antioquia department.  He dreams of turning his business into a legacy that he will leave to his family to be handed down generation to generation.

Danilo works five days a week with a lot of determination.  He likes to serve his customers well and to constantly have his business stocked so that his customers can always find what they need.  Danilo would currently like to expand his small business and would like to invest capital which will allow him to buy more merchandise.  However, he doesn't have enough capital to achieve his goals.  In this way, he would like to broaden the reach of his store, attract more customers, increase his sales and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis Ángel se dedica a la venta de comida. Tiene más de 3 años en este negocio, pues siempre ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los ingresos de su hogar, ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una forma humilde. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras,   utensilios de cocina, leña entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Luis Ángel sells food.  He’s been in this business for more than three years and has always shown to be a responsible person.  He started this way of earning a living because he needed an income to pay the household expenses.  He’s always enjoyed working and earning a humble living.  He will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, kitchen utensils, firewood, and other things.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny forma parte del banco comunal “Visión al Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Coronel.
Ella se dedica a la repostería desde hace 6 años. Realiza sus productos desde su casa, preparando dulces, masas de pizza, picarones, facturitas, alfajores, queques, entre otros. Jenny vende sus productos los días viernes y domingos en un carro que traslada desde su casa al centro de la ciudad. Mientras que los días miércoles, vende sus productos a los trabajadores de un hospital y  la municipalidad de Coronel. Quienes son sus clientes frecuentes.
Su mercadería e ingredientes los compra en distribuidoras y un proveedor llega a su misma casa a vender mercadería. 
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería al por mayor, específicamente; harina, levadura, margarina, huevos, polvos royal y manjar, ya que así podrá trabajar con mayor tranquilidad, sin que le falten ingredientes para sus productos de repostería.
Sus metas son tener un local establecido, en el cual pueda realizar, ofrecer y vender sus productos.
Jenny vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 19 y 18 años de edad, ambos anhelan estudiar en la Universidad. 
Sus sueños son poder superarse en cuanto a su negocio, para generar mayores ganancias y así gozar de una mejor situación socioeconómica. Además de que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Ella está muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Además participa de las reuniones, con la esperanza de superarse.
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
Jenny is part of the “Visión al Futuro” communal bank in the city of Coronel.  She’s been making desserts at home for six years and makes candy, pizza dough, picarones, facturitas, alfajores, and cakes among other things.  Jenny sells her products on Fridays and Sundays from a cart that she takes from her home to the city center.  On Wednesdays she sells her products to the workers at a hospital and in Coronel.  They are her steady customers.  She buys her merchandise and ingredients from distributors and a supplier who goes to her home to sell.

She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients in large quantity, specifically flour, yeast, margarine, eggs, baking powder, and various delicacies.  In this way she can work calmly without worrying about running out of anything.  Her goals are to have a shop where she can make and sell her products.

Jenny lives with her husband and two children, ages 19 and 18, both of want to study at university.

Her dreams are to succeed in her business in order to earn more and enjoy a better financial situation.  She also wants her children to have professional careers.  She is very grateful for the loan through Fondo Esperanza, which will allow her to invest into her business and increase her earnings.  She also attends the meetings in hopes of being more successful.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Gladys Marcelina

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del  Banco Comunal “Dulce Amanecer”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, con grado de educación superior.  Es soltera  y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. 
La señora se dedica a la  venta de abarrotes y trabaja  con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace cinco años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio venta de abarrotes.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1300.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercadería al por mayor para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, leches, etc.
También nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de carros, es un negocio que lo realiza esporádicamente (alterno).  Ella trabaja sola.
Su sueño es tener una tienda mucho más grande y bien abastecida para generar más ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the “Dulce Amanecer” (Sweet Dawn) community bank which is located in Puno district and department.  She is 36 years old and completed her higher education.  She is single and has two school-age children.

Gladys sells groceries.  She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she used that money for her grocery business.

Gladys will use this new loan for 1,300 soles to buy merchandise wholesale for her store.  She will buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.  She tells us that she also sells cars.  It is a business that she carries out sporadically.  She works on her own.

Gladys' dream is to own a much bigger store which is well stocked so that she can make more income.  What Gladys likes about her community bank is the punctuality.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc. for her store (wholesale)

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
'Mujeres en Victoria 1 & 2' is a group comprised of ten women. Each member comes from an extremely poor area in Santo Domingo. Each member sees this as a chance to change their future and provide their families with a better life. 

Immacula is one of these members. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are already grown. Only the youngeS. is still living with her and her husband. With these loans Immacula hopes to inveS. in her Comedor - a little restaurant - where she sells lunch to her neighbors and people working around the community. 

This is Immacula´s third loan with Esperanza International. She has taken a step toward improving her business by investing every loan to expand her business, which has been operating ten years already, in order to serve her clients. She started taking loans from Esperanza almoS. two years ago, after the program went to her community and a group of five women decided to start this group. Her moS. difficult challenges are to have her business improve and to have a good house and a vehicle for work and family.

Thank you for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, soda, and juices.

loans.name: Irma Dora

texts.es:
Irma es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad,  cuenta con educación superior.  Irma es conviviente  y tiene tres hijos aún estudiando.
La señora  se dedica  a la venta de comidas al paso (salchipapas, sandwichs, dulcería), también cuenta que ofrece el servicio de llamadas telefónicas.  Trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de comidas al paso.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles,  comprará papas, gaseosas, gas, etc. 
En el negocio la ayuda su hermana ya que su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad.
Su sueño es tener un local por el centro y así mejorar sus ventas.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Community Bank “Las Retamas”, located in the district of Puno, in the Puno department and province.  She is 40 years old and has obtained a higher education. Irma is married and still has 3 children in school. 

She sells fast food (salchipapas: fried potatoes and fried sausage, sandwiches, and sweets) and also offers call-in orders.  She has worked with the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) Movement for 4 years.  Her first loan was 300 soles, money that she invested in her fast food business. 

With this new loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy potatoes, sodas, gas, etc.  Her sister helps her with the business since her husband works out of town. Her dream is to have a local spot in the central area and improve her sales.  What she likes most about the Community Bank is the simplicity of the loan.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, soft drinks, gas, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Ulises

texts.es:
Jorge, nació en Estelí, tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado, de oficio comerciante, solo estudio hasta sexto grado de primaria, es jefe de familia, cuida a su mama. Inicio a trabajar a los 13 años de edad como vendedor ambulante en los barrios de Estelí , desde tempranas horas salía a vender , a recorrer las calles buscando el alimento diario para el y su familia sin horario ni salario fijo , el se buscaba como ganar la vida vendiendo productos de uso popular , también vendió en las comarcas aledañas de Estelí , para entonces un pastor de una iglesia evangélica le ayudaba a vender  sus productos de ahí el adquirió la experiencia en ventas , aprendió a negociar precios. Actualmente es dueño de una pulpería la cual estableció con las ganancias que obtuvo de su trabajo anterior y préstamo que el ha hecho, lleva tres años y medio con su pulpería.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la pulpería, para comprar productos alimenticios como azúcar, arroz, aceite, caramelos  y también hacer recargas de minutos a celulares. Esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar su inventario, hacer nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ganancias. 
Tiene como meta poner una distribuidora de alimentos en el centro de la ciudad de Estelí y comprar su casa para darle un techo digno a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge was born in Estelí.  He is 42 years old, married, and works as a salesman.  He only studied up to the sixth grade of elementary school.

Jorge is the head of his household and cares for his mom.  He started working as an itinerant street vendor in the neighborhoods of Estelí at the age of 13.  He used to go out to sell his products from early in the morning.  He would walk through the streets looking to make enough money to feed himself and his family.  He didn't work regular hours or receive a fixed salary.  He looked for ways to earn a living selling basic household products.  He also sold his products in regions neighboring Estelí.  Back then, a minister from an evangelical church helped him to sell his products and that is where he gained his sales experience.  He learned how to negotiate prices.

Jorge is currently the owner of a grocery store which he set up with the profits that he made from his previous work and a loan that he took out.  He has been running his grocery store for three and a half years.  Jorge is requesting this loan to invest in his grocery store, so that he can buy food products such as sugar, rice, oil and candies.  He will also buy cell phone minutes.

This investment will help Jorge to increase his stock, gain new customers and improve his profits.  His goal is to set up a food distributors in Estelí city center and to buy his house so that he can provide his family with a decent home.

loans.use: to invest in his grocery store, buying food products such as sugar, rice, oil and candies, and also cell phone minutes

loans.name: Pedro Damian

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene 35 años de edad, es originario del departamento de Estelí, está casado , es padre de tres hijos , el se dedica a vender frutas y comida en la carretera principal del departamento de Estelí.
