He wants to grow his herd and increase the production of his dairy cows so that he can sell the milk. José is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of cows.

He is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora. María C. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive por la comunidad Corazón de Jesús que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, en esta parroquia hay hermosos lugares para visitar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura, son muy amables y gentiles.

La Señora. María tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 25, 23, 20, 18, 14 y 12 años de edad, su primer y tercer hijo trabajan y estudian en el colegio, su segundo y cuarto hijo trabaja y le ayudan  economícamente, su quinta hija esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposo labora en su taller de carpintería, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña María trabaja como empleada domestica, esta labor la realiza hace 3 años, su horario es de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde de lunes a viernes. En  su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y pollos.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos.

Su meta es tener un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Ms. María C. is a member of the Corazón de Jesús [Heart of Jesus] communal bank. She lives in the community of Corazón de Jesús, which belongs to the El Valle parish. This parish has many beautiful places to visit. Its people work in commerce, animal husbandry, and agriculture, and are very friendly and kind.

María is 42 years old, married, and has six children who are 25, 23, 20, 18, 14 and 12 years old. Her first and third-oldest sons work and study in high school. Her second and fourth-oldest sons work and help out economically, her fifth-oldest daughter is studying in a high school in the city, and her youngest son is in a school in the community. Her husband works in a carpentry workshop and together they have been able to build their own house.
 
María works as a domestic worker, which she has been doing for three years. Her work schedule is from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon from Monday to Friday. At home, she raises guinea pigs and chickens.

She has been a member of the communal bank for six years and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of chickens.

Her goal is to own a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silver chains for men and women, silver rings for women, silver bracelets for children, silver earrings for women, and silver watches for women.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana J. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive por la comunidad Corazón de Jesús que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, en esta parroquia hay hermosos lugares para visitar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura, son muy amables y gentiles.

Doña Ana tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 25, 23, 20 y 11 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan economícamente y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un bus, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora Ana se dedica a varias actividades como: lavar ropa ajena, cría chanchos, pollos y cuyes los que vende en su comunidad y en su casa tiene una tiendita de comestibles la misma que abre solo cuando se encuentra en casa y por las noches.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda como: arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, aceites, detergentes, etc.

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su tienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana J. is a member of the communal bank "Corazón de Jesús".  She lives in the community "Corazón de Jesús" in the Valle parish which has beautiful places to visit.  Its people are merchants, farmers or raise livestock and they are very kind and gentle.

Doña Ana, age 41, is married and has four children, ages 25, 23, 20 and 11.  The eldest three work and help her out financially and her youngest is in school.  Her husband is a bus driver and together they have been able to build their own home.

Ana has several business activities.  She launders clothes and raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her community.  She also has a small grocery store in her home that she opens only when she is at home in the evenings.

She has been a member of the communal bank for six years and plans to use this loan to buy groceries for her store such as rice, sugar, eggs, pasta, oil, detergent, etc.

Her goal is to continue expanding her store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, eggs, pasta, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Henry Manuel

texts.es:
Henry Manuel S. de 29 años vive en el barrio 7 de Abril de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y su hijo de 7 años; desde que llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla procedente del municipio de Concordia en el departamento del Magdalena, contrajo matrimonio y tuvo un hijo, decidió generar ingresos con lo que él conocía muy bien,  y es que Henry prepara dos deliciosos productos costeños: quesos y suero, producido con la leche que le envían sus padres de  su tierra natal y que  le sirve como materia prima para la fabricación de sus productos estrellas.
Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará leche en el municipio de Concordia  y con ella elaborar el queso y el suero que tanto gusta a sus clientes, y que lo tiene como su negocio principal  desde el año 2002, el cual  empezó por distribuirlo de tienda en tienda  y que agregando su buen manejo,  el negocio ha crecido y hoy atiende no solo tiendas sino restaurantes y panaderías donde también se lo compran.  Henry es un gran trabajador  él recibe ingresos adicionales por trabajar en un negocio de comidas rápidas que él mismo  elabora y tiene 5 años de trabajar;  con sus ingresos   ha impulsado en unión de su cónyuge a su familia, porque su sueño es que su hijo se convierta en un profesional exitoso. Su desafío mayor se produce,  cuando hay sequía y la producción se disminuye. Henry trabaja persistentemente y  mientras cosecha sus éxitos,  obtiene en su negocio una rentabilidad  sobre las ventas no menor de un 22% , rota sus cuentas por cobrar cada 5 días, así como también sus inventarios en este mismo tiempo.
texts.en:
Henry Manuel S., age 29, lives in the "7 de Abril" neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla, with his wife and son, age 7.  He arrived in Barranquilla from the town of Concordia in the department of Magdalena, got married and had a son.  He decided to earn an income doing what he knew best which was preparing delicious coastal products such as cheese and whey made from milk that his parents sent him from his home town.  He now uses that milk as raw material for his main products.

This is his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he will use it to buy milk from Concordia to make the cheese and whey that his customers like so much.  This has been his main business since 2002 when he began distributing his products to stores.  He did so well that business increased and now he not only sells to stores but also to restaurants and bakeries.

Henry is a hard worker and makes an additional income working in a fast food restaurant where he has been for five years.  With his earnings he has been able to strengthen his family ties because his dream is to help his son become a successful professional.  His biggest challenge is getting through droughts which decreases production.  Henry works constantly even though he is earns a good profit of 22% over sales with a turnover of 5 days in both accounts receivable and inventory.

loans.use: To buy milk for cheese making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a larger volume of beauty products

loans.name: Danis Esther

texts.es: Dani Esther Domínguez tiene una microempresa donde ofrece servicios de telecomunicaciones y también vende mercancía en general. Ella vive en el barrio el Limón con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 8 años cada uno. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y tiene como  meta invertirlo en la compra de una fotocopiadora, para aumentar los servicios de fotocopiaje que aún no presta en masas, tal como  su clientela lo  requiere,  pues ha aumentado y Dani  necesita ser más competitiva en su negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, aprovechando su infraestructura física y su mercado actual, donde ofrece servicios de telefonía nacional e internacional , fax e internet y fotocopiaje; así Dani mismo vende mercancía mediante guías especializadas, como productos de belleza y de aseo personal, además de cosméticos y accesorios femeninos . Su meta es diversificar su negocio, adicionando productos de papelería porque quiere crecer y responder a su gran desafío de tener su propia  casa. Mientras tanto sus negocios le ofrecen una rentabilidad no menos del 20,7%  y sus inventarios rotan cada 4 días y ella se esmera permanentemente por trabajar en función de hacer de su negocio una empresa estable, para unida a su familia  alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Dani Esther Domínguez has a micro-business selling telecommunication services and general merchandise.  She lives in the "Limón" neighborhood with her husband and her eight-year-old twins.  This is her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She plans to use it to buy a photocopy machine to increase her copying services since she is unable to provide large volume service, which is in demand.  Dani needs to be competitive in her business in order to generate more income.  She wants to take advantage of the physical infrastructure she has and the current market, offering national and international telephone, fax, internet and photocopy services.

Dani also sells merchandise through specialized catalogues such as beauty products, personal care, cosmetics and ladies' accessories.  Her goal is to diversify her business by adding stationery supplies and grow enough to be able to have her own home.  Meanwhile, her business gives her a profit of 20.7%, with a turnover of 4 days.  She works hard to make her business stable so that she and her family can carry out their dreams.

loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Ollantaytambo y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Santiago; es casado; el socio tiene 47 años de edad; el socio tiene 1 hija y el socio se dedica a la agricultura  el socio tiene terrenos en los cuales cultiva maíz, papa, el socio se dedica principalmente a la exportación de maíz blanco; el socio  compra semillas para la siembra las abona y luego vende los granos al por mayor y menor, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo de dinero en mejorar su vivienda el refaccionara algunos ambientes y requiere de capital para cubrir los gastos. El socio solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para refaccionar su vivienda.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sr. Santiago is a member of the Communal Bank “Ollantay de Wayracpuncu” which is located in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 47 years old, married, and has one daughter.  Santiago is a farmer who grows corn and potatoes.  He exports white corn and produces it by purchasing the seeds for planting and fertilizing his crops prior to selling the grain in bulk and in smaller quantities.  On this occasion, he wants to invest the money from his loan in the improvement of his home.  Some interior repairs are needed and he needs the capital to cover the expenses.  Santiago is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of materials for these home repairs.

He is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Celinda Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a Celinda, tiene 59 años  de edad, es soltera, vive con su hermana y una sobrina de 15 años que estudia en colegio y la quiere como si fuera su hija. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 12 ciclos  y le gusta porque además de entretenerse recibe el apoyo tanto de sus compañeras como de la institución.

Ella para obtener recursos se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también vende en su casa donde tiene unas vitrinas para que sus clientes miren sus productos, nos cuenta que lo que más vende es ropa de mujer y de niñas. Ella también prepara comida para vender, prepara hasta 10 almuerzos al dia  para entregar. Trabaja todos los días  desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil una vez al mes o cuando necesite. Tiene 14 años dedicada a sus ventas y le ha ido bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños, etc.

Su sueño es algún día tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabi Province and known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the communal bank "Luz de América" meet every two weeks.

Here we meet Celinda, age 59, who is single and lives with her sister and 15-year-old niece who is a student and who she loves like a daughter.  She has been in the communal bank for 12 terms and she enjoys it not only because it keeps her busy but because of the support she receives from her friends there.

She earns her living selling all kinds of clothing on a door-to-door basis and out of her home where she has display cases set up for the customers to shop.  What she sells most are women's and little girls' clothing.  She also prepares and sells up to 10 lunch meals a day which she delivers.  She works every day from 8:30 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil once a month or when necessary.  She has been in business for 14 years and it has gone well for her.

She plans to use the loan to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, etc.

Her dream is to have her own shop one day.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia  es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo, desde hace 11 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social que por lo regular estas vivienda son muy pequeñas y en parte frontal están expuestas (sin ninguna protección). A Sonia lo que mas le interesa en este momento es poner una barda al frente de su casa para ofrecer mayor seguridad a su familia ya que esta es el patrimonio que le pueden ofrecer a sus 4 hijos. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Sonia is a person who is very responsible with her work.  She acquired her house 11 years ago which, like most social welfare housing of this type, is very small and exposed (without any protection).  

What interests Sonia the most at this time is putting a wall up around her house to provide more security for her family, which is an endowment she can offer her 4 children.  In order to carry out her project, she needs to buy construction materials and pay for manual labor.

loans.use: buy construction materials and pay for manual labor to build a wall around her house.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma Karina

texts.es:
Norma Karina es una mujer muy responsable en su hogar y su trabajo, desde hace 4 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social y que en este momento necesita instalar protecciones para brindar a sus 4 hijos mayor seguridad.
 Norma y su esposo trabajan de Lunes a Domingo con un día de descanso, lo cual no les permite estar en casa y a sus hijos se quedan con una persona después de ir a la escuela mientras llegan sus papas, por lo tanto la casa se queda sola y temen que alguna persona ajena entre a robar sus cosas que con mucho esfuerzo han ido comprando. Para poner sus protecciones necesita capital para que su casa se quede segura.
texts.en:
Norma Karina is a person who is very responsible with her home and work.  Four years ago, she acquired her social welfare house that currently needs added protection to provide more safety for her 4 children.

Norma and her husband work Monday through Sunday, with one day of rest in between.  This doesn’t allow them to be home with their children, who stay with someone after school until their parents can get home.  As a result, the house is often empty.  They fear that they could be robbed, losing items that they’ve worked very hard to acquire.  They are in need of funds to secure their home.

loans.use: add further protection to her home and possessions.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario tiene 34  años, vive con su esposa  y sus 3 hijos en una casa que es alquilada. Hace más de 2 años se dedica a la venta de cerdos ahumados que es un plato típico en su zona y se le llama “lechón”, de esta manera trabaja todos los días en compañía de su esposa y de algunos familiares, pues son socios en este negocio, ya que intervienen en el proceso de su elaboración, desde la compra de los cerdos, la preparación, horneado y venta de este platillo a los distintos puntos de la ciudad donde reside. Su esposa la ayuda principalmente en el comercio  pero en un horario que no perjudique en la crianza de sus hijos. Durante este tiempo, ha visto que es rentable este negocio, porque el lechón que produce tiene buena sazón y tiene mucha demanda en su zona, ya que le permite proyectarse para el futuro y ver las mejores opciones para su negocio. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP y esta muy entusiasmado de ver que se integra a un grupo de personas en el banco comunal que son solidarias y responsable en sus pagos la cual le da confianza y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cerdos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mario is 34 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a house that is rented.  For 2 years, he has dedicated himself to selling smoked pork, a food called “lechón” that is traditional of the area.  He works every day along with his wife and some relatives who are partners in the enterprise.  They all contribute to the business’ process, from buying the pigs to preparing and selling the food throughout the city where they live.  His wife helps him primarily with sales, but on a schedule that is not detrimental to raising their children.  
  
Over time, he has seen that the business is profitable because his dish is very tasty and in high demand.  This allows him to plan for the future and see better options for his business.  This is his first loan with MFP; he is very enthusiastic to see that he has joined a group of people who are united and financially responsible with their loans.  This gives him confidence, and he commits to making his repayments on time.  He will invest his loan into buying more pigs at wholesale.

loans.use: buy more pigs at wholesale.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Deysi; es conviviente; la socia tiene 21 años de edad; la socia tiene 1 hijo, la socia se dedica a la venta de artesanía y venta de golosinas y todo lo que implica una tienda con todo lo que se requiere para un viaje a Machupicchu la socia tiene su stand en la estación de tren en Ollantaytambo, el cual se encuentra en la misma estación camino a Machupicchu, la socia se levanta muy temprano por la mañana todos los días y abre su tienda para la cual abasteció y compro mercadería relacionada en artículos de viajero como linternas, repelentes, pastillas purificadoras, medicinas básicas, algodones, golosinas, chocolates, ponchos de lluvia, gorros de lana, paraguas, galletas, energizarte y mucho más, a esto añadió artesanías para la venta a turistas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como agua mineral, jugos y abastecer su stand. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para implementar el stand.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Deysi is a member of the Communal Bank “Ollantay de Wayracpuncu” which is located in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 21 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one child. Deysi sells handicrafts, candy, and any other items that may be needed when taking a trip to Machu Picchu. She has a stand at the train station in Ollantaytambo, which is the same station for those who are traveling to Macchu Picchu. Deysi wakes up very early in the morning every day and opens her stand so that she can stock it with merchandise she has purchased. These items include supplies for traveling such as lanterns, repellents, water purification tablets, basic medicines, cotton, sweets, chocolates, rain ponchos, wool caps, umbrellas, cookies, energy drinks, and many other products. She recently added crafts to sell to the tourists. Deysi is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as mineral water and juices to stock her stand.

She is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to restock her tourist stand.

loans.name: Marily Nalleli

texts.es:
La señorita Marily Nallely es una mujer muy responsable que aun vive en la casa de sus padres los cuales apoya económicamente con los gastos de hogar.
La casa donde la familia vive la adquirieron de interés social la cual es muy pequeña, y no le permite a esta joven tener su propio espacio, por lo que se ve en la necesidad de ayudar a su padre con la construcción de su propia recamara. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra y de esta manera le permitirá tener su privacidad.
texts.en: Marily Nallely is a very responsible woman who still lives in her parents’ house; she helps them financially with the household expenses.  The family lives in social welfare housing.  The house is very small, and doesn’t allow this youngster to have her own space.  Therefore, she finds herself needing to help her father build her a bedroom.  In order to carry out this project, she needs to buy construction materials and pay for manual labor.  This addition would permit her to have privacy.

loans.use: buy construction materials and pay for manual labor to add a bedroom.

loans.name: Rosario Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosario, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 18, 17 y 12  años de edad, el mayor estudia en universidad y los menores en colegio. El marido es artesano, él se dedica a elaborar figuras y artesanías con tagua en distintos modelos.

Es una gran ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana en sus ventas y los fines de semana se dedica a preparar comida para un centro de eventos de la ciudad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio 7 años y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos como perfumes, cremas, bisuterías y cosméticos. También productos para el negocio de su marido como lijas, tagua y discos para pulir. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of the Light of America Cooperative Bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarind.

Here is where we find Rosario, 39 years of age and in a common-law-marriage that has produced three children ages 18, 17, and 12.  The oldest is studying at university, and the younger ones are in school.  Her husband is an artisan, dedicating himself to making a variety of figurines and carvings from tagua (commonly known as “vegetable ivory”).

She is a great homemaker who dedicates herself to selling products from the Yanbal line (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women).  She sells three days per week, and on the weekend she works making food for an events center in the city.  She delivers her products on credit, collecting every week or fifteen days depending on what her customers want.  She tells us she’s been in business for 7 years and that things are going very well.

This loan is to buy products such as perfumes, creams, jewelry and cosmetics.  She would also like to buy products for her husband’s business such as sandpaper, tagua, and grinding plates.  She has been a member of the cooperative bank for two years, and enjoys it because the payments are easy to make.

Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, jewelry, cosmetics, sandpaper, tagua and grinding plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Martha Verónica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 31 años  de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 10 y 5 años, ambos estudian en escuela. Su marido tiene un taxi amigo y es comerciante. Ella es nacida en Guayaquil pero hace seis años se vino  a vivir a  esta linda ciudad.

Ella tiene una tienda comestibles en su casa, en el que vende desde arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, hasta artículos de bazar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio seis años y que le ha ido muy bien, los productos compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría  los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y artículos de bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3años y le gusta porque a través de los créditos a podido financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un local propio ya que donde tiene su tienda es arrendado.
texts.en:
The members of the Light of America Cooperative Bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Here is where we find Martha, 31 years of age; she is in a common-law marriage that has resulted in two children ages 10 and 5 who are both in school.  Her husband has a taxi and is a merchant.  She was born in Guayaquil, but came to live in this beautiful city six years ago.

She has a grocery store in her home where she sells rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, and even bazaar items.  She works every day from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm, and sometimes even later.  She tells us she’s been in business for six years, and that things have gone very well.  She buys her products in Portoviejo, although she receives most items in her locale.

This loan will be used to better supply her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, cold cuts and bazaar items.  She has been a member of the cooperative bank for 3 years and enjoys it because, through the loans, she has been able to finance her business.

Her dream is to have her own location as she currently rents.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, cold cuts and bazaar items.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad L. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez,Misamis Occidental.  She is 59 years old.  Natividad is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Natividad owns and operates a fish sales business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish in the market.  Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Natividad from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa A. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental.  She is 54 years old.  Rosa is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community.  Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Rosa is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosa from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yinne Amarilis

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yinne, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 21, 18 y 8 años de edad, los mayores son independientes y la menor que vive con ella estudia en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Ella se dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana aprovechando las mañanas cuando su hija está en la escuela para realizar sus ventas ya que en las tardes se dedica a ayudarla en sus tareas escolares, lo que más vende son los perfumes. Nos cuenta que lleva 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son muy útiles para financiarse.
 
Su sueño es tener su local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The members of the Light of America Cooperative Bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Here is where we find Yinne, 39 years of age, who is married and has three children ages 21, 18, and 8.  The older ones are now grown and independent; the youngest lives with her and is in school.  Her husband is in construction.

She dedicates herself to selling Avon, Esika and Yanbal catalog products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories).  She sells door-to-door, working three days per week, taking advantage of the mornings when her daughter is in school to sell.  In the afternoons, she dedicates herself to helping her with her homework.  What she sells the most of is perfumes.  She tells us she’s been in this business for 8 years.

She is going to use this loan to buy perfumes, jewelry, cosmetics and creams.  She has been a member of the cooperative bank for three years, and enjoys it because the loans have been very useful for her business.

Her dream is to have her own locale from which to sell her products.

loans.use: buy perfumes, creams, jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 67 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Cruce Jaén – Nuevo Olmos, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad a la agricultura, pertenece al distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno, los cuales cría en un ambiente cercano a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Esta actividad la realiza hace 8 años, por ello conoce a la perfección este rubro. Adicionalmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo producto de una herencia. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Pedro desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Pedro is 67 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the Cruce Jaén section of Nuevo Olmos.  This is a rural zone that is primarily agricultural, belonging to the Olmos district in Lambayeque, and more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle near his home and, when they are large enough, he offers them for sale to the merchants that frequent the area.  He has been carrying out this activity for 8 years, which is why he now knows the trade perfectly.  Additionally, he has inherited some farmland.  With the income from both of these endeavors, he works to help his family get ahead.

Pedro would like to expand his business by buying more animals to augment sales.  For this reason, he has turned to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan of 600 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: buy more animals to expand his business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn J., from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan for 8000 PHP to purchase additional products including perfume, body massage lotion and shampoo for sale, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products including perfume, body massage lotion and shampoo for sale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Francisca, tiene 60 años  de edad, hace varios  años su esposo  falleció y quedo sola, pero de esa relación tuvo cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive con ella. Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura desde hace muchos años, se dedica a coser ropa de todo tipo, pero lo que más elabora son sabanas las mismas que después las vende a sus clientes. En la actualidad esta cosiendo uniformes de escuelas y colegios para la entrada a clases. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.
 
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, cierres, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es tener un taller con  más infraestructura.
texts.en:
The members of the Light of America Cooperative Bank meet every fifteen days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Here is where we find Francisca, 60 years of age and a widow.  Her husband passed away a few years ago; they had four children, and one of them lives with her. She learned the trade of design and tailoring, and has had a small sewing workshop for many years.  She makes all types of clothing, but mostly bedding that she sells to her customers.  Currently, she is sewing uniforms for the start of the school year.  She works every day from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm, and sometimes even later when she has orders to deliver.

She plans to use this new loan to buy fabrics, threads, clasps, buttons and other sewing supplies.  She has been a member of the cooperative bank almost from its inception, and she enjoys it because she can get access to credit more easily.

Her dream is to have a workshop with a better infrastructure.

loans.use: buy fabrics, threads, clasps, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire more animals and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Urbano

texts.es: Don Urbano tiene 55 años, vive en compañía de su esposa y de su hijo en su casa que es propia. Es un hombre muy trabajador dedicado a velar por el bienestar de su familia y la gran responsabilidad que él tiene lo asumió, desde entonces se dedica en la actividad agrícola. Por más  30 años siembra granos y tubérculos como: papa, maíz y cereales en sus terrenos de cultivo, su deseo es superar su record de  producción, para que de esa manera pueda solventar su hogar y al menor de sus hijos que actualmente esta estudiando. En cada jornada de siembra y de cosecha siempre requiere la ayuda de su esposa y de peones que contrata y eso le permite optimizar su trabajo y ahorrar tiempo. Es su crédito número 6  que tiene con MFP,  confía en cada integrante de su banco común al porque a lo largo del tiempo ha demostrado ser responsable y solidario por lo que esta muy agradecido. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de abono para su siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Urbano is 55 years old and lives with his wife and son in his own home.  He is a very hard-working man who is committed to looking out for his family's well-being.  He took on the great responsibility that he has.  Urbano works as a farmer.  For more than 30 years, he has been growing grains and tubers such as potatoes, corn and cereals on his farmland.  His wish is to increase his production record so that he can cover his household expenses and the expenses of his youngest child who is currently in school.

Every day of the sowing season and harvest season Urbano always requires the help of his wife and laborers who he hires.  This allows him to optimize his work and save time.  This is his sixth loan with MFP.  He trusts every member of his community bank because, throughout the years, they have shown themselves to be responsible and united, and he is very grateful for that.  Urbano will invest the loan that he is requesting in buying fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his potato crop

loans.name: Gildardo De Jesùs

texts.es:
Desde niño, Gildardo de Jesús M. C. conoció la ley del rebusque, pues la falta de recursos en su hogar lo obligaron a trabajar en diferentes oficios desde pequeño, fue asì como se convirtió en un luchador incansable que desde hace algún tiempo decidió montar su propio negocio, una salsamentaría que ofrece diversos productos a sus clientes y vecinos, pues ya es reconocido en el sector. 

A sus 39 años y como padre responsable de sus dos hijos, Gildardo es un gran ahorrador pues sus sueño es tener su casa propia para darle tranquilidad a su familia. Asì mismo espera que su negocio se posicione con el  tiempo y se convierta en un gran supermercado. 

Actualmente Gildardo necesita de un préstamo para comprar un televisor que ubicará en su negocio con el fin de atraer a sus clientes y lograra asì que se queden por màs tiempo para incrementar sus ventas, como el mismo lo dice el conocimiento popular me ha enseñado a traer la clientela y estoy seguro que esta será una forma.
texts.en:
Since he was a child, Gildardo de Jesús M. C. has known the importance of hard work. A lack of resources in the home meant that Gildardo had to work a range of different jobs from a young age, turning him into a tireless worker. A little while back he decided to set up his own general store that offers many products to his customers and neighbours, as he is well known in the area.

At 39 years of age and as a responsible father to two children, Gildardo is a great saver, as his dream is to have his own home to give his family peace of mind. He hopes that with time his business will grow to be a large supermarket.

Gildardo currently needs a loan to purchase a televison set which he will install in his store to attract customers who, once there, will stay for longer, make more purchases and increase his sales. Gildardo's knowledge of the public has taught him how to attract customers and he is certain that this is the way to bring them in.

loans.use: to purchase a television set

loans.name: Nikki

texts.en:
Nikki T., from the village of Sebac,Tudela, Misamis Occidental, is 42 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nikki owns and operates a specialized retail store selling daily-use products such as sugar, canned goods, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nikki joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, she is requesting her third loan loan for 7000 PHP to purchase dried fish and bagoong for sale. Nikki plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and bagoong for sale.

loans.name: Maritza Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maritza, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo cuatro hijos pero uno de ellos falleció hace varios años, tiene tres de 18, 16 y 15 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. El marido es ebanista.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo. Además de productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días en sus ratos libres, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa compra en una distribuidora. Nos cuenta que con el crédito anterior empezó con este tipo de ventas ya que antes se dedicaba a la venta de artículos para el hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for some years as the of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Luz De América [Light of America] community bank meet every two weeks. 

Here we meet Maritza. She is 44 years old and in a common law marriage, which has produced four children, one of whom died several years ago. Her other children are aged 18, 19 and 15 years old. They are high school students. Her husband is a furniture maker.    
 
She is a housewife who sells clothing via catalogue to be able to have her own resources. She also sells Esika products (beauty products such as cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works every day in her free time, selling her products on credit, collecting every week. She receives the beauty products at her house and buys the clothing from a distributor. She tells us that with the previous loan she started doing these sales, since before she sold household items.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and all types of clothing. She has been in the community bank for 5 years and she likes it because it is easy to take out the loans.   

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
Aunque María Nelly G. siempre ha sido una mujer emprendedora desde que es madre cabeza de familia y tiene bajo su responsabilidad ofrecerle un buen futuro a sus dos hijas, quienes fueron el motor principal para que esta emprendedora le diera vida a su propio negocio, Papelería Real, que ahora es su única fuente de sustento. 

A sus 35 años, María Nelly sueña con que su papelería sea la mejor de Cisneros, municipio al oriente de Antioquia del que es oriunda. 

Actualmente, María Nelly necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido como cuadernos, lápices, borradores, reglas y resmas, así espera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Although María Nelly G. has always been an enterprising woman. She is a mother and head of her family, responsible for caring for and giving a good future to her two daughters. They were the main reason why this enterprising woman has given her life to her own business, Papelería Real [Royal Paperstore],which is her only source of income now. 

At 35 years old, María Nelly dreams of her paper store being the best in Cisneros, a town to the east of Antioquia, where she is from.   

At present, María Nelly needs a loan to buy various things, such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, rulers and reams of paper. In this way, she hopes to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, notebooks, pencils, erasers, rulers, and reams of paper.

loans.name: Clara Albertina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Clara, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada pero nunca pudo tener hijos. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque aquí ha recibido mucha ayuda y además porque en las reuniones se entretiene y se olvida de sus problemas.

Tiene un carro con el cual ofrece el servicio de transporte escolar, trabaja de lunes a viernes durante todo el dia, nos cuenta que realiza cuatro recorridos por dia, lleva 12 años que viene prestando este servicio y que año a año aumentan sus clientes ya que ofrece puntualidad y seguridad.
 
Necesita el crédito para comprar llantas y ciertas refacciones para mantener en excelente estado su carro.
 
Su sueño es tener otro carro más moderno para brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the Luz De América communal bank meet in the city of Portojejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years at the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we meet 54 year old Clara.  She is married but was never able to have children.  Her husband is an auto mechanic.  This is the bank’s second cycle and she likes it because she has received lots of help there.  She also likes going to the meetings because they are entertaining and she is able to forget all of her problems.

She has a car with which she offers school transportation services, all day Monday through Friday.  She makes four trips each day and has been doing this for 12 years.  Her customers increase each year because she offers them security and timeliness.
 
She needs this loan to buy tires and certain spare parts to keep her car in good shape.  She hopes to one day have a newer car to be able to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts

loans.name: María Rosalba

texts.es:
María Rosalba A. L. a sus 58 años es una luchadora incansable, pues desde joven y como madre cabeza de familia de dos hijos tuvo que enfrentarse a trabajar en lo que sabe, vender comidas caseras, con el fin de hacerse al sustento y al de su familia. 

María Rosalba trabaja sola y sabe que su sazón es su fuerte, pues sus platos aunque sencillos son de buen sabor y según ella, eso es lo que le gusta a mis clientes. 

Con el fin de lograr mayor agilidad a la hora de elaborar las comidas para vender, María Rosalba necesita de una estufa que le permitirá sacar sus platos mucho más rápido, por ello, necesita de un préstamo puesto que no cuenta con los recursos para hacerlo.
texts.en:
At age 58, María Rosalba A. L., is a tireless hard working woman.  Since she was young, head of the household, and mother of two children, she had been working at what she knows best, selling home cooked meals.  In this way she can support her family.

María Rosalba Works alone and knows that her seasonings are her strengths, because her dishes, although simple, have a good flavor and according to her is what her customers like best.

She needs a new stove in order to speed up her business and be able to get her dishes out quicker.  She does not currently have the necessary resources, so she needs this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new stove

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta tiene 32 años, vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos y su esposo en casa de un familiar. Desde hace 2 años tiene un restaurante, en donde se asocio con su madre, quien se encarga de la atención de los clientes y ambos preparan comida de manera diaria y su trabajo comienza desde las primeras horas del día con las compras de los ingredientes perecibles como carne y verduras ya que estos tienen que ser frescos. La buena sazón de su socia es una gran fortaleza de su negocio ya que asegura la permanencia de sus clientes en su consumo y le genera las ganancias necesarias que cubre todo lo que ha invertido y para los próximos meses  procurará el mejoramiento de su negocio. Es la primera  vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, ya que ha recibido comentarios favorables de los créditos para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de nuevas mesas, sillas que le servirán para abrir una sucursal en un local cercano a un centro educativo.
texts.en: Violeta is 32 years old and lives with her husband and two children at a relative’s house.  For the past two years she has had a restaurant that she and her mother are associated with.  Her mother is in charge of serving the customers and both prepare the food daily.  Her work begins in the first hours of the morning when she shops for perishable ingredients, such as meat and vegetables because they need to be fresh.  Her delicious spices are of great strength to the business and it assures that her customers will return to eat.  It also brings her the necessary income that will cover everything she has invested in and will show improvement in her business in the coming months.  This will be her first loan through MFP and she has already received favorable remarks about improving the condition of her business.  She is committed to repaying her loan on time.  She will use the money to buy new tables and chairs that will allow her to open a branch in a location near a school.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, from the village of Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City, is 46 years old, married, and has three grown children. To make a living, Erlinda runs a retail store in the local community. Engaged in her business for 10 years, she earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her second loan for 7000 PHP to purchase a variety of products such as canned goods, candies, soap and toothpaste, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products such as canned goods, candies, soap, and toothpaste for her retail store.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.es: Virgilia tiene 47 años, es viuda y vive con el menor de sus 7 hijos en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 3 años se dedica con más intensidad a la agricultura, comenzó ofreciendo su mano de obra como peón en las temporadas de siembra y de cosecha, en la actualidad sigue desempeñándose de esta forma pero también ha decidido dedicarse al engorde y venta de reses. En un inicio empezó con su propio capital que durante mucho tiempo ha ahorrado, con ello pudo adquirir su primera vaca, negocio que tuvo éxito y la animó para continuar adelante con este negocio. En la actualidad tiene animales entre vacas y carneros que es un capital regular de trabajo que siempre le saca de ajustes económicos y ve con mucho futuro este negocio. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de ser nueva integrante de su banco comunal  ya que tiene buenas referencias de ella de la cual esta satisfecha y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una ternera hembra.
texts.en:
Virgilia is 47 years old and lives with the youngest of her seven children in a home of her own.  For the past three year she has been increasingly dedicated to agriculture.  She began offering her labor as a field hand during planting and harvest seasons, and currently continues doing this, but now also to the raises and sells cattle.

She began with her own capital which she saved up over a long time and was able to buy her first cow.  She was successful and it motivated her to continue with this business.  She now has sheep and cattle which provide a steady profit and she sees a future for this business.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very grateful to be a part of this communal bank.  She is satisfied with it and is committed to being in time with her payments.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a heifer.

loans.use: to buy a heifer

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Chann V. is a 47 year-old woman who resides in the province of Siem Reap. Chann V. is blessed with six children, four of whom are single while the other two are married and live in their own houses. To make a living, she is domestic  kitchen laborer in her community  earning around $2 a day. In order to support the increase in expenses, Chann V.’s husband works as a local porter and he typically earns an average of $3 a day to help cover the family’s expenses.  Presently, Chann V. is worried about her living conditions as her house often needs to be repaired. Because of lack of funds, Chhann V. has decided to seek a Kiva loan in order to purchase some wooden poles for repairing her old house.

loans.use: to purchase some wooden poles for repairing her old house which needs repair.

loans.name: Daveiva Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Daveiva, tiene 36 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 21, 17, 10  años y  un bebé 4 meses, los mayores estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante  de carne.
 
Ella se dedica al comercio en general, tiene una papelería y bazar en su casa, también allí vende helados y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00. Sus productos compra en Guayaquil y también recibe mercadería en su local de otras partes. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio por diez años y que le ha ido bastante bien. Hace poco  empezó a vender ropa americana y ha tenido bastante acogida entre sus clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar artículos de bazar, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 13 años y es una de las fundadoras del banco.
 
Su sueño es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the “Luz De América” meet in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, and known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we meet Daveiva.  She is 36 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has four children, ages 21, 17, 10, and a 4 year old baby; the oldest study at university, high school, and elementary school.  Her husband is a butcher.

She sells general merchandise and has a paper goods store in her home.  She also sells ice cream and Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories), and works daily from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm.  She buys her products in Guayaquil and also receives local merchandise and things from other.  She’s been doing this for ten years and things have gone very well for her.  A short time ago she began selling American clothing and has had lots of demand from her customers 

This loan is so that she can buy more paper products, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.  She has been a part of the communal bank for 13 years and is one of the founding members.

She hopes to be able to add onto her business.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin E., from the village of P-1, Danlugan, Lopez Jaena, Mis. Occ., is 47 years old and single. To make a living, Franklin has just started a business providing transportation in the local community.

In 2011, Franklin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting his first loan of 50000 PHP to purchase motor side car to expand transportation services, Franklin plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase motor side car to expand transportation services

loans.name: Unenjargal

texts.en:
Unenjargal, 29 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His older daughter, age 10, goes to a local secondary school, while the younger one, who hasn't yet reached school age, stays home.

With the help of his wife, Unenjargal manages a coal and brick-trading business that he started in 2004. The coal-trading business is profitable during the cold seasons, while brick-trading is popular during warm seasons. He has gained much experience and is planning to have his own working place in the future because he currently faces high rental expenses. Unenjaral is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to sell in the summer.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva O. is from the village of Molatuhan Alto, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Eva is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Eva owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services in the local community. Eva is just starting this business.

In 2011, Eva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to renew transportation licenses. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eva from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renew transportation licenses

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Pat S. has her own store at the local market in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province.. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, sweets, plastic products, soft drinks, and other necessary items. Her husband is a  taxi driver . The couple always tries  their best to feed their two children who are still attending  public school. Besides her selling business, Pat S. has been planting potatoes on her own land twice a year. Pat S. would like to ask for loan to pay for the wages of domestic laborers who she has hired to help plant potatoes.

loans.use: to pay the wages of domestic laborers she has hired for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline B. is from the city of P-4, Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is 26 years old. Jacqueline is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jacqueline owns and operates a fishing business. Jacqueline has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jacqueline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacqueline is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing engine purchase additional fishing net. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jacqueline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine and purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Erwina

texts.en:
Erwina M. is from the village of P-2, Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is 29 years old. Erwina is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Erwina works in a family member's fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Erwina has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Erwina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erwina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Erwina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Chheav

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Cham, Chheav L., age 51, is year-old widowed mother who lives with her six children, five of whom are single and one is married. Two of her children work as garment factory workers. Chheav L. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother, and she always uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Chheav L. doesn’t have enough capital to plant crops this season so she is requesting  a loan to use towards purchasing potato seeds for planting.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Meeting life’s challenges head-on is a habit that could be developed only by the brave. Evelyn B., 38, does just that. Evelyn is only a high school graduate, but right now she manages her own micro-business. She is married to a construction worker, Joevil, and mother to her three children, who are all studying at a public high school nearby.  Together, they live in Barangay Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines.

Evelyn runs her own sari-sari (variety) store, located in an extension of their house. Every day, she observes the buying patterns of her customers and notes their preferences in terms of the type of item they buy, the price and the brand. She sees to it that her customers get what they desire. She also operates a food stall where she offers food items among her local community. Monthly, Evelyn earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 PHP.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan.  She intends to meet the demands of her customers.  As needed, she will buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks and other grocery items.  She also will use part of this loan to buy more raw ingredients needed for her food stall.

Evelyn acknowledges that no challenge is too hard to deal with. She knows that the Lord will enable her to overcome and uphold the future of both her children and her business. She dreams of making her sari-sari store grow. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay  microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her variety store and more raw ingredients needed for her food stall

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 46 años de edad y es madre soltera de 4 hijos adultos. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz,  el distrito más grande de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Su comunidad es urbana y en vías de desarrollo. Hilda se dedica a la venta de postres en variedad. Ella los vende en el Mercado Modelo, un mercado grande, conocido y con bastante movimiento comercial en el centro de Chiclayo. Vende sus productos de forma ambulante. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia con este negocio. Es muy conocida en el mercado y tiene una clientela ya establecida. Desea usar su crédito para solventar sus gastos personales para su casa. Por ello, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Edpyme le ofrece tasas más bajas de otros bancos o prestamistas informales. Con su crédito, Hilda podrá cubrir sus gastos y seguir trabajando tranquilo sin tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que la cobrarían tasas altísimas. Hilda tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo.
texts.en: Hilda is 46 years old and a single mother of 4 grown children. She lives in her own house in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz, the largest district in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. Her community is urban and in development.  Hilda works selling a variety of desserts. She sells them in the Mercado Modelo, a large well known market with a lot of commercial activity in downtown Chiclayo. She sells her products as a street vendor. She has more than 10 years experience with this business. She is very well known in the market and has an established clientele. She wants to use the loan to pay for personal expenses for her house. For that, she has asked for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Edpyme offers lower interest rates than other banks or informal lenders that would charge her very high interest. Hilda has good personal and work references from her community. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for his household expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bricks to sell

loans.name: Chai

texts.en:
Chai V., 55, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. V. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 1 each per day. Two of their children are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 each per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing KiV. partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Teav

texts.en: Teav S., age 27, makes a living by selling fish and a few items. For example, soft drinks, cooking ingredients, shampoo and cosmetic products and other goods in the busy market. She sells the fish that she buys from other fisherman. She currently earns an average of US$2 a day, and she has been running her business for several years. Her husband is 27 years old and is a policeman who works along a street in the Baray district. Teav S. is the mother of one child. Teav S. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Teav S. is applying for a loan so she can purchase additional essential items for selling.

loans.use: to purchase additional essential items for selling.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela G. is from Maquilao Tangub City. She is 62 years old. Rafaela is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Rafaela raises fish for sale. Rafaela has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rafaela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rafaela has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. 

Rafaela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair fishing equipment. This will be the second loan taken out by Rafaela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair fishing equipment.

loans.name: Banaba Group

texts.en:
Liza S. is from the village of Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Mis. Occ.. She is 34 years old. Liza is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Liza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Liza makes and sells food and drinks for passenger in the bus terminal. Liza has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1,400 PHP a month.

In 2011, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Liza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase plastic wares to be used for her business. This will be the first loan taken out by Liza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase plastic wares to be used for her business

loans.name: Darlinda

texts.en:
Darlinda is a 46-year-old woman. She is married and has five children. One of her children is in school. Darlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Darlinda runs a Sari-sari store in the Philippines. She sells a variety of items such as noodles, salt, sugar, candies, and sardines. Darlinda has been in business for five years. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store.

In the future, Darlinda would like to save enough money that she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Bello Horizonte Tejedores ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuentan con los servicios básicos de agua y luz.
