Desde hace más de 4 años, gana la vida vendiendo ropa para niños y damas. Realiza sus ventas recorriendo caseríos cercanos tomando pedidos de sus clientes y repartiendo la mercadería. Ya cuenta con una clientela establecida. El destino del crédito será para la compra de prendas de vestir para entregar a clientes por pedidos realizados. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, logrará seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia. 

Celia es una cliente conocida para Edpyme Alternativa. Este préstamo será su segundo con la institución y canceló su primero de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Celia is 37 years old, married and has two children. They live in their own home in the village of Bello Horizonte Tejedores in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone in the Piura region. It is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She lives in the rural part of the district and they don't have basic services like water and electricity.

For more than four years, she has earned a living selling clothing for women and kids. She goes to nearby neighborhoods taking orders from customers and delivering merchandise. She already has an established customer base. The loan will be used to purchase articles of clothing to deliver to the customers to meet their requests. For this reason, she has asked for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With this investment, she will continue growing her business and improving her family's quality of life. 

Celia is a known client of Edpyme Alternativa. This will be her second loan with the institution and she paid of her first loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more articles of clothing to meet the requests of her customers

loans.name: Rosa Nelida

texts.es: Rosa tiene 46 años de edad. Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Viven en el  caserío Los Boliches en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana la vida brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi propia, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para transportar la gente. Además, obtiene otros ingresos por la venta de ropa. Realiza sus ventas recorriendo caseríos cercanos tomando pedidos de sus clientes y repartiendo la mercadería. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona en ambos negocios. El destino del crédito será para arreglar y mantener su mototaxi en buena condición. Con esta inversión, podrá seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.  Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 46-year-old single mother with two children. They live in the village of Los Boliches in the district of Olmos, a busy commercial agriculture zone in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

She makes a living providing passenger transport services in her own mototaxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and a cabin for transporting people. She also makes money by selling clothes. She sells in nearby villages taking orders from her clients and delivering the merchandise. She has an established local clientele for both businesses. 

The loan will be used to fix her mototaxi and keep it in good condition. With this investment, she will be able to continue offering good service to her customers. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to fix her mototaxi and keep it in good condition.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna G. works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Lorna is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Lorna is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy S. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 36 years old. Joy is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Joy owns and operates a pedicab transport service. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Joy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn C., 29, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

C. sells gasoline, earning an income of US $2 per day. Her husband is a blacksmith, earning an income of US $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $83 on food and US $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more supplements to expand her husband’s blacksmith business. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. C.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy more supplements to expand her husband business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina works hard to support 3 children. She is married and has a dry goods business in the Philippines.

Josefina requested a PHP 3,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergencies. Josefina is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Tomato Group

texts.en:
Juvie C. is from the city of TALAIRON, OROQ. CITY. She is 39 years old. Juvie is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Juvie is married and has 2 school-aged children.  She owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Juvie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Juvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Juvie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients

loans.name: Phim's Group

texts.en:
Four low-income people have decided to seek a loan for similar purposes. One of these people, Phim M., 31, has been chosen to be the leader of this loan group by the other members. 

Phim M. and her husband currently catch fresh fish in and around Tunle Sap River, and they always sell all fish at retail, so that they will get a proper price. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are young and attend school. Currently, the old machine the family uses to connect with the boat has broken down and this has been affecting their income. Phim M. will use this loan to buy a new machine to replace the broken one. She is the head of the four-member group. 

Mrs. K., Mrs. N., and Mrs. T. are earning a profit by fishing; all of these women will use their loans to buy nets for their fishing activities.

loans.use: to buy a new machine to replace a broken one.

loans.name: El

texts.en: El S., 55, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products.  S. sells traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 1.25 per day.  Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike to transport the cakes to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport cakes to sell

loans.name: Hen

texts.en: Hen O., 56, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. O. is a housewife, while her husband is a farmer earning an income of USD 4 per day. Four of her children are employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. O. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a plot of farmland to produce more rice. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to produce more rice

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn E. is from Prenza Tangub City. She is 45 years old.  Evelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children.  She owns & operates a business operating motor transport services.  Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ma. Regina

texts.en:
Ma. Regina C. works hard to support five children. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ma. Regina requested a PHP 3,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Ma. Regina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase solar lamp.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol S., 40, resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. 

S. sells groceries, earning an income of US $5 per day. Two of her children are employed in the city, earning an income of US $2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $42 on food and US $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to purchase a tuk tuk for one of her children to start a new business as a tuk tuk driver in the city. ( A tuk tuk is a motorcycle with a passenger cab.) This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk for her child to start a new business.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 48 years old and married with seven children.

Ermelinda works hard to provide for her family. She has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ermelinda has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been buying and selling charcoal for ten years and also earns income from a sari sari (specialized local retail) store.

Ermelinda aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en: Thoeurn C. has been in a farming business for a long time, and earns a profit an average of $1.52 each day. This is a skill she had learned from her grandparent when she was single. She is now married and has two young kids who live under her care. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. For additional income, the couple also sells merchandise in the mobile place by using their own motorcycle. Unfortunately, their existing motorbike broke down while doing this. Thoeurn C. would like to apply for a loan to buy a used motor for replacing the broken one and also to buy some merchandise for resale. Note: Thoeurn C., her two kids and her husband are in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a used motor for replacing the broken one, and also to buy some merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G., 42, is only a high school graduate, but right now she manages her own micro business. She is married to Romy, a worker at an upholstery shop, and mothers her three children, who are studying in public elementary and high schools nearby.

Marilou runs her own sari-sari (variety) store located in an extension of their house. Every day she observes the buying patterns of her customers and notes down their preferences in terms of the type of item they buy, the price, and the brand. She sees to it that her customers get what they deserve. Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around 12,000 PHP.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 44,000 PHP loan. As needed, she will buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks, and other grocery items to meet the demands of her customers. 

Marilou dreams of making her sari-sari store grow. 

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan V., 50, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. 

V. sells sugarcane juice, earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of US $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $60 on food and US $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a new sugarcane squeezer to operate her business more efficiently. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new sugarcane squeezer.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita C. is from the village of Buenavista, Oroquieta City. She is 59 years old. Tita is single. 

To make a living, Tita prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Tita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Tita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Tita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her motorcycle, which she uses for her business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Tita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle, which she uses for her business.

loans.name: Dok

texts.en:
Dok S., 32, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known as one of Angkorean Temples. S. sells coffee and breakfast, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family expenses.  Each month, the family has to spend USD 110 on food and USD 20 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to build chicken cages and purchase chickens to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to build chicken cages and purchase chickens to raise for sale

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Met S., 32, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known as one of Angkorean Temples. S. grows mushrooms to sell, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a furniture repairman and seller, earning an income of USD 9 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 90 on food and USD 27 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a water pump to water the mushrooms. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to water the mushrooms

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam L., 43, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known as one of Angkorean Temples. L. is employed as guard to look after the temples, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a gardener, earning an income of USD 4.5 per day to help cover the famiL. expenses. Each month, the famiL. has to spend USD 41 on food and USD 10 on the other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: The two people shown in the picture are Ke P., 38, and his wife, also age 38. They currently live in Kompong Cham province. Ke P. earns a living by cultivating rice with his wife. They have six children, one of whom is a Khmer food vendor from morning until evening next to her house. Ke P. will be using his loan to get a mortgage for farmland for his neighbor and to buy natural fertilizer for her crop to grow well.

loans.use: to get a mortgage for farmland and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Teody

texts.en:
Teody M. is from the town of East Pob., Lopez Jaena, Mis.Occ.  He is 40 years old.  Teody is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Teody owns & operates a business baking & selling bread in the local community. Teody has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9150 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Teody joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teody has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Teody is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP, which will be used to rent baking equipment. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Teody from GDMPC.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to rent baking equipment

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to repair the rickshaw of her husband who is a driver by trade and provides transport services to his passengers. Using the loan, he will repair the engine which will help him provide better quality transport facilities to his passengers and earn better income. 

Robina has three children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She herself is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She is hopeful that this investment will prove a good one for her family and earn her husband better profits in future. She lives with her family in Mian Channu which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her house contains 2 rooms and she has been living there for the past 15 years.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou L. is from the town of p-2, Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena,  Mis. Occ.  She is 31 years old.  Marilou is single.  Marilou owns & operates a business selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marilou from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy a motorcycle. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en:
Lonh S., 25, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. 

S. sells rice, earning an income of US $6 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of US $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $70 on food and US $120 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more rice in bulk to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more rice in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang D., 48, is a busy woman who attempts to earn money from many ventures. She cultivates rice as well as buying it in bulk from other farmers to store in her home. She buys when rice is commanding the lowest price and then sells it to gain income. Besides those sectors, she also provides a rice hulling service inside her home to her neighbors. She is a widowed mother who has five children. Four of her children are single, while the other one is married and lives separately. Two children are employed in a garment factory as workers. 

Unfortunately, the hulling machine has often broken down while providing service. Because of this problem, Seang D. would like a loan to repair her hulling machine and buy rice to stock up for future sales.

loans.use: to repair her hulling machine and buy rice to stock up for future sales.

loans.name: Chheoung

texts.en:
Chheoung L., 51, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. 

L. sells soup, porridge, and Chinese noodles, earning an income of US $4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $50 on food and US $90 on the other necessary expenses. 

L. is requesting a loan of US $300 to purchase more supplements to expand her food-selling business. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more items to expand her food-selling business.

loans.name: Sgoun

texts.en:
Sgoun M., 56, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. 

M. grows vegetables to sell, earning an income of US $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $25 on food and US $90 on the other necessary expenses. 

M. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a water pump to water her vegetables. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to water the vegetables.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen S., 26, is married and lives with her husband and two young children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband have been garment factory workers since 2007, and are able to make US$3 each per day. They also farm in the rainy season. To earn more money, Pen S. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a plot of land and fertilizer. S. appears in the photograph with her family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland and fertilizer

loans.name: Soeur

texts.en:
Soeur S., 43, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make US$5 per day. This couple has one school-aged child. 

Soeur S. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike to use as transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport rice to sell

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat K., 57, lives with her husband and four children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US$2.50 per day, while her husband earns less than US$1 per day. Her husband is a farmer, growing rice. This couple also is supported by four children, three of whom are garment factory workers and one is a construction worker. 

Khat K. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. K. appears in the photograph with her son.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 56 years old.  She is married and has 7 children. Her younger children still go school.

Jocelyn is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Jocelyn works hard to improve her business. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She hopes this loan will help grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen P., 48.  She is happily married to Roman P., a government employee.  They have been blessed with three children, one of whom is in high school and the other two in elementary school.  Helen is working hard to help her husband, in order for their children to be able to go all the way through college.  Together, they live in Fairview, Quezon City, Philippines.

Helen operates an electric repair shop.  She has been in this kind of business for quite some time now.  She hires a repairman to do what is needed for every item their customers bring to their shop.  These include household appliances like washing machines, electric fans, and televisions, among others.  Serving her local community, she earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 PHP per month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan.  She intends to use this loan to pay for spare parts needed for the repair of electric items.  Helen believes that through this loan, she will be able to accommodate the needs of her clients that would eventually create income for her business.

Helen prays for good health and success for her business.  She desires that her children will be able to finish their college education and become financially stable someday.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she reads.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts needed for electrics repair

loans.name: Pil

texts.en:
Pil M., 59, sells grocery items in front of a garment factory in the Kampong Chhnang province. She also sells meat and wine in the evening, and she usually makes US$3 of profit each day. She is a widow with five children. Three of her children are in school, while two are employed in garment factories. 

Pil M. is asking for a loan of US$500 to expand her stock of her grocery items.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Nan S., 51, owns a small kiosk next to her house in Kompong Cham, where she sells soft drinks and Khmer noodles. She normally makes around $2 of profit each day to cover her family's daily expenses. Her husband also helps her in the business. Nan S. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations, which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has recently come to a low capacity due to lack of material for making Khmer noodles. Nan S. wishes to have more funds to buy the equipment for making Khmer noodles, which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy the equipment for making Khmer noodles.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San H. is 30 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than six years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing activities, or buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Toem Sim, 37, who works as a fisherman in and around the lakes of his community. They have three children: two are single and live with them, while the third child is married and lives independently. 

Currently, San H.'s house has broken in a few places, making it so difficult for her and her family to live there. Because of this reason, San H. requested a loan in order to buy some planks for mending her broken house.

loans.use: to buy some planks for mending her broken house.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda O., 35, is married to Mario O., a mason.  They have been blessed with four healthy children, who are all studying in public elementary and high schools nearby.  Erlinda is working hard to help her husband in order for them to send their children all the way through college. They live in Brgy.Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines.

Erlinda has been in the rags-making business for quite some time now.  She buys cut out pieces of fabrics, old newspapers as patterns, and other raw materials needed.  She weaves these fabrics into palm-sized and doormat-sized rags.  Users of these rags are usually jeepney and taxi drivers and even offices.  She sells the finished products to her patrons on a wholesale basis.  Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around 11,000 PHP.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to pay for the purchase of more raw materials needed for her rag-making business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

It is Erlinda's desire to help her children finish their college education and become financially stable someday.  She prays for sustainability of her business and continue to provide the needs of her family.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she reads.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed for her rag making business

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed lives in Mian Channu which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 12 years. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to boost her husband’s business selling animals. Using the loan, he will purchase young animals such as goats & sheep, raise them and sell them to his customers at a good profit. He started this business six years ago by purchasing very few animals and sold them at a profit. 

Khursheed is confident about the positive growth of her husband’s business and about the better financial future of her family as a result of an investment. 

She has given birth to two sons. Her elder son is studying while the younger one who is 7 years old stays at home.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She has maintained a good credit record in every loan year.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for resale.

loans.name: Acquilina

texts.en:
Acquilina R. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Acquilina is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Acquilina owns & operates a business providing new clothing to local community members. Acquilina is just starting this business.

In 2010, Acquilina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Acquilina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Acquilina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ready to wear clothes and supplies for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Acquilina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ready to wear clothes and supplies for sale

loans.name: Abdulmanon

texts.ru: Тагаев Абдулманон проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 46 лет. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку на центральном рынке города Кургантюбе, где продает хозяйственные товары. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. В продвижении его деятельности ему помогают его сыновья. Он берет кредит для покупки кипятильников, перчаток, ножей, удлинителей и губки.
texts.en: Abdulamon T. lives in the Bohtar region. He is 46 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. He is in retail and rents out a vendor space on the central market of the town of Qurgan-tube where he sells household products. He has been in this business for six years. Abdulamon's sons are helping him in the business development. He is taking out the loan to buy water boilers, gloves, knives, cord extensions and sponges.

loans.use: to buy water boilers, gloves, knives, cord extensions and sponges

loans.name: Chut

texts.en: Chut S. is a 32-year-old fish vendor and the mother of one school-aged child. Every day in early morning, Moeun Sory and her husband always go to buy fish from the fishermen and they hurry up and bring their fish by motorbike to the market for resale. Recently, their motorbike broke while driving and it will affect their vending business. Chut S. is taking out her loan to buy a used motorcycle, and she will use the rest of the loan to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle, and use the rest to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca T. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Rebecca is married and has 3 adult children.  Rebecca owns & operates a business selling fish in the market. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fish and dried fish for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rebecca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish and dried fish for sale

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark S. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old. Mark is single. He owns & operates a business operating tricycle transport services. Mark has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mark joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mark is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mark from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Chak

texts.en: Chak S. is a hard-working woman who has spent her life cultivating crops. Chak S. is a 57-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. Chak S. is married to Phin Pei, age 56. This couple, who work together in the farming business are blessed with four children, two of whom are employed in different jobs to earn a profit. The remaining two are students who attend the local school. In order to earn extra income, Chak S. will be using the loan to buy some pig feed and piglets for feeding purposes. She hopes to use the remaining cash to pay the arrangement fees of her child to go to work overseas.

loans.use: to buy some pig feed and piglets for feeding purposes.

loans.name: Dushan

texts.ru: Халилов Душан проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 43 года. Женат. У него четверо детей. Он имеет средне - специальное образование, счетовод. По специальности работает 20 лет. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством. При доме у него небольшой участок земли, где он сеет злаковые культуры и выращивает овощи. В этой области он 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Dushan K. lives in the Yavan region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has four children. He has secondary specialized education, he is an accountant. He has worked in his profession for twenty years. He also does agriculture. Dushan has a small plot of land at his home where he sows cereals and grows vegetables. He has been eight years in this business. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Kaneezan's Group

texts.en:
Kaneezan lives in Mian Channu which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 12 years.   She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s agriculture business. He has been operating this business for the past six years. He grows different seasonal crops and after cultivating, he sells to his clients at a profit. He offers reasonable rates to his clients that’s why his clients approach him.  

Kaneezan herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She has given birth to a son who is nine years of age. 

Using the loan, her husband will purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides etc. to get maximum output from his work and increase his profits.  

Kaneezan is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her husband and she will be able to provide better living facilities to her son.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean S. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Jean is married and has 4 school-aged children.  Jean owns & operates a business planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Jean has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Jean is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Jean from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak K. is 48 year-old widow who earns a living by planting rice crops on her own farmland annually. From her crop business, she can make around $2.50 a day to provide for the family’s needs. Currently, she lives with her elderly mother and her daughter, who works as a garment factory worker and has a specific salary every month. 

Prak K. really wants to have a house that she owns, but she doesn’t have sufficient money to buy one. So now, Prak K. would like to request her loan to add with her current savings in order to buy a small wooden house with zinc roofing.

loans.use: to buy a small wooden house with zinc roofing

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem belongs to Mian Channu which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a single room brick house with her family for the past 20 years.  She is 46 years old, married to B. and has a son and two daughters. Her son sells animals to butchers. Her daughters stay at home and help Naseem in her daily household work. 

Her husband operates an agriculture business. He has a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops. He is very active and works very hard to afford the living expenses of his family. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to further improve her husband’s business by purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides etc. in larger quantity.  Her husband has been operating this business for the past six years and Naseem is very hopeful that an investment will improve the financial condition of his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a resident and a farmer in Kitale Town in Western Kenya producing milk and selling to the local market. He is married with four children aged between 18 and 6 years and all schooling. He gets additional income from his employment as a non-teaching staff person.

Nathan has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to venture into poultry farming. He has been in dairy farming but believes the venture into the poultry business will be where he can make faster returns and pay for the education of his children. Nathan believes the poultry business will act as a support for the dairy business and enable him to expand later for more commercial purposes.

Nathan says diseases are the main challenge for both poultry and dairy businesses.

loans.use: To  purchase poultry.

loans.name: Lloyd

texts.en:
Lloyd is 26 years old and is still single. He tills a piece of land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, where he grows rice crops. He also raises pigs for fattening and sale.   Lloyd sells his harvests and pigs at the market.

Lloyd works hard to improve his farm and small piggery. He is saving for his future family. Lloyd is planning to use his loan to purchase pig feed and farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and farm inputs

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom got married a few years ago with G. M. and she has a son and a daughter, who both stay at home and have not started their education yet. She lives in a 2-room brick house in a small city called Mian Channu. Mian Channu is a small city of Pakistan also known for its agriculture industry.  She is a housewife and stays at home doing her household work. She is a very active and supportive person and always ready to help her family in their time of need. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her nephew who also lives with her and operates an animal-selling business. He buys young animals, raises them and sells to butchers at a profit. Using the loan, he will buy goats & sheep for resale.
 
Kalsoom is hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her nephew’s business and it will help him to grow financially.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for resale.

loans.name: Lynett

texts.en:
Lynett lives in Sto. Niño in South Cotabato with her family. She is married and has 2 children, aged 8 and 10. Lynett and her husband are both farmers. They have been growing rice for 10 years.

Lynett does her best to keep their farm productive. She also wants to find ways to help augment their income. She plans to raise pigs to sell to achieve that purpose.

Lynett's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, piglets and feeds

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with 7 children. Her family lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato.

Marilyn is in the business of farming. She has been growing rice for 6 years. She owns carabaos (water buffaloes) that help in plowing the field.  Marilyn said that the farm is very helpful in providing for her family. It also supports her children's education. 

Marilyn wants to keep the farm productive and has applied for a loan to purchase 4 bags of fertilizers, 3 sacks of seeds and other farm inputs.

In the future, Marilyn hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Irshaad's Group

texts.en:
Irshaad is 36 years old and divorced. Her husband left her a few years ago. Now she lives with her brother in a small city called Mian Channu which is located in Punjab Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She spends her day in doing her daily routine work. Her brother is very supportive by nature and operates an animal-selling business. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times he sells animals to butchers. 

Irshaad also helps him in his business by taking care of his cattle, providing them timely food and water. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her brother’s business. Using the loan, he will buy goats and sheep and sell at a good profit. He has been operating this business for the past six years and Irshaad is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for resale.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old.  She is a married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 20 years old.

Marilyn has been engaged in farming for 6 years. Her husband manages their rice farm and she helps him keep it free of weeds and pests. Marilyn also raises pigs and makes "balut" (a boiled fertilized egg) for sale. She has ducks that lay eggs but still has to buy more eggs from other sellers for her balut business. Marilyn works hard to help provide for her family and send her children to school.

This loan will be used to purchase duck eggs, pig feeds and farm fertilizers. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her family's living conditions and wants to have her own car.

loans.use: to purchase duck eggs, pig feeds and farm fertilizers

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en: Zosimo, a 50-year-old single man, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a vegetable/spices vending business in the Philippines for the past 10 years. He has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell in his stall. In the future, Zosimo would like to build up and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell in his stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Julie

texts.en:
Mary Julie is a 35-year-old farmer from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is still single and wants to have her own family someday.

Mary Julie has been growing rice for 4 years. She earns approximately 5000 PHP from this farming activity.  She works hard to earn better income and be able to save for her future family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds.  Mary Julie hopes for this loan to help improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Ma. Lisa

texts.en: Ma. Lisa, a 46-year-old married mother of eight children, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a food production business in the Philippines for the past seven years.  She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ingredients for the goods she sells in her food stall. In the future, Ma. Lisa would like to expand her business to better provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and buy poultry.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a rice farmer. She tills her own land located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Nelia works hard to earn from the farm because it is the only source of income her family has. Nelia has 5 children, 4 of whom still go to school. She wants them to finish college and have bright futures.

Nelia's loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to start a new business to help augment her family's income.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena earns a living through farming and selling meat. She tills a piece of land where she grows rice crops. She also raises pigs and sells their meat to the people in her community. Nena has been engaged in rice farming for 20 years, and started selling pork meat 3 years ago.

Nena is a widow with 5 children to look after. Nena works hard to sustain her family. She is planning to use the loan to purchase fertilizers, piglets and feeds.

loans.use: buy fertilizers, piglets and feeds

loans.name: Simora

texts.en:
Simora is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock for her fish vending business.

Simora has been in this business for 30 years. Simora also earns additional income from her "carinderia" (local eatery).

Simora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her businesses to support the family's needs in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sinforiana

texts.en:
Sinforiana is 49 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sinforiana is borrowing PHP 16,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Mian Channu which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 20 years. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to boost her husband’s livestock business. He has some livestock at his home. He sells their milk and also sells some to earn a good profit. His livestock base is cows & goats. He sells goats to his customers. Using the loan, he will buy another cow to increase the productivity of milk which will help him sell milk to many other customers to get good profits. He started this business 20 years ago and it is giving him good income every month. 

Perveen is confident about the positive financial growth of her husband’s business and about the better financial future of her family as a result of an investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She has maintained a good credit record in every loan year.

loans.use: To buy another cow for its milk.

loans.name: Rang

texts.en:
Rang T., 32 years old, is a married woman living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Rang T. and her husband sells some firewood for earning profit. They always go to buy firewood in bulk from their regular suppliers or other firewood seller. And then, they sell it to make a profit. They can earn about $4 a day from their business. 

The couple are blessed with two single children who still live under their roof. Rang T. will use her loan to purchase machine to link with trailer in order to pick up their firewood to sell somewhere.

loans.use: to purchase machine to link with trailer in order to pick up their firewood to sell

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Cultivating rice is part of 31-year-old Ou S.’s daily routine. Rice is an essential product vital to Cambodian people. She learned to do this from her grandmother and she is very widely known in this sector since before she was married. Her husband, Sim Mari, is a blacksmith. He is good at making doors and windows. He usually earns an average of US$15 each day. Most of the income for her whole family relies on her husband’s business. 

Currently, Ou S.’s husband is running his business very well because he sells his items at a reasonable price. In order to better satisfy the needs of the customers, Ou S. is seeking a US$ 1200 loan for her husband to buy bigger amounts of iron in order to produce doors and windows to sell.

loans.use: to buy a bigger amount of iron to produce doors and windows to sell.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is 57 years old.  He is a married man and has 4 children. His oldest child is 22 years old.

Norberto is a farmer. He has been growing rice for 24 years. He also raises pigs to sell. Norberto works hard to provide for his family. He hopes to improve their living conditions and provide better futures for his children.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and pig feeds.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pig feeds

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: For the last five years, Fred has made a living raise crops and livestock in Kitale Town in Western Kenya, where his main products include onions, milk and eggs. He is 23 years old, married and has one child who will soon celebrate his second birthday. Fred is applying for a loan for 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will make his family more financially stable and give them access to better food. His long-term goal is to own four cows and a mill he can use to grind cereals at the local market.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat lives in Mian Channu which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 20 years.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s timber selling business. Gas is not available in his area and people approach him to buy wood from him for cooking food. Using the loan, he will buy timber in bulk quantity which will help him to fulfill the timely needs of his customers and earn better profits. He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Mussarat is confident that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business. 

Mussarat is a housewife but she also operates a decorative embroidery business for her neighborhood clients. She is very skillful at her work and receives a good number of orders every month which helps her to pay the utilities. She is the mother of four children. Her eldest son has a construction supplies business while her daughter is doing a nursing course. Her remaining 2 children are getting their education from a local school. 

Mussarat is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She has maintained a good credit record in every loan year.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Bou S., 41, is a a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. She earns about $1 per day. She is a widowed mother who has given birth to five children. Two of them are working at sewing clothes in a garment factory. Recently, the family's living conditions have not been comfortable because their house doesn’t have a toilet for daily use yet and this is harmful for their health. Therefore, Bou S. is requesting a loan to build a restroom for her family's sanitation.

loans.use: to build a restroom for her family's sanitation.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen S., 56, has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in Chamkar Leu district, Kompong Cham province. Since 1990, Sen S. has owned and operated her farm to cultivate rice and vegetables, from which she earns a daily income. She is a widow who currently lives with six children. Three of them are employed in a variety of jobs and other provinces while the other three are single and enrolled in school. 

Sen S. would like to ask for a loan to buy cashews in bulk from her neighbor for resale and also plant vegetables on her farmland.

loans.use: to buy cashews in bulk from her neighbor and also plant vegetables on her farmland.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is aged 61 years and has been in active farming for the last 12 years. His produce of milk and eggs are sold to the local market. His family relies on farming for their upkeep. He is married, with 7 children between 23 and 12 years old.

Christopher has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says the dairy cow will provide the family with milk for consumption, and for sale to meet other basic needs. He  hopes to increase the number of his dairy cows and purchase a motorcycle to help him with the supply of produce to the market.

Christopher concurs with other farmers that animal diseases are quite costly to manage. He is, however, glad Juhudi Kilimo provides agricultural loans.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nida is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Nida has a pottery business in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for pottery-making.

Nida has been in this business for six years. In the future, Nida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for pottery-making.

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en:
Rihab is a wife and mother of four sons. Her husband is a taxi driver in the city of Rafah in the Gaza Strip. Rihab's husband needs to have his car fixed and maintained.

Rihab took out a loan from FATEN to help her husband--who appears in the picture here instead of her as she is a conservative woman--to pay for the maintenance and increase the car's working hours and thus profit.

loans.use: To pay to perform maintenance on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 60 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. Her oldest child is 38 years old and no longer lives with them.

Pacita started her farming business 5 years ago. She grows rice crops to sell. She earns 5000 PHP from this farming. Pacita is planning to use this loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She hopes for her harvest to increase.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Fe works hard to support her family. She has a "Carenderia" (small restaurant) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Fe is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her Carenderia business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is from the village of Pines, Oroquieta City.  She is 67 years old, and married. To make a living, Lolita has a business running a retail store in the local community. 

Lolita has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. 

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP with which she will purchase a variety of products, such as canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., for her retail store . This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lolita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products, such as canned goods, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., for her retail store

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 50 years old and married with two children. Nelly works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Nelly has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, noodles, rice, etc.

In the future Nelly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Vahram

texts.en:
Vahran A. is from the village of Haykavan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  He is married, with two sons (five and sixteen years old).  Vahran is a trained auto mechanic and has been working on the family farm for the past thirty years.  He considers himself to be a hard-working professional farmer.  He would like a loan to purchase potato seeds, barley seeds and fuel for this year’s growing season.  Vahram expects this investment to increase the family income by twenty percent.  He dreams of saving enough money to finish the construction of the family home and provide university education for his children.  

Vahram was born in Haykavan and is surrounded by close friends and relatives.  The village is well irrigated to support agriculture activities.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds, barley seeds and fuel

loans.name: Narra

texts.en:
Narra is 58 years old and married with seven children.  With four children in school, Narra works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like milk, sugar, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Narra has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, noodles, salt, etc. 

In the future Narra would like to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Norie Belen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norie Belen works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling of "nipa" (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair).  Norie Belen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

 Norie Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that all her hard work will help her to attain her dream of having a fishing boat.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Peruz

texts.en:
Peruz A. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Gheghanist.  She is the proud mother of two wonderful children – an eighteen year old son and a twenty-one year-old daughter.  

Peruz has been engaged in agricultural activities for the past seventeen years.  In addition to supporting her family, she helps relatives in the city with produce grown on the family farm.  She has lived her entire life in Gheghanist and is considered a hard working, honest person.  She plans to take a loan to purchase feed and fertilizer.  Peruz’s business investment should bring the family fifteen percent additional income this year.  Peruz will use the additional income to support her children’s college education.

loans.use: to purchase feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan belongs to Mian Channu which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 24 years. She is 48 years old, married to N., and has six sons and a daughter. Her eldest son has a construction supplies business while the second one sells wheat and rice. Her remaining children are studying in a local school. 

It is very difficult for Bashiraan and her husband to afford their children’s school fees. That’s why her two elder children left their education and started work so that their younger brothers and their sister can continue their education. The older sons contribute their family financially from their earnings. 

Her husband is also involved in a wheat- and rice-selling business. He supplies good quality products and that’s why he has a good number of customers and earns regular profits. He also operates a milk selling business and for this purpose he keeps two buffaloes and a cow at his home. 

Bashiraan also supports her family financially by selling wood to her community clients. She is also a very good housewife and does her household tasks very well.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his milk selling business by purchasing another dairy cow. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Bashiraan is very hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has proved herself a responsible client of Asasah by paying the installments on time and by attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow for milk selling business.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
42 year-old Olivia A. is married, with 2 school-aged children. Her family lives in Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. Olivia is engaged in selling dried fish. She sells her dried fish at the market, where she earns 3,000 PHP a month.

Olivia is now in her 5th loan cycle at ASKI amounting to 12,000 PHP. According to her, she will use her loan to purchase fish for her dried fish business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her dried fish business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Melanie is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Melanie has a  Ready-To-Wear clothing business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional  Ready-To-Wear clothing to sell.

Melanie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Melanie would like to make some business improvements and renovate her home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional Ready-To-Wear clothing to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en: Ashkhen Bedeyan lives in the village of Bara, which is located in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is married and has five daughters who range in age from nine to 27. In addition to raising her daughters, she has worked on the family farm for the past 30 years. Her goals are to continue supporting her family and raise money to renovate her family's home. She is applying for this loan to buy enough livestock to increase her family's income by 25 percent. She is very happy to have access to microfinance loans and an opportunity to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her income by buying more livestock.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon S., age 51, is pictured with her husband under their roof. To earn a living, Suon S. cultivates a rice crop on her existing farmland. The family typically generates a revenue of US$ 2 each day and have been in their business for years. They have five kids, three of whom are single and the other two are married. Two of their children already work in different jobs to earn income. After heavy rain, this is the good time for growing crops, but Suon S. is still not planting crops yet. She hopes to use her Kiva loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and watermelon seeds for planting.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and watermelon seeds for planting.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Alice has a business selling food, which she has had for two years.  She also has a second business selling charcoal  

To help expand her businesses, Alice has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food and charcoal for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Alice hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Alice hopes to become a doctor after her studies. 

Alice is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to handle customers.

loans.use: to purchase more food and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for purchase of poultry and feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy weaves and a modern shaving machine

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya got married a few years ago with N. M.. She has three sons. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She lives in a 2-room brick house in a small city called Mian Channu. Mian Channu is located in Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She is a housewife and stays at home doing her household work.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband who has an agriculture business. He grows different seasonal crops and earns good profits. Using the loan, he will purchase fertilizers, seeds and pesticides etc to get maximum results from his work. 

Surriya is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business and improve the living standard of her family.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
