loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables.

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد عمره25 سنة اعزب يعمل في بيع الخضار والفواكه له في عمله 13 سنة يحب عمله ويريد التطور والتحسن في العمل والمدخول يريد من خلال تحسين عمله الى زيادة المدخول اليومي حتى يؤمن مستقبله وخاصة انه في طور تكوين عائلة يطمح محمد في زيادة مدخوله وتغيير مستقبله خاصة انه يعاني من صعوبة في المنافسة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء خضار وفاوكه للعمل وتأمين بعض الادوات المنزلية الخاصة في منزله الجديد يتميز في تنوعه في البيع حيث يشمل بضائع عديدة في المحل خاصته ويحلم بتوسيع العمل وتكبير المصلحة محمد ايضا يساعد اهله في تخطي المصاعب المادية وذلك حرضاً منه على الترابط الأسري
texts.en: Mohamad is 25 years old and unmarried. He works selling fruits and vegetables. He has 13 years of experience in his work. He likes his work and would like to develop and improve both his business and his income. He wants to increase his daily income by improving his business so that he can secure a good future for himself, especially since he is in the stage of his life where he will soon be starting a family of his own. Mohamad aspires to increase his income and improve his future, especially since he is having some trouble competing in his field. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy fruits and vegetables for his business, as well as some home appliances for his new home. He stands out in his field due to the diversity of the goods he sells. He dreams of expanding his business. Mohamad also helps his family overcome their material difficulties as he is very interested in maintaining his family ties.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables for his business, as well as some home appliances for his new home.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita B. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 61 years old, widowed and has 2 adult-aged children. Nita owns and operates a business making and selling homemade sausages (longganisa and chorizzo) and hopia (a bean filled pastry) in the local community. She also runs a retail store selling junk food and canned goods. Nita has been engaged in her businesses for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from them.

In 2008, Nita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional ingredients and to increase working capital. Nita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients such as ground meat, spices and food seasonings. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Nita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as ground meat, spices and food seasonings.

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Kitookye Trading Centre Society Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Justus is the leader of Kitookye group in Kihihi. He is a hardworking and friendly man from Kitookye who has had a business of selling produce like beans, peas and maize for 5 years, as well as being a farmer. He is 49 years old and married with four children. He is able to make 80,000 Ugandan shillings of profit every week and this helps run his home and business.

His clients vary from hotel owners and housewives to retailers. Justus says he still runs his farming business given the fact that it is a dependable means of livelihood in Uganda. Justus says he has managed to give all of his children an education using profits from his businesses. Justus needs a loan for business expansion so that he can buy and sell more produce.

loans.use: to buy more beans, peas, maize and others for resale.

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en: Mkhitar M. lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Tufashen.  He is a widower with three children. His two daughters are 17 and 21 years old and his son is 13 years old.  Mkhitar has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for the past 22 years.  He considers himself to be an honest and hard working person.  He is looking for a loan to purchase seeds and animal feed.  According to his business plan, this investment will increase the family income by 25 percent.  Mkhitar’s dream is to have his three children graduate from university.  He would also like to renovate the family home.  He is grateful that he is able to support his family as a farmer and is proud to live in Armenia.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and animal feed

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 27 years old. She has one child who is nine months old. Her husband sells different types of foodstuffs including sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes and cassava. Vestine owns a restaurant where she sells African dishes. She has had this business since 2009. With her business, she was able to buy a piece of land. She plans to save until she can afford to buy a cow. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita M. is from the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. She is 52 years old. Margarita is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Margarita owns & operates a business venture running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, biscuits & instant noodles in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Margarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Margarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (her father). Halima has a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for four years and she works 7 days out of every week.  Halima sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  Halima has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenge(s) for Halima include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and also to own a fully stocked salon.   Halima lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids

To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, candies, shampoo, soap & firewood in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & firewood. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

location.town: Palao, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jonadamu

texts.en: Jonadamu is 33 years old and married with two children who are ages 11 months and 6 years. He owns a shop with different items that are commonly used at home such as matches, salt, sugar, candles etc and he works together with her wife. He is requesting a loan to buy more items such as salt, sugar, candles etc and fill his shop so that she wins the clientele around and makes more profits. He plans to save all her profits until she is able to build a family house.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit S. is from the village of Akhouryan in the Shirak region of Armenia. Anahit has been an agricultural entrepreneur for 20 years. In Akhouryan, the main economic activity for the population is farming.  

In order for Anahit to meet the spring sowing season, she needs a loan to purchase potato seeds and also animal feed. She expects the family income to increase by 20 percent with this investment.  

Anahit is happily married with three children – two daughters (32 and 33 years old) and a 24-year-old son. With the additional income, Anahit will continue supporting her family and save some money to renovate the family home.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and animal feed.

loans.name: Roswil

texts.en:
Meeting life’s challenges head on is a habit that could be developed only by the brave. Roswil T., 32, does just that. Roswil is only a high school graduate but right now she manages her own micro-business as she learns entrepreneurship as a community partner in CCT*. She is married to a vendor, Renato, and mothers her three children, two of whom are still studying in elementary school while the other one is not yet of school age. Together, they live in Brgy. Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines.

Roswil takes the opportunity of selling turnips in her local community as summer is the best season for turnips in the Philippines. She buys these vegetables from wholesalers and retails the same ones with minimal mark up.  Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP).

To help her grow her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to purchase sacks of turnips to sell in her local community. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Roswil acknowledges that no challenges is too hard to deal with. She knows that the Lord will enable her to overcome and uphold the future of both her children and her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she reads.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of turnips for selling.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 35 years old.  She has 5 children who are between the ages of 2 and 14.  She sells children and adult second-hand clothing at the market.  She has been selling clothes for 7 years and this business has helped her meet her and her family's needs.   It has also enabled her to build a small family house.  Gloria is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtsetseg is 49 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in Kherlen city in Dornod Aimag, the far eastern province of Mongolia 750 kms away from the capital. She has been running a bakery business for 7 years and has regular customers who buy her products. Her husband is unemployed at the moment. Finding a job in the remote city of Kherlen is quite hard because it is located far from the capital and other towns and is  undeveloped. 

Enkhtsetseg’s eldest son runs a transportation business. He has an old Russian truck and transportd goods over long distances. Because his truck is very old and uneconomical in terms of petrol use, he wants to sell it and buy another truck in better condition which uses less petrol, carries more load, and is reliable. The loan Mrs. Enkhtsetseg is requesting will be used to replace her son's old truck for a better one.

loans.use: buy a better truck for her son's transport business

loans.name: Oula

texts.ar: علا في عمر 19 سنة عزباء تعمل في بيع الفولارد والشالات لها في عملها 3 سنوات تريد ان تحسن من وضعها المادي والاجتماعي وخاصة انها تسعد للزواج تساعد اهلها وتؤمن لهم بعض حاجياتهم فهي الاكبر وتسعى دائما ال شد الروابط الاسرية مع الاهل تعتمد على نفسها في تأمين مستقبلها فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وتوسيع المحل تريد تكبير المحل بحيث يصبح بامكانها ان تؤمن عدد اكبر من البضائع وان تزيد من مدخولها خاصة انها مقدمه على زفاف لا يوجد لديها الكثير من العوائق سوى بعض المادة وتحسين المحل لانه بحاجة الى بعض الديكور
texts.en: Oula is 19 years old and unmarried. She works selling scarves and shawls, and she has three years of experience in this line of work. She would like to improve her financiA. situation and her sociA. status, especially since she is going to be married soon. She helps support her family by providing them with certain essentiA. items as she is the oldest child in her family and always strives to strengthen her ties with her family. She is self-reliant in securing her future, and with a loan from A.-Majmoua, she would like to buy new goods to expand her store. She wants to enlarge her store so that she can offer more items for sale and thereby increase her income. Part of her motivation is that she is about to be married. The only thing that stands in the way of her improving her store is a lack of materiA. means, as her store is in need of some decoration.

loans.use: buy more scarves and shawls for her scarf and shawl store as well as generally improve and expand her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary G. is from the village of Purok De Oro, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Mary is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Mary owns & operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies such as steamed cakes (or siopao) in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mary joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & fund working capital.

Mary is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, eggs nd ground meat. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 28 years old.  She has 2 children who are 6 and 8 years old. Her husband sells foodstuffs while Jeannette plaits hair. She has been able to pay for her children’s school fees from the profits of her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a salon hair cutting machine.  Jeannette plans to open up another salon in a different place in the future.

loans.use: buy a hair cutting machine for her salon

loans.name: Azim

texts.en:
K. Azim is 31 years old. He is married and has three children. From the time he was young, Azim was learning to work in the small business of cattle and sheep breeding. He sells them in the market of Isfara and he has been in this business for 10 years. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children, and see them as professional, ethical and hardworking. For this reason, Azim is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni. He wants with this loan to buy sheep and cattle. Azim is thankful for your support. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle and sheep

loans.name: Jocily

texts.en:
Jocily G. is from the village of Looc, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Jocily is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Jocily owns & operates a tailolring business, providing general alterations & sewing services to local community members. She also sells used clothing (or ukay-ukay).   She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jocily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase sewing supplies such as needles & threads. 

Jocily is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional fabrics & tailoring materials. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is 30 years old and lives in the Paynesville area.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is a physician assistant at a local clinic.  With all three children in school, both she and her husband have to struggle to make ends meet.

Abigail started her seamstress business four years ago and now has a lot of customers.  On a daily basis, she has to deliver not less than ten suits per day.  Abigail is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth and a sewing machine for her shop.  She hopes to have her own boutique that will sell only her own clothes.

loans.use: buy cloth and a sewing machine for her tailor shop

John Mhar is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase more canned goods, snack foods & beverages to resell. This will be his 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره38 سنة متزوج وله 6 اولاد يعمل في محل لبيع الكومبيوتر له في عمله 5 سنوات يريد ان يزيد من مدخول محله وان يور المصلحة فهو يتميز بالعمل الجيد والجودة في العمل والخدمة السريعة للزبون وله خبرة كبيرة في هذه العمل فهو متطور ويلاحق دائما التكنولوجيا يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء كومبيوترات جديدة وطاولات وكراسي لتوسيع العمل حتى يصبح يضم عدد اكبر من الزبائن يريد ان يؤمن لأبناء قريته العمل الجيد والشامل وحتى يزيد ايضا من مدخول عائلته واولاده وتأمين العيش الجيد لهم وتعليمهم بشكل افضل فهو اب عطوف وحنون ويسعى الى تأمين الراحة والتطور له ولعائلته لا يعاني صعوبات سوى بعض الصعوبات التنافسية
texts.en: Ali is 38 years old and married with six children. He works selling computers, and he has five years of experience in this line of work. He would like to increase his store's revenues, as he stands out in his field due to his good and timely service, as well as the high quality of his establishment. He has a lot of experience in his field, as he is always looking for ways to develop his business and consistently follows new developments in the field of technology. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy new computers, desks, and chairs in order to expand his business and thereby increase his customer base. He wants to provide the youth of his town with good and broad work experience. In addition, he would like to increase his income since he strives to secure a good life for his family as well as a quality education for his children. He is a loving and caring father, and he always tries to provide himself and his family with a comfortable life and opportunities to develop themselves. The only difficulties he has in his business are from the competition in his field.

loans.use: buy desks, chairs and computers in order to expand his computer store.

loans.name: Fauste

texts.en: Fausta is 35 years old.  She has 6 children who are between 2 ½  and 16 years old. Her husband is a teacher.  Fausta owns a general store in which she sells books, pencils and milk. She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her store. With the profits generated, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: add inventory to her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase firewood and pay wages

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude N. lives in the Kalerwe neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Gertrude has a business of selling milk. She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days out of every week. Gertrude sells her products in a retail shop. 

Gertrude has requested for  a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use  to buy more cans of milk. She also generates additional income from a motorcycle for hire. The main business challenges for Gertrude include transportation, thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also  to start making her  ghee. 

Gertrude lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees

loans.use: to buy more cans of milk

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 44 سنة متزوج وله ربع اولاد يعمل في بيع اللحوم والدجاج له في عمله 30 سنة يعاني علي من بعض الصعوبات المادية في تغيير الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لديه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء براد واجهة لعرض اللحوم والدجاج وتطوير وتحسين المحل حيث انه يريد ان يزيد من مدخول المحل وتطوير العمل يحب ان يعلم اولاده بشكل جيد وان يؤمن مستقبل جيد لهم خاصة وانهم في طور النمو وتأمين المستقبل علي طموح محب للعمل له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه وقد ساهم القرض السابق من المجموعة الى تحسين الوضع المادي له وتطوير العمل
texts.en: Ali is 44 years old and married with four children. He works selling chicken and meat. He has 30 years of experience in this line of work. Material difficulties are preventing Ali from improving his material situation and social status. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy a refrigerator for displaying his chicken and meat and thereby improve his store. He would like to increase his income and develop his business. He wants to provide his children with a good education and secure a good future for them, especially since they are in a formative stage in their lives. Ali is ambitious and likes to work. He has customers from his community and from among his neighbors. His last loan from al-Majmoua helped him to improve his material situation as well as develop his business.

loans.use: buy a display refrigerator to improve his butcher store.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg, a 43-year-old widow, lives with her mother in her apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her only son Enkhmend 27 is married and lives with his wife. He works in city's rescue department. 

Mrs. Altantsetseg started her retail business in 2006 by selling shoes. Now she rents a space inside the shop and sells cosmetic items. Her business is growing and during past few years she has managed to buy a plot of land for her son and a car for herself. Now she is planning to increase her profits by increasing her working capital and buying more products to sell. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.use: to increase working capital by buying more cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 55 years old, married to Esther Chelagat, and has seven children aged 32, 28, 25, 20, 17, 15 and seven years old. He makes bricks in Chepterit and has been in operation for a period of three years getting a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He has taken out his first loan from KADET Ltd. of 20,000 KES and intends to use it to purchase firewood and pay wages to the labourers he hires when preaparing the bricks. The profits will be used to educate his children. 

He hopes to have a happy family which is well cared for.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and pay employees

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 33 years old, married to Peninah, and has two children aged five and three years old. He has been selling vegetable seedlings in Kiptenden trading centre in Kabarnet town for six years, and makes a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

He has applied for a fourth loan of 50,000 KES from KADET Ltd., after he repaid the previous loans successfuly. He hopes to use this money to buy varieties of seeds for planting to raise seedlings for resale. The income will be used to improve the welfare of his young family and also improve his farm. 

He dreams of having a very sustainable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting

loans.name: Sintei Ole Sambaruan

texts.en:
Sintei Ole Sambaruan M. is 23 years old, single and supports his parents. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which yields good returns. 

He learned about KADET Ltd. through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to buy farm inputs and prepare the land for planting. 

He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build new house and educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy and build rental houses and buy livestock for sale to generate more income. He is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and prepare land for planting

loans.name: Raghierd

texts.ar: رغيد عمره 22 سنة غير متزوج يعمل في محل لبيع الاقراص المدمجة والافلام وتعهد حفلات له في عمله 7 سنوات يحب عمله ويرى فيه طموح كبير بان يصبح منسق حفلات يريد دائما ملاحقة كل ما هو متطور ومتجدد يسعى الى تأمين مستقبل جيد له ولعائلته خاصة انه يساعد اهله لكي يتمكن من استمرار العلاقات الاسرية فهو جدي في العمل طموح يتميز بحبه لعمله وابتكاره فيه لا يعاني من منافسة في محيطه لكن ما ينقصه هو بعض المادة ليتمكن من دعم عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء جهاز عرض للانارة وتقوية المحل وايضا شراء جهاز يستعمله في الحفلات وهو ( mixer) له زبائن كثر من المناطق المجاورة لقريته ومن قريته واصدقائهله شغف كبير في عمله وذلك ايضا من دعم من اهله
texts.en: Raghierd is 22 years old and unmarried. He works in a store which sells movies and CDs, and organizes parties. He has seven years of experience in this line of work. He likes his work and sees in it the possibility to realize his aspiration of becoming a party planner. He continuously follows developments and whatever is new in his field. He is trying to secure a good future for himself and for his family, particularly because he helps to support his family and thereby maintain his relationship with his family. He is ambitious and serious about his work, and he stands out in his field through his love for his work and his innovation. He isn't having problems from competition in his community, but he does lack certain material resources which he needs to support his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy display lighting equipment to improve his store, as well as a mixer, which he uses in putting on parties. He has many customers from his own town, from neighboring towns and from among his friends. He has a very strong passion for both his work and for supporting his family.

loans.use: buy display lighting equipment for his media store and a mixer to DJ at parties.

loans.name: Lasiti Sankale

texts.en:
Lasiti Sankale L. is married and supports a family of six. He does wheat farming on his own piece of land. He has been doing this for the past six years.

Lasiti has been a good client. He repaid his previous loan well and without complication. This will be his third loan. He plans to purchase certified wheat seeds from Kenya Seed Company and hire manpower for land preparation. 

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to large scale and pay school fees for his children. He dreams of improving his living standard and seeing his children prosper. He is a conscientious man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase certified wheat seeds and hire manpower to prepare his land

loans.name: Maleyo Ole

texts.en:
Maleyo Ole T. is 26 years old. He is married to Sein T. and blessed with two children who are in school. He has been farming on his own piece of land for a period of five years.

He learned about KADET LTD from other men in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his third loan. He plans to buy eight bags of Kenya certified wheat seed and eight bags of fertilizer. 

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to build a permanent home and expand his farming activity. His dream is to construct rental houses and educate his children in order to have a better future. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives.

loans.use: to buy Kenya certified wheat seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is 26 years old, married to Ben Okelo and has three children aged eight, six, and three years old. She owns a grocery business in Mosoriot trading centre in Kapsabet and has been in this business for two years. She earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES.
Benta has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES and plans to use the money to purchase vegetables and fruits for her grocery business. This is her second loan after servicing her first loan successfully. The profits will be used to educate her children and also improve the status of her grocery business. Benta hopes that she will be able to educate her children to greater levels.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en: Nelie is 37 years old and has three children who are between the ages of five and 17. Her husband sells shoes. Nelie has been selling tomatoes in the market on a wholesale scale for the past 11 years. This business has enabled her pay school fees for her children and pays her house rent as well. She is requesting a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell and make more profits. She plans to buy a piece of land with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes.

loans.name: Dania

texts.ar: دانيا مطلقة لها 3 اولاد عمرها 34 سنة تعمل في بيع الالبسة الجاهزة الولادية والنسائية من منزلها لها في عملها 13 سنة تعمل من اجل تأمين العيش الكريم لها ولأفراد عائلتها تريد لهم العيش الجيد والمستقبل الجيد تريد تعليم اولادها بشكل يؤمن لهم مستقبل جيد فهي ام اكثر اهتمام لها هو اولادها خاصة انها هي من تعيلهم لها اهتمام مميز بالعائلة خاصة انها امرأة مطلقة تعتمد على ذاتها في تطوير نفسها واولادها فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى دفع الاقساط المدرسية لأولادها حتى يتمكنوا من متابعة مسيرتهم التعليمية خاصة انها هي لم تستطع ان تكمل تعليمها فهي تحلم بتحقيق هذا لأولادها لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها حيث انها تتميز بالاسعار الجيدة والنوعية الجيدة تطمح بفتح محل  لها خاصة انها تبيع الملابس في منزلها يضم عدد كبير من البضاعة
texts.en: Dania is divorced and has three children. She is 34 years old and makes a living by selling women's and children's clothes from her house. She has 13 years of experience in this line of work. She works in order to secure a respectable life for herself and for the members of her family. She wants them to have a good life and a good future. She wants to provide them with an education that will grant them a good future, as she is a mother and her biggest concern in life is her children. Furthermore, she is the one who provides for her children. She also has a particularly strong concern for her family because she is a divorced woman who must rely on herself to improve her and her children's lives. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to pay for her children's school tuition fees so that they can continue their education. She herself was not able to complete her education, and her dream is to enable her children complete their education. She has customers from her community and from among her neighbors as she stands out in her field due to her good prices and the quality of the items in her store. She aspires to open her own store since she is currently running her business out of her home and has many items for sale.

loans.use: pay her children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Solina

texts.en: Solina is 27 years old.  She has 3 children who are between 3 and 11 years old.   She is married to a cook.  Solina sells fresh milk and has been doing this for the past 1 ½ years. This business has enabled her meet her family's needs, feed her children, and pay their school fees. She is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of milk in order to make more profit.

loans.use: buy more milk to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a carpenter. He is 51 years old and married to Julia Jebii who is a business lady. They are blessed with four children who are 21, 18, 12 and 8 years old. He does his carpentry work in Kipsigak Trading Centre, Kapsabet and he has been in this business for a period of eight years. He earns a monthly income of KES. 15,000.

He has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD. This is his second loan. He repaid the previous loan successfully.  He hopes to use this money to purchase a grinding machine and timber for the workshop. 

The profits will be used to educate his children and look after their welfare. He hopes to have a stable family.

loans.use: to purchase a grinding machine and timber

loans.name: Pushati

texts.en:
Pushati O. D. is 43 years old. He is married to Gladys D. who is a housewife and they have six children. Pushati is a farmer and he has been in this business for the last ten years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.
Pushati learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through a marketing campaign carried out by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, which he will use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profits from this loan to settle the loan and expand his farming business. His hopes and dreams are to become a large-scale farmer, buy a bigger piece of land for farming and build rental houses. He is a painstaking man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Leatitia

texts.en: Leatitia is 36 years old.  She has one child who is 17 years old and is in school.  Her husband is a farmer.  Leatitia sells tomatoes wholesale at the market. She has been selling tomatoes for the past 8 years.  With the help of her business, she is able to meet both her and her child’s needs.  Leatitia is requesting a loan to purchase large quantities of tomatoes to make more profit.

loans.use: buy large quantities of tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To plant napier grass and build a fence

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar: احمد عمره 35 سنة متزوج يعمل في بيع الكواتم للموتورات له في عمله 9 سنوات يحب عمله يسعى الى تأمين مستقبل جيد له ولعائلته يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله فهو محب للعمل يتميز بالدقة في العمل والقلة في محيطه فهو لا يعاني من المنافسة سوى من بعض النقص المادي التي يعيق تطور عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل موتورات وكواتم وايضا يريد ان يطور عمله من خلال شراء الحديد لتصنيع الكواتم فهو طموح يمتلك عقل مدبر في العمل له زبائن من اصحاب المصالح الكبيرة في الورش فهو دائم التطور والتقدم في مجال تطوير العمل
texts.en: Ahmad is 35 years old and married. He sells engine mufflers for a living. He has nine years of experience in his work, and he likes his work. He is trying to secure a good future for himself and for his family, and he would like to increase his income. He likes to work, and he stands out in his field due to his attention to detail and the lack of competition in his field in the region he lives in. However, material difficulties are hindering him from developing his business. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy goods for his store, including engines and mufflers. He would also like to use the loan to buy steel since he would like to develop his store by manufacturing mufflers. He is ambitious and organized in his work. He has customers from among the owners of the workshops in his area as he is always developing his business further and progressing in his field.

loans.use: to purchase items for his muffler shop such as engines, engine mufflers, and steel for manufacturing mufflers .

loans.name: Kitunga Tukore Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Ivan is the leader of the Kitunga Tukore group in Kihihi. He is 27 years old, married, and has one child. He has a retail shop that deals in general merchandise at the Kanyasti trading center in Kitunga.  From this business he is able to generate 400,000 UGX monthly in income.  He is also involved in the selling of tea leaves and it is from this business that he got the capital to open up a retail shop. 

Ivan is very hard-working and his dream is to educate his children and expand his business. He is quick to say that the loans have enabled him to improve his business working capital and he is very grateful for that. He needs a loan to be able to buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items for his store.

loans.use: buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, and other items for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes for planting, chemicals, and sheep for fattening

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 29 years old.  She is married and has two children -- one is 1 month old, and the other is 2 years old.  Clementine works with her husband.  She owns a general store in which she sells rice, salt, and some plastic products such as cups and basins. She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her shop and hence make more profit.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old and married to Alfred Odinga who is a secondary school teacher. They have two children who are five and three years old.  Catherine owns a cosmetic shop in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for a period of five years, earning a monthly income of KES. 8,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD. This is her first loan, and she hopes to use the money to buy stock for her cosmetic shop like; hair weaves worth KES. 5,000, body lotions worth KES. 3,000, hair treatments worth KES. 10,000, body creams worth KES. 2,000, and hair chemicals for KES. 10,000. 

The profits will be saved to enable her to open another cosmetic shop in the town. She hopes to purchase a plot and build her own permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase business stock for her cosmetic shop

loans.name: Kezie

texts.en: Kezie is a mother of 3 children who are between 1 and 3 years old.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Kezie sells different kinds of fish, including both big and small fish. This business has enabled her feed her children as well as buy a piece of land. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell to  make more profit and enable her to develop herself.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30 years old and married to Beatrice. They have two children who are 4 years old and 7 months old.  Stephen owns a shop in Ndurio trading centre in Kapsabet town and has been in the business for a period of three years. He earns an income of KES 10,000 monthly.

He has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. This is his first loan and he hopes to use the money to purchase sugar, wheat flour, and cooking oil. 

The profits will be used to increase the stock for the business. He hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, wheat flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es:
Trabajar desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche no es un sacrificio para Diana María M. I. quien después de quedar viuda y convertirse en madre cabeza de hogar para sacar adelante a su hija, esta luchadora decidió crear su propio negocio, un almacén de ropa interior que se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos.

Aunque asumir las riendas del hogar no ha sido fácil para esta emprendedora, sus deseos de salir adelante y de ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hija, es lo que la motiva a seguir adelante pues en el futuro espera que su almacén crezca hasta el punto de ser reconocido e incrementar sus ventas. 

Actualmente, Diana necesita de un crédito para comprar surtido de pijamas y ropa interior el cual será de gran utilidad para seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Working from 8:00am until 9:00pm is not a sacrifice for Diana Maria Marin I., who after being widowed became the head of her household in order to help her daughter get ahead. This fighter decided to create her own business, an intimate apparel store that has become her only source of income.

Although taking the reins of the household has not been easy for this entrepreneur, her desire to get ahead and to give her daughter a better future is what motivates her to continue forward. In the future she hopes that her store grows until it is well-known and sales increase.

Currently, Diana needs a loan to stock up on pajamas and underwear which will be very useful for continuing her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies of pajamas and underwear.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar: احمد عمره27 سنة متزوج يعمل في زراعة الأراضي الزراعية له في عمله 4 سنوات يعمل بجد ونشاط يتميز بالعمل الجيد والخبرة الواسعة يريد ان يحسن من مجتمعه وان يزيد من مدخوله يريد دعم مصلحته من خلال طلبه قرض من المجموعة يريد شراء رابيد للمصلحة لنقل البضاعة له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة على الصعيد الاقتصادي والاجتماعي له زبائن من قريته يعاني من بعض الصعوبات المادية والاقتصادية يتميز بالجهد والالتزام والمهارة في العمل
texts.en: Ahmad is 27 years old and married. He farms for a living, and he has four years of experience in this line of work. He works very hard and stands out in his field due to the quality of his work and his wide experience in this type of work. He would like to improve his community and increase his income. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy a truck (model "Rapid") to help him move his goods. He has a good history with al-Majmoua, and he received the full support of his family during his last loan. In regards to the economic and social aspects of his life, he has customers from his town, but he is currently having some material and economic difficulties. He stands out in his work through his skill, his commitment to his work, and the large amount of effort he puts into his work.

loans.use: buy a truck (model "Rapid") to help move the goods he produces on his farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a mother of 2 children who are 3 and 4 years old.  She is 30 years old. Her husband sells foodstuffs.  Jane owns a restaurant which she has been running for the past 14 years. With the profits from her restaurant, she pays her children’s school fees and built a small family house. 

Jane is requesting a loan to buy restaurant equipment and supplies such as plates, chairs, a charcoal stove and utensils.   From the profits she plans to make, she plans to add to her savings to buy a cow.

loans.use: buy equipment and supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Alba Edith

texts.es:
Trabajar vendiendo productos por catálogo desde su casa con el fin de contribuir a solventar los gastos del hogar y continuar atendiendo las labores propias de la casa fue la decisión que Alba Edith H. tomó desde hace 4 años, así equilibraría un poco las necesidades que enfrentaba su familia debido al trabajo inestable de su esposo. 

Desde entonces, Alba Edith es una consagrada a su negocio y como ella misma lo afirma, se siente orgullosa de contribuir con una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. 

A sus 49 años de edad, esta emprendedora espera mantener un buen nivel de ventas que le permitan sostener su negocio en el tiempo. Actualmente Alba Edith necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido de los catálogos que llega en producción y así mantener un inventario adicional que le permita generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Four years ago Alba Edith H. decided to work from her home selling catalog items, with the goal of helping with her family's costs while continuing to take care of her household tasks. This way she balanced a little the needs of her family caused by her husband's unstable employment. 

Since then, Alba Edith has established herself in her business, and as she herself affirms, she feels proud to contribute to a better quality of life for her family. 

At 49 years of age, this entrepreneur hopes to maintain a good level of sales that will allow her to sustain her business over time. Currently Alba Edith needs a loan to buy stock from the catalogs that arrive in production and therefore maintain an additional inventory that will allow her to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy catalog stock to maintain inventory.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.ar: عباس عمره 48 سنة متزوج وله 5 اولاد يعمل من اكثر من 25 سنة في حدادة السيارات يحب عمله ويرى من خلال التطور والتميز يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يؤمن العيش الجيد له ولعائلته يسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تحسين وضع العمل وشراء معدات جديدة دهان ومكنة سحب للسيارات يتميز بالخبرة في العمل والدقة له معارف وزبائن من محيطه واصدقائه يتميز عمله بالنظافة يوجد عنده بعض الصعوبات حيث انه يرغب بمواكبة التطور في العمل ولا ينقصه سوى المادة يريد ان يوسع عمله وان يصبح لديه عدد اكبر من الزبائن
texts.en: Abbas is 48 years old and married with five children. He has worked for more than 25 years as a car repairman, and he likes his work. By developing his business and distinguishing his from other businesses, he would like to increase his income and secure a good life for himself and his family. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he will try to improve his business by buying new equipment, paint and a towing machine. He stands out in his work due to his experience, his attention to detail, and the orderliness of his business. He knows many of the people in his community, and he has customers from his community and from among his friends. Even though he would like to develop his business, he is having some difficulty doing this as he lacks the material means to do so. He is otherwise very prepared to develop his business. He would like to expand his business and increase his customer base.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for his car shop, including paint and a towing machine.

loans.name: Virgnie

texts.en: Virgnie is 32 years old.  She has 2 children who are 3 and 7 years old and are both in school. She owns a general store in which she sells sugar, shoes, radios, etc. This business has enabled her to pay her children’s school fees, pay house rent, and feed her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy more items for her shop in order to make more profit.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Elijah Barno

texts.en:
Elijah Barno K. K. is a young man of twenty-two years. He is married and has no children, but lives in Eldoret town with two relatives for whom he provides basic needs. He has been in this motorcycle business for two years and gets a monthly income of about $293.


This will be Elijah's 2nd loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his first loan successfully. With this loan he plans to buy a brand new motorcycle which will cost him 80,000 KES. 


With the income he is going to get he plans to repay the loan. In future he wants to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Jhon Sebastián

texts.es:
Aunque Jhon Sebastián C. A. siempre quiso entrar a la universidad, sus recursos económicos no le alcanzaron para lograr este sueño, por eso, desde hace algún tiempo se dedicó a trabajar en una ferretería, allí aprendió el oficio de elaborar llaves y otras manualidades propias de la cerrajería, fue entonces cuando vio la oportunidad de crear su propio negocio. 

En un pequeño espacio en su casa, Jhon Sebastián adecuó su indumentaria de trabajo y aunque su negocio es pequeño sus ganas de progresar son enormes, por ello, sueña con crecer su negocio hasta convertirlo en una ferretería reconocida que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar una máquina duplicadora de llaves lo que le permitirá agilizar su trabajo y ser más productivo.
texts.en:
Although Jhon Sebastián C. A. always wanted to enter the university, his economic resources were not sufficient for him to achieve this dream. For this reason, he began some time ago to work in a hardware store. There he learned to make keys and other manual skills related to locksmithing. It was then that he saw the opportunity to create his own business.

Jhon Sebastián has arranged his working tools in a little space in his house, and although his business is small, his will to progress is enormous. He dreams of expanding his business until he converts it into a well known hardware store, which will permit him to improve his quality of life.

Now this entrepreneur needs a loan to buy a machine that duplicates keys, which will allow him to speed up his work and become more productive.

loans.use: to buy a machine that duplicates keys.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 34 years old. His spouse, Jane, is a business lady.  They are blessed with three children, ages six, four, and one.  He operates his business in the Ndurio trading centre where he buys and sells dry maize from local suppliers. He has been in this business for a period of seven years, earning a monthly income of KES. 5,000.

George has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD.  He hopes to use this loan amount to purchase dry maize from the local suppliers in Iten market.  The profits will be used to expand the shop which his spouse operates.

He hopes to educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: purchase dry maize for resale

loans.name: Aniss

texts.ar: انيس اعزب عمره 29 سنة يعمل في محل لبيع الحلويات له في عمله 6 سنوات يمتلك خبرة كبيرة في هذا العمل حيث انه ورثه من ولاده يتميز بحبه للعمل وابتكاره فيه اصناف جديدة لكن ما يعيق تطوره هي المادة حيث انه يريد ان يطور العمل وان يدخل ماكنات ومواد اولية جديدة ليزيد من مدخول العمل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية وتسجيل سيارته التي سيتخدمها في العمل فهو طموح ولكن له السمعة الجيدة من القرض السابق من المجموعة حيث ساهم في دعم عمله له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واصدقائه
texts.en: Aniss is 29 years old and unmarried. He works in a pastry shop, and he has six years of experience in this line of work. He is very knowledgeable of this business because inherited it from his father. He stands out in his work due to his love for his work, and due to his innovation. He has created several new types of sweets. However, material concerns are preventing his continued progress. He would like to improve his business and increase his income by bringing in new equipment into his shop, as well as by obtaining more supplies. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy these supplies, and in addition, he would like to register his car, which he plans to start using in his work. He is ambitious, and he has a good reputation with al-Majmoua, as his previous experience taking out a loan was good. He used his previous loan to support his business. He has customers from his community, and from among his neighbors and friends.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sugar and honey for his pastry/sweet shop, and to register his car so that he can use it in his business.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 31 years old.  She has 2 children who are 1 and 2 ½ years old.  Vestine owns and operates a shop in which she sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, coffee, sugar and powder milk. This business has enabled her to buy a piece of land. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell and make more profits. She plans to save all her profits and build a family house.

loans.use: buy items to resell such as cooking oil, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Batoul

texts.ar: بتول متزوجة ولها اربع اولاد تعمل في بيع الثياب عمرها 37 سنة لها في عملها سنتين تعمل بجد لها اربع اولاد تسعى الى تعليمهم ودعمهم فهي ام عطوفة تريد ان تؤمن المستقبل الجيد لأولادها فهي غير متعلمة وهدفها هو تحسين وضع اولادها العلمي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة موسمية وشراء الطحين لصنع المناقيش والمرقوق فهي تحب عملها وتسعى دائما الى زيادة البضاعة حتى تتمكن من تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي لها ولعائلتها
texts.en: Batoul is 37 years old and married with four children. She works selling clothes, and she has two years of experience in this line of work. She works hard since she is a caring mother and strives to provide a good education for her children as well as support them in all areas of life in general. She would like to secure a good future for her children. She herself is not well educated, and her goal with respect to her children is to provide them with good educational opportunities. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to buy new seasonal goods for her store as well as flour which she can use to make manakish (similar to pizza) and markook (a particular Arab dish that requires dough). She likes her work and is always trying to increase the goods she offers in her store so that she can improve her and her family's financial situation and social status.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes for her clothing store.

loans.name: Cielo De Jesús

texts.es:
Después de sufrir la muerte de su único hijo, Cielo de Jesús O. A. de 60 años decidió seguir adelante y luchar por solventarse, pues su hijo era el que se hacía cargo de los gastos del hogar. 

Cielo dice todavía con una expresión de tristeza en el rostro que los golpes de la vida son los que también impulsan a seguir adelante, pues ahora su legumbrería es su única fuente de ingresos y es la que le permite mantenerse en pie. 

Actualmente, Cielo necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido, específicamente en artículos de la canasta familiar y legumbres, así incrementará su inventario y logrará incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
After suffering the death of her only child, Cielo de Jesús O. A., aged 60, decided to forge ahead and struggle to support herself, since her son was the one who supported the household. 

Cielo says, still with a look of sadness on her face, that the blows that life has given her have also driven her to keep on going. Now her vegetable store is her only source of income that lets her keep on standing. 

At present, Cielo needs a loan to buy a variety of products, specifically, items for the family shopping basket and vegetables. In this way, she will increase her inventory and her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables and family shopping basket products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron K. C. is a man of fifty-six years, and is the married father of seven. He lives in Mosop on the outskirts of Eldoret town. His wife Salome is a teacher and adds to the family income.  Haron is a maize farmer and has been in this business for twenty-one years now. He gets a monthly income of about $188.


This will be Haron's 4th loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the income he is going to get he wants to pay school fees for his children and also plow some back into his farming business. 


In future Haron wants to educate his children and also continue with his farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maize seedlings.

loans.name: Peter Kinga

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last ten years.  He is 47 years old, married to Mary Njeri and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Salma

texts.ar: سلمى عمرها 44 سنة تعمل في بيع الخضار والفواكه لها في عملها 3سنوات تحب عملها وهي متميزة بالعمل حيث انها المرأة الوحيدة في منطقتها تعمل في هذا المجال هي امرأة متزوجة ولها ولدان تحب ان تؤمن لهم المستقبل الجيد والعيش الكريم تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة خضروات وفواكه موسمية ودعم مصلحة بيع الفحم لها حب كبير للعمل حيث انها تتمكن ان تؤمن التعليم الجيد لأولادها وان تعتمد على نفسها خاصة في ظل انها هي التي تقوم بالصرف على عائلتها فهي مثابرة مجدة وتتميز بين جيرانها وزبائنها بالدقة في العمل والاسعار الرخيصة المناسبة للجميع
texts.en: Salma is 44 years old and works selling fruits and vegetables. She has three years of experience in this line of work. She likes her work and stands out in her field since she is the only woman working in it in her area. She is married and has two children. She would like to secure a good future and a respectable life for her children. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to buy new goods for her store including seasonal fruits and vegetables, as well as support the side of her business in which she sells coal. She has a great love for her work because it enables her to rely on herself and provide a good education for her children. This is all the more important since she is the one who financially supports her family. She is diligent in her work, and she is known among her neighbors and her customers for her attention to detail and for her low prices which everyone can pay.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables and coal to sell in her store.

loans.name: Bernard Kamau

texts.en:
Bernard has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 40 years old, married to Esther Wanjiru, and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 30,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Bernard hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Thomas Mwai

texts.en:
Thomas has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 47 years old, married to Mary Wanjiru, and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 12,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Thomas hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Andrew Wambari

texts.en:
Andrew has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twelve years.  He is 35 years old, married to Cecilia Wanjiru, and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 20,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Andrew hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny J. Y. is a woman of forty-four years, widowed and the mother of five children. They live in Mosop on the outskirts of Eldoret town. She does maize farming and has been doing so for eleven years now. She gets a monthly income of about $150 from selling the maize.


This will be Winny's fourth loan from  KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer. With the income that she will get she wants to buy a posho mill machine (machine used for making maize flour), and also educate her children. 


In future she wants to educate her children, and also continue with maize farming.

loans.use: to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josianne

texts.en: Josianne is 32 years old.  She has 5 children who are between 2 and 15 years old. Her husband  has a motorcycle which he uses for business.  Josianne sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as sweet potatoes, irish potatoes and beans.  She has been doing this business for 11 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs. With her profits she plans to buy home equipment and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: John Mwangi

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last thirteen years.  He is 47 years old, married to Martha Wanjiru, and they have one child..  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 20,000 KES well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Meteur Ole

texts.en:
Meteur has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last 28 years.  He is 50 years old, married to Neema Ole Meteur, and they have six children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his sixth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Meteur hopes to become a leading farmer in Naviasha town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Phenias

texts.en: Phenias is 26 years old. He is single and hard working. He sells different kinds of foodstuffs, such as beans and different kinds of flours. He enjoys his business and it has enabled him to build two small houses away form town. He is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs. He plans to buy a house in town in the future.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, such as beans and flour, for resale

loans.name: Kashumpai Kirmusoi

texts.en:
Kashumpai has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years. She is 32 years old and married to Edward K.. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

In the future, Kashumpai hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary Wanjiku

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 28 years.  She is 56 years old, and a single mother of three children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers, and this will be her third loan.  She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Emmanuel David

texts.es:
Emmanuel de 19 años, es un joven emprendedor que inicio su actividad abriendo una tienda de víveres hace poco tiempo. Poco a poco a incrementado su capital de trabajo. 

El labora diariamente con la ayuda de su madre que a la vez hacen las comprar de mercadería para su negocio. En algunas ocasiones no tiene tiempo de estar en su negocio ya que todavía estudia por eso su mama le ayuda a trabajar vendiendo arroz, bebidas, confites etc.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz aceite azúcar y más productos para su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos. En un futuro desea ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is 19 years old. He is an enterprising young man who started his activity opening a grocery store a little while ago. Little by little, he increased his working capital.    

He works daily with the help of his mother who also helps him buy merchandise for his business. On some occasions, he doesn't have time to be at the business since he is still in school. That is why his mother helps him work, selling rice, beverages, candies, etc. 

With the loan, he wants to buy rice, oil, sugar and more products for his business to increase his income. In the future, he wants to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La falta de oportunidades laborales a las que se vieron muchas veces enfrentados Mariluz O. Velásques y su esposo hicieron que con gran esfuerzo, esta emprendedora iniciara su propio negocio en Medellín. Se trata de la venta de tiras para brasieres y pedrería, lo que le ha permitido contribuir para cubrir los gastos del hogar. 

A sus 35 años de edad Mariluz se siente orgullosa de ser independiente, pues así lucha día a día para salir adelante y cumplir el sueño de tener una gran empresa que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecerle educación superior a sus hijas. 

Enfrentarse a la competencia que existe en el mercado es una de las dificultades que enfrenta, pero a su vez esto la llena de fuerzas para ser cada vez mejor. 

Actualmente Mariluz necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía e insumos, así incrementará su inventario y lograra aumentar sus ventas para caminar hacia el logro de ese sueño, ser empresaria.
texts.en:
Mariluz O. Velásques and her husband are among those who often found themselves confronted with the lack of job opportunities. With great effort, they managed to have this entrepreneurial woman set up her own business in Medellín. It deals in the sale of straps for brassieres and jewelry, and this has permitted her to contribute to covering their household expenses.

At the age of 35, Mariluz feels proud to be independent, and thus she works hard day after day to advance and fulfill her dream of having a large business that will permit her to improve her quality of life and offer a higher education to her daughters.

Confronting the competition that exists in the market is one of the difficulties that face her, but on her part, this fills her with the strength to do better every time.

Now Mariluz needs a loan to buy merchandise and decorative items. Thus she will enlarge her inventory and be able to increase her sales to progress toward the attainment of her dream of being a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and items for decorating brassiere straps.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 26 years old and has two children who are six and eight years old. She sells second-hand clothes in the market and has had her business for the past six years.  She has used some of the profit she made to buy a piece of land. She is requesting this loan in order to buy more clothes for resale.  She plans to reinvest any additional profit she makes back into her business.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Isaboke

texts.en:
Isaboke M. has been operating a retail shop where he sells cereals. He has had this business for two years, and previously sold furniture to earn a living.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.  He hopes to open his own company in the future.  He has requested this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more cereals such as maize and beans.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Isaboke M. is pictured with his wife.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as maize and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 bales of shoes for sale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family (in-laws).    

Sarah sells charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Sarah sells her products from home, at retail.  She also generates additional income through renting rooms and selling second-hand clothes.  

Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.   The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only.   Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is 26 years old and she has 2 children who are between 4 and 7 years old. Her husband is a driver. 

Aline is very hard working.  She sells tomatoes at wholesale and she has been selling tomatoes for 14 years. She has achieved several things; among these, she has been able to renovate her house. Aline is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes and make more profit.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4 bales of second hand shoes.

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Bimala C..  She is married and has 2 children aged 16 and 12.  In 2000, she established her cow-raising business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy a  young milk-giving cow.  In the future, Bimala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buys young milk giving cow

loans.name: Augusta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Augusta; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y fideos, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para productos al por mayor para su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Augusta belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 45 years old, married, and has one child. Augusta divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery business. She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, and noodles. Augusta manages her store from 7am until 10pm. This business enables her to help her children get ahead. Augusta wants to expand and improve her grocery store, so she is requesting a loan to buy products in bulk.

Augusta is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah Kisenyi, who lives in the Ntinda neighbourhood of Kampala, Uganda, is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a rented home that has access to both electricity and piped water, and her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, food and utility bills.

Sarah has been operating a restaurant for three years, working six days a week. She has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bananas, beef, rice, Irish potatoes, chicken and bags of charcoal.

Sarah faces two main business challenges: ever-increasing prices for foodstuffs, and thieves who break into the restaurant to steal her utensils and foodstuffs. Her goal for the business is to own a fully-stocked restaurant.

loans.use: to buy more banana bunches, rice, beef, chicken and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ramila

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Ramila K., who is married and has three children aged 17, 13 and 5, established her cow-raising business in 2000. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. Ramila has already received and repaid four loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent one to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Ramila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry, who is 43 years old and residing with his family in Kingstone Village, a slum, has been running his retail shop there for 10 years.  He also sells clothes on the same premises.  Henry, who also has rental units which earn him extra income, previously baked and sold cakes to earn a living.  He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya he has become financially stable. Henry has requested a loan for 60,000 Kes to expand his business premises and hopes to grow his business within five years and employ more people.

loans.use: to expand his business premises.

loans.name: Lucía Del Socorro

texts.es:
La sonrisa de Lucía del Socorro V. J. demuestra la felicidad que le impone a la vida y  aunque para ella no ha sido fácil por ser madre cabeza de familia de 3 hijos, su dedicación, esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante le han permitido trabajar fuertemente para mejorar su calidad vida y la de su familia. 

Lucía lucha incansablemente y desde hace muchos años conoció la ley del rebusque; chance, licor y mercancía al por mayor, fueron algunas de las labores que esta emprendedora inició con el propósito de salir adelante con su familia. 

Después Lucía se hizo a una cacharrería en la que trabaja desde las 12:00 del día hasta las 12:00 de la noche y aunque su jornada es larga, Lucía está convencida de que sólo así se cumplirá su sueño, tener una gran cacharrería que no sea reconocida sólo en el barrio sino también en la ciudad y así ofrecerle un buen futuro a su familia. 

Actualmente esta emprendedora requiere de un préstamo para comprar surtido y comprar celulares que le permitan incrmentar la venta de minutos que le generarán mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Lucía del Socorro V. J.'s smile shows the happiness she puts into life, although for her it hasn't been easy to be a mother and head of household in a family with 3 children. Her striving, dedication, and eagerness to get ahead have allowed her to work hard to improve her and her family's quality of life.  

Lucía struggles tirelessly and many years ago she got to know the temporary employment, lottery, liquor and wholesale merchandise law. This enterprising woman started various jobs with the purpose of getting ahead with her family.    

Later, Lucía opened a hardware store where she works from 12:00 p.m. to 12:00 a.m. Although her day is long, Lucía is convinced that this is the only way she can accomplish her dream of having a hardware store known not only in the neighborhood, but in the city as well. In this way, she will offer a good future to her family. 

At present, this enterprising woman needs a loan to buy a variety of products and to buy cell phones that will allow her to increase the sale of minutes that will bring in more income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her hardware store and to buy cellphones to sell minutes.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
