La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelida; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de vestidos y ternos, ella vende vestidos y ternos en alquiler, ella tiene una tienda desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de vestidos y ternos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar vestidos y ternos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelida belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old, single, and has one child. Nelida divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling dresses and suits from a rented location. She manages her shop from 9am to 9pm. This business enables her to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand her dress and suit business, so she is requesting a loan to buy these items in bulk.

Nelida is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase dresses and suits in bulk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose B. lives in the Kamwokya Kifumbira neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, two of whom are in school. Rose lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and paying utility bills.   

Rose has a business of a bar. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. Rose sells her products from home, by means of retail. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

Rose has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local gin. 

The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin to resell.

loans.name: Madalene

texts.en:
Madalene is 35 years old. She has two children who are 2 ½  and 4 ½ years old. Her husband is a driver. 

She sells food stuffs. She has done this business for one year and this business has enabled her meet her family needs.She wishes to start up a clothes business as well.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes in addition to the food stuffs she sells.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 46 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y aceite, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 46 years old, married, and has three children. Juana divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery business. She manages her store from 7am to 10pm. Juana sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and oil. She wants to expand her grocery store, so she is requesting a loan to buy products in bulk.

Juana is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Ingrid Del Rosario

texts.es:
Ingrid D. A.  vive con su esposo y su hija D. 24 años  en el municipio D. Galapa,  lugar donD. tiene una miscelánea y  venD. mercancía al detalle como  prendas D. vestir D. bajo costo, papelería, cosméticos  y productos por catálogo D. varias revistas;  este negocio  lo  inició en el año 2008, cuando decidió experimentar con una pequeña vitrina,  que  adquirió D. segunda mano  y unas cuantas mercancías con las que la surtió. Ingrid también ha trabajado eventualmente como promotora D. salud en el hospital D. Galapa, donD. muchos D. sus habitantes  son sus clientes  y acuden a ella para hacer sus compras en épocas especiales, cuando necesitan  dar obsequios en fechas especiales o adquirir productos D. papelería; Ingrid  y su esposo D. oficio A.ñil  han logrado educar a su hija,  que está próxima a recibir su grado como abogada. 
Su sueño ahora se concentra en ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en un almacén, donD. toda la gente D. su pueblo consiga lo que está buscando; por eso mientras ella aspira a ganarse una importante clientela con su buen servicio y teniendo productos que necesitan sus clientes, va ahorrando para permanentemente hacer inyecciones D. capital D. trabajo que contribuyan a este fin; actualmente contribuye con su trabajo en los gastos del hogar; el capital D. trabajo D. su negocio está representado en gran parte por sus inventarios  y  maneja ventas a crédito muy bajas debido a una mala experiencia del pasado que le enseño a que “es mejor ganar poco, pero vendiendo D. contado”.   Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el surtirá  su negocio con mercancías dirigidas a la mujer,  para despertar el interés D. sus clientes en hacer sus compras con motivos del día D. las madres, que a todas las familias entusiasma mientras a Ingrid se le incrementan las ventas en este bello día.
texts.en:
Ingrid D. A. lives with her husband and 24-year-old daughter in the town of Galapa where she has a general store selling at retail items like low cost clothes, stationery items, cosmetics and assorted catalogue merchandise.  She started the business in 2008 when she decided to experiment with a small display case that she bought used and a few items of merchandise that she stocked it with.  Ingrid has also occasionally worked as a Health Promoter at Galapa’s hospital where many of its residents are her customers and come to her to make seasonal purchases when they need gifts for special occasions or when they need stationery items.  Ingrid and her husband, who is a bricklayer, have managed to educate their daughter who is about to receive her law degree.

Her dream now is concentrated in expanding the business turning it into a large store where all the people from her town can find what they are looking for.  Because of this, while she hopes to gather an important clientele with her good service and by having what her customers need in stock, she will save up to be able to make permanent capital infusions toward this end.

She currently is able to contribute to household expenses with her work.  Her business’ working capital is mostly represented by her inventory.  She handles very few credit sales because of a past bad experience that taught her “it’s better to earn less but to sell for cash.” 

This is her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to stock her store with merchandise aimed at women to awaken customer interest in making Mothers Day purchases which excite all families and increase Ingrid’s sales on this lovely day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK JOM est créé le 08 avril. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Leur activité principale est l'embouche ovine.

Madame Bintou Léye à droite de la photo et emmitouflée d'une écharpe orange est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 66 ans est veuve et a en charge ses deux petits enfants. 

Elle mène une activité d'embouche ovine  mais fait aussi du petit commerce de bouillie de mil et d'arachides. Elle a une expérience de quatre ans dans ces domaines.


Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la région.


Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter des moutons pour augmenter son cheptel et ainsi faire de gros revenus.


Elle participe aux charges de la famille surtout pour la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bok Jom was created on April 8th. It is composed of 14 women who all come from the same village. Their group was formed based on family and neighborly connections. Their primary activity is raising sheep.

Mrs. Bintou Léye, on the right in the photo wearing an orange scarf, is the group leader. She is 66-year-old widow who looks after her two grandchildren.

Her activity is sheep fattening, although she also sells millet and peanut porridge. She has four years of experience in these fields. She buys her supplies weekly at the local markets.

This loan will allow her to buy sheep to increase her livestock and boost her revenue.

She takes care of the family’s needs, especially with respect to food and health care.

loans.use: to buy sheep to be fattened and sold

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipa K. is a 38-year-old lady who lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Mrs. Dipa K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 12 and her son is studying in grade 9. 

Mrs. Dipa is a center chief in her group. Being a center chief means she has taken responsibility for all her center members. (BPW Patan works in 62 different centers, which have up to eight groups of five women each. The members of each center elect a center chief, who is responsible for managing the groups and assisting loan officers at center meetings.) 

Mrs. Dipa and her husband, Mr. Ramesh K., opened their veterinary pharmacy six years ago. They sell different types of medicine for domestic animals in their shop. They both contribute equally in their shop because they don’t have any other jobs. 

Mrs. Dipa K. already has taken her second loan with Kiva and has repaid it. With the previous loan she was able to buy various medicines for her shop. Now Mrs. Dipa is requesting 30,000 NPR to expand her business and buy more necessary medicines for her shop.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her veterinary shop.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Isabel; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chompas de alpaca, ella teje las chompas y luego lo reparte en las diferentes tiendas que venden chompas, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chompas de alpaca. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one child. Isabel divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling sweaters made of alpaca wool. She knits the sweaters and later distributes them to different stores for resale. Isabel wants to expand her business of selling sweaters, so she is requesting a loan to buy alpaca wool in bulk.

Isabel is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool in bulk for making sweaters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To introduce new products such as baby shawls, diapers and vests into her product line.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and soft drinks and to fix up her locale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de materiales de construcción, ella provee a las diferentes tiendas, ella vende cemento, clavos, arena entre otros materiales, la socia trabaja en forma independiente por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old and in a common-law marriage. Elizabeth divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling construction materials to different stores. She offers cement, nails, sand, and other materials. Elizabeth works independently and her job enables her to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand her business of selling construction materials, so she is requesting a loan to buy more of these items.

Elizabeth is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to acquire construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two hair driers and a hair blow drier.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu N. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her father. Nulu lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and utilities.      

Nulu has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works six days out of every week. Nulu sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Nulu has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. 

The main business challenges for Nulu include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals for her business are to own a delivery van and also to open up other branches.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ampliacion Villa El Polvorin Group

texts.es: La Señora Isidora C. tiene 48 años vive con su esposo y tiene 03 hijos, desde  hace mas de 02 años aperturo su taller de confecciones junto a su esposo, ellos  se dedican a la elaboracion de polos para caballeros y lo llevan a vender a  diferentes departamentos del Perú. En sus inicios ellos trabajaban para diferentes talleres pero gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio pudieron ir adquiriendo maquinas de cocer, remalladoras y otros para luego poder tener su propio taller como siempre lo habian soñado. Con el préstamo obtenido van a seguir invirtiendo en telas para poder seguir confeccionando polos.
texts.en: Mrs. Isidora C. is 48 years old, lives with her husband and has 3 children. More than 2 years ago she opened a clothes-making store together with her husband. They make men's polo shirts and take them to different departments of Peru to sell. At the beginning, they worked for different workshops, but thanks to their hard work and sacrifice they were able to buy sewing machines, overlockers and other items to later be able to have their own workshop like they had always dreamed. With the loan they will continue investing in fabrics to keep making t-shirts.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fabric to make polo shirts.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen S. V. is 41 years old, married and the father of one.  

He runs Bridge Restaurant to earn a living. He has managed to stabilize the business through Faulu Kenya.  

He hopes to move the business to the city center, where he would be able to get more customers. 

He is now requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy crates of soda, seats and tables.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda, seats and tables.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz es una mujer muy trabajadora cuenta con 32 años de edad, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa desde hace 10 años, primero empezó rentando un local a su cuñada pero después se le hacia muy cara la renta y tubo que dejar de rentar y mejor opto por poner el negocio en su casa. Dice que ella solicito un préstamo a la financiera para surtir su tienda y comprara cloro, chiles enlatados, sopas, aceite, jabón, huevo, frijoles, refrescos, dulces, leche etc. doña Bety como es conocida por sus conocidos surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas de la población de Zitacuaro donde le den buenos precios para así después ella ganarle algo a la hora de venderlos. Doña Beatriz esta casada con el señor Juan Carlos el cual es guarachero y tiene dos niños de nombres Cecilia la cual estudia la primaria y Carlos de 2 años de edad. Doña Bety esta agradecida por el préstamo por que así va a tener mas surtido su negocio, la meta que tiene es comprar mas anaqueles para acomodar sus productos y mas adelante comprar un refrigerador para meter carnes frías.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a very hardworking 32-year-old woman. She has had a grocery store in her house for 10 years. She first began renting a store from her sister-in-law, but the rent became very expensive and she had to step renting and opted instead to put the business in her home. She says that she asked for a loan to supply her store and buy bleach, canned chili peppers, soups, oil, soap, eggs, beans, sodas, candies, milk, etc. Bety, as she is known by her friends, goes to different stores in Zitacuaro to source her products where they give her good prices so that she can make a profit when she sells them. 

Beatriz is married to Juan Carolos, who is a Guaracha musician, and has two children - Cecilia, who is in primary school, and Carlos, who is 2. Bety is thankful for the loan because this way she will be able to have more stock in her store. Her goal is to buy more shelves to accommodate her products and later to buy a refrigerator to stock cold meats.

loans.use: to buy items to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals, sugar, cooking fat and shoes.

loans.name: Glenda Marisol

texts.es:
Glenda de 25 años, es una mujer emprendedora en su negocio que un día decidió escoger esa actividad de servicio por la falta de empleo ya que tuvo el poyo de sus padres.

Ella trabaja todos lo días en su negocio. Su  local lo ubico en su propio domicilio para que su hermano lo ayude también la ayuda en la papelería. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería para su negocio como camaras, cables, computaodras y como útiles escolares y así mejorar su capital de trabajo. 

En un futuro desea acondicionar  y mejorar su local y dale lo mejor a sus clientelas.
texts.en:
Glenda, 25, is an enterprising woman in her business, who one day decided to choose this service activity because she didn't have a job and was living with the support of her parents. 

She works every day in her business. Her store is located in her house so that her brother can also help her in the stationary store. With the loan she will buy more merchandise for her business like cameras, cables, computers and school supplies, and thereby increase her business capital. 

In the future she wants to add air conditioning and improve her store and give her customers the very best.

loans.use: to buy cameras, cables, computers and school supplies.

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Trabajar como independiente siempre ha sido el sueño de Nelson Enrique J. C. oriundo del municipio de San Carlos en el Oriente de Antioquia, la falta de oportunidades laborales lo motivaron a hacerse a su propio negocio, una distribuidora de pipetas de gas, debido a que en el lugar donde vive no existe red y todas las personas utilizan las pipetas como opción. 

A sus 31 años de edad siente que esta es la oportunidad para estabilizarse económicamente y sacar adelante a su esposa y sus dos hijos para los que visualiza un mejor futuro. 

Nelson sueña con tener una gran distribuidora de gas que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y para empezar a hacerlo realidad necesita de un préstamo que le permita comprar estantería para ubicar las pipetas y comprar algunos cilindros que serán la base para iniciar con pie derecho su negocio.
texts.en:
To work independently has always been Nelson Enrique J. C.’s dream.  He is from the municipality of San Carlos in the west of Antioquia.  The lack of employment opportunities motivated him to set up his own business: a gas tank distributorship because the area where he lives lacks a network and everyone’s option is to use gas tanks. At the age of 31 he feels that this is the opportunity to stabilize economically and get ahead with his wife and two children for whom he visualizes a better future.

Nelson dreams with having a large gas distributorship that will make it possible for him to improve his and his family’s quality of life.  To start making it a reality he needs a loan that will allow him to buy shelving to store the tanks and to buy a few cylinders that will be the base for him to start his business on the right foot.

loans.use: to buy shelving and gas tanks.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice N. W. is a 33-year-old married woman with three children.  

She has grown cabbages for five years. With hard work on her farm, her business has grown.  

Apart from growing cabbages, she runs a boutique for extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business. 

She hopes to expand her farm together with her boutique for better income. She needs 40,000 KES to buy clothes for her boutique and improve her farm.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her boutique and improve her farm.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita Lama (Shakya) lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two sons. Her husband's name is Rajesh Shakya. He went to Dubai a few years ago for work. Her older son is studying in class 6 and her younger son is in primary school. 

Anita Lama opened her gift shop four years ago in the village of Khogana Dobata, intending to raise the living standard of her family. She sells various types of gift and decorative items in her shop. 

In Nepal the demand for gift items is increasing constantly because Nepal is very rich in its festivals. So to meet the demand of the customers, Mrs. Anita Lama is requesting a loan in the amount of  25,000 NPR to buy various types of gift items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy decorative goods for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children.  He does welding so as to earn a living.  His business is three years old and he employs two people.  

He also runs a posho mill to supplement his income.  He was previously in farming.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has gained business knowledge and has managed to add business stock.  He wants 40,000 Kes to buy welding rods and metals.

loans.use: to buy welding rods and metals

loans.name: Enerilda Del Rocio

texts.es:
Enerilda de 38 años, es una mujer inspiradora en su familia que decidió escoger esta actividad de ventas de cosméticos por catálogos para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Ella tiene dos hijos uno en escuela y el otro en universidad.

Ella labora en todo el día haciendo lo pedidos que sus clientes le piden o  se dedica a cobrarle a casa persona. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más mercadería de bisutería, cremas, perfumes. Y en un futuro mejorar su negocio para crecer y obtener más ingresos y darle lo mejor a sus hijos en salud y estudios.
texts.en:
Enerilda, 38 years old, is an uplifting woman in her family who chose to sell cosmetics from catalogs to help cover the costs of the home. She has two children, one in school and the other in university. 

She works every day taking orders from her customers and collecting payment. With the loan she will buy more costume jewelry, creams and perfumes. In the future she will improve her business to grow and get more income and give her children better health and education.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry, creams, perfumes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter was born in 1978.  He is married and has a 3-year-old child.  He started operating his retail shop seven years ago.  

He joined a Faulu Kenya group because he needed a way of saving his money and accessing finances easily.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes through the group.  He will use the loan to buy maize flour, tea leaves and sugar.  

Peter hopes to expand his business in five years and open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, tea leaves and sugar

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. M., seen here in the photo, sells herbal health products.  She has been in this business for the last seven years. 

Through the trainings held by Faulu Kenya, she has learned some business skills that have helped her to run her business.  She needs to add stock of zinc and calcium products.  Therefore, she has requested 20,000 Kes.  

She dreams of expanding her business in five years.  She is also looking forward to owning a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of zinc and calcium products

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian de 40 años,  natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri, es un  hombre entusiasta en sus labores y está casado con Albina de 38 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 06 hijos donde viven en su propia casa ubicados en la Comunidad Villa Quintiarina anexo del distrito de Quimbiri. El trabajo de Adrian es labrar la tierra, oficio que le enseñó sus padres desde que era muy niño, han transcurrido 23 años trabajando y cultivando cacao, maní y ajonjolíes, actividad que actualmente lo hace de manera tecnificada. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y  jornaleros, quienes le brindan el apoyo que necesita durante esa temporada, él sabe muy bien que sus ganancias se debe a la buena calidad de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, sin embargar cargar los pesados sacos de sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad le resulta muy cansado. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar la siembra y aumentar su producción. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y está dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. En su banco comunal es un socio participe. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de abono y fertilizantes que le serán de gran utilidad para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Adrian, a 40-year-old from the city of Quimbiri, is an enthusiastic worker. He is married to Albina, 38, and together with their 6 children they live in their own home in the community of Villa Quintianrina next to the district of Quimbiri. 

Adrian works the land, a trade that he learned from his parents from a very young age. He has spent 23 years cultivating cacao, peanuts, and sesame seeds; currently he uses machinery to do this. During harvest time he has the help of his children and seasonal workers, who give him a lot of needed support during that time. He knows that his earnings depend on the good quality of his fruits. What he most likes about his work is harvesting, even though carrying the heavy sacks of produce from the farm to the community is very exhausting. In the future, he hopes to buy new land to plant more and increase production. 

This is his 12th loan with MFP. He feels like this will help him to progress his work and plans to make his payments punctually. In his village bank he is a participating member. The loan is for the purchase of manure and fertilizers that will be of great use for improving his production.

loans.use: Comprar abono y fertilizantes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children, four of whom are in school. Rose lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and utilities.   

Rose runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Rose sells her products from home, by means of retail. 

Rose has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. 

The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and the ever increasing prices of commodities, which affects customers' rate of buying.

Her goals for her business are to own a delivery van and also to own a wholesale shop .

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt , boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in the Ntinda neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school.  

Hadjah has a business selling raw food. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products at the market.

She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and ever-increasing prices of food. 

Hadjah has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of cassava, yams and sweet potatoes.   Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to run a wholesale-only business .

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of yams, cassava and potatoes

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a registered member of Faulu Kenya.  He runs Secret Salon to earn a living.  He has run his business for nine years.  He says he treats his clients well, and this has helped to create good customer relations.  

Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to his business because he has learned about financial management, which is one of the elements that has helped him to keep his business.  He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kes because he needs to buy a hair dryer, clippers and hair chemicals.  His dream is to run a beauty parlor in the future.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, clippers and hair chemicals

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es:
Esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia es el legado de María Ofelia A. D. quien después de su separación debió asumir la responsabilidad del hogar y luchar por salir adelante con sus 4 hijos, por ello decidió crear su propio negocio, pues su poca escolaridad le cerraba las puertas en los lugares donde solicitaba trabajo. 

Su tienda de productos de la canasta familiar está ubicada en un espacio de su casa, pues así además de trabajar puede estar pendiente del hogar y de sus hijos, lo que le facilita su labor como madre. 

Actualmente María Ofelia necesita de un préstamo para comprar una nevera puesto que la que tiene se encuentra en mal estado y no le permite almacenar los productos, así podrá incrementar sus ventas ya que diversificará vendiendo productos como yogurt, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
A deep desire to provide for her family is what drives Maria Ofelia A. D.. After her separation, she had to assume the responsibility of providing for her four children. She decided to start her own business because with her limited education the doors were closed to other employment options.

Her shop sells staple foods and is located in her house. This way she can run her business and still care for her home and her children. 

Currently Maria Ofelia is seeking a loan to buy a freezer because her current freezer is broken and she cannot store products there. With a working freezer she could increase her sales and diversify the products she sells adding things like yogurt, milk, and other goods.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: La Trinite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "LA TRINITE" est formé de cinq personnes qui appartiennent toutes à la même famille. La représentante de ce groupe se nomme Aline Marthe. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Aline Marthe est mariée à un certain Florant. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Aline Marthe habite au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin) avec ses enfants et son mari depuis trois ans. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de dix ans que Aline Marthe mène comme activité, la vente de tissus à Cotonou. Aline Marthe s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Aline Marthe désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: The group "The Trinity" is made up of five people who all come from the same family.  The representative of the group is named Aline Marthe.  This is the first time that the group has requested ALIDé's financial support in order to raise their business levels.  Aline Marthe is married to a man named Florant.  The couple has four children in their care, all educated, of which two are their own children.  Aline Marthe has lived in the Kpondéhou neighborhood in Cotonou (the economic capital of Benin) with her children and husband for three years.  The couple takes care of the various familial responsibilities together.  It has been nearly 10 years that Aline Marthe has run her business selling cloth in Cotonou.  Aline Marthe stocks up in Danktopa, the international market of Benin.  With the goal of increasing her stock of products and better responding to the demands of her customer base, Aline Marthe would like to obtain a loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of cloth.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylvia B. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.

Sylvia has a business selling second-hand shoes. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Sylvia    sells her products at the market.

Sylvia has requested  a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand shoes. The main business challenges for Sylvia include transportation and ever-increasing prices fpr shoes.

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a permanent business location and also to sell wholesale. Sylvia  lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Tari Maya

texts.en:
Tari Maiya D., a resident of Chappagaun, lives with her husband and two sons, one of whom attends school. Chappagaun is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband works in a private office. 

Tari is engaged in goat farming. She has five goats on her farm. She sells the goats in the local market. This business helps her contribute  to upgrading the living standard of her family. She is requesting a third loan for 10,000.00 NPR to buy more goats and grains to feed them.

loans.use: To purchase baby goats

loans.name: « Eternel Est Ma Lumiere » Group

texts.fr:
« ETERNEL EST MA LUMIERE » est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo) est nommée Sidonie. Les membres du groupe appartiennent à la même localité. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
Née en 1982 au Bénin, Sidonie vit depuis quatre ans environs à Gankpodo, un quartier de Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Sidonie est mariée à Bertrand. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfant. Sidonie assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a environs sept ans que Sidonie vend des vêtements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est dans le même marché que Sidonie achète ses produits. Cette activité lui génère des revenus qui l’aident à subvenir à ses besoins et améliorer son niveau de vie. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Sidonie et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: "Eternal is My Light" is a group made up of three people, whose president (the one who has her finger raised in the photo) is named Sidonie.  The group members come from the same area.  With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group is requesting, for the second time, a loan from ALIDé.  Born in 1982 in Benin, Sidonie has lived for around four years in Gankpodo, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Sidonie is married to Bertrand.  The couple does not yet have any children.  Sidonie, along with her husband, cares for the different household responsibilities.  For around seven years, Sidonie has sold clothing in Danktopa, the international market of Benin.  Sidonie buys her products in the same market.  This business generates revenues for her which help to provide for her needs and improve her standard of living.  This second loan will definitely allow Sidonie and her group to raise their business levels and to grow their customer base and revenues.

loans.use: Acheter des vêtements.

loans.name: G.s. Moises Group

texts.es: La señora Tomasa ella se dedica al comercio de mercadería en general, la cual distribuye de manera ambulante. Su compañero de vida trabaja como sonidista en un conjunto musical. Tiene 3 hijos que estudian 1 en primaria y uno en secundaria.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería comopantalones, camisas, faldas, calzado, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos entre otros  así considera que su negocio incrementara con ayuda de los prestamos.  La señora Blanca Rosa además de trabajar en una zona franca también se dedica al comercio de  bisuterías en general, las cuales distribuye de forma ambulante. Ella es casada, su esposo es sastre y tiene 5 hijos, todos menores de edad y estudiando. Desea continuar invirtiendo en el negocio para que crezca y en un futuro solo dedicarse a su negocio. Atanacio Estanislao es un integrante nuevo del grupo, el tiene 58 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos estudiando en la universidad de 18 y 20 años de edad. El señor se dedica a la venta de artículos en general, los cuales distribuye en el M.. Antes elaboraba pantalones y los vendía en el M., sin embargo vender diferentes mercaderías es mejor para incrementar los ingresos. El inicio el negocio desde hace  18 años y ha sido duro ya que el capital inicial fue prestado, poco a poco ha ido haciendo su propio capital.
texts.en:
Tomasa sells general merchandise, which she distributes in an itinerant manner.  Her life partner works as a sound technician for a musical group.  She has one child in elementary school and one in high school.

She will use the loan to buy merchandise like pants, shirts, skirts, footwear, perfume, cream, and treatments, among other items.  This way her business will increase with help from the loans.

In addition to working in the free zone, Blanca Rosa sells general costume jewelry in an itinerant manner.  She is married, and her husband is a tailor.  She has five minor children, and they attend school.  She wishes to continue investing in her business.  She will do this so that it will grow.  Then she will only devote herself to her business in the future.

Atanacio Estanislao, age 58, is a new member of the group.  He is married and has two children attending the university.  They are 18 and 20 years old.  He sells general items in the market.  He used to make pants and sell them in the market.  However, selling different merchandise is better for increasing his earnings.  He started his business 18 years ago.  It has been difficult because his initial capital was borrowed.  Little by little he has been making his own capital.

loans.use: to buy  pants, shirts, skirts, footwear, perfume, cream, and treatments, among other items.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 43 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa y sus 03 queridos hijos; a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. Antonio es un hombre muy responsable, la vida le enseñó tropiezos pero no se amedrantó, al contrario  trato de sobresalir y trabajó con mucho ahínco en los cultivos de cacao y plátano, productos que actualmente los comercializa en la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad que obtiene de estos frutos, no dudan en comprarle todo lo cosechado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar en épocas de lluvia porque perjudican el rendimiento de su trabajo. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras.Este es su 12avo  crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar  todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario y responsable. El crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos como la poda y el desmonte de malezas.
texts.en: Antonio is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and three loving children. Antonio is a responsible man; he wants to provide a good education to his children. He had some setbacks in life, but he didn't let this deter him. On the contrary, he was motivated to succeed, and he worked hard on his cocoa and plantain crops. He sells these crops in the city of San Francisco, where he has a diverse group of buyers who purchase from him because they trust the quality of his products. He has been growing for 20 years, and his biggest challenge is working during the rainy season because he cannot accomplish as much. In the future he hopes to save enough from his earnings to buy more land. This will be his twelfth loan with MFP; he knows he has to make his payments punctually, and he is prepared to do so. He is responsible and shows solidarity with the other members of his community bank. The loan will be used to maintain his crops by hiring workers to prune and clear weeds.

loans.use: hire workers who can prune and clear weeds and brush from his fields.

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
This is 51 year-old Bimala S..  She is married and has one child, age 6.  In 2005, she established her meat shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy goats and chickens for her business.  

In the future, Bimala plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   In Nepal, the meat is always fresh.  In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo.  The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk.  

With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices.  This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.  This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy chickens and goats

loans.name: Jhunu

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Jhunu K..  She is married and has one child, age 10.  In 2004, she established her cow rasing business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy a young milk cow.  

In the future, Jhunu plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about $0.50 USD.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy a young milk cow

loans.name: Sandra Virginia

texts.es:
Sandra ahora tiene una lavadora mas y ha aumentado gradualmente su oferta en el servicio de lavandaría, igualmente su anterior crédito le alcanzó para su otro negocio de preparar comidas porque compró materias primas e  insumos y logró buenos descuentos en su compra; como Sandra se mueve en varias actividades generadoras de ingresos logró tambien fortalecer la venta de mercancias mediante guias especializadas, todo esto la puso muy contenta y ahora nuevamente quiere invertir, por eso ha acudido a su segundo  credikiva con el cual planea comprar una lavadora para incrementar sus servicios y aprovechar la oferta de productos de belleza que existe en el mercado a propósito del dia de la madre, época de gran despliegue comercial.
Ella despidió a su asesor de credito con las siguientes palabras: "Doy gracias a Dios por las personas de buen corazon que me han apoyado para crecer en mi actividad y con ello he logrado mejorar mi nivel de vida con mis diferentes actividades."
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Sandra ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/206893
texts.en:
Sandra now has an additional washing machine and has gradually increased her laundry service offer.  Her previous loan helped her in her other business making meals because she bought raw materials and supplies and managed to obtain good discounts on her purchase.  As Sandra works in several different income-making activities, she also managed to strengthen her business selling merchandise through specialized catalogs.  This made her very happy and now she would like to invest again.  For this reason, she is requesting her second Kiva loan with which she plans to buy a washing machine in order to increase her services and also to take advantage of the beauty products offer that exists in the market around Mother's Day which is a time of great commercial promotion.

Sandra took leave of her loan officer with the following words: "I thank God for the kind-hearted people who have supported me in growing in my business.  With their help, I have managed to improve my standard of living through my different business activities".

If you would like to know more about Sandra's story, check out the following link:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/206893

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to increase her services and to buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Lawani Latifa

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession, Lawani est âgée de 26ans et est mère de 02enfants. Son mari est mécanicien. Elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure depuis 2007. Elle veut satisfaire ses nombreuses clientes c’est pour  cela elle sollicite ce prêt  pour acheter  des mèches et des pommades. Elle achète au Grand marché de Lomé et revend dans son salon de coiffure sis à Novissi (un quartier pas très loin de la ville de Lomé).  Elle veut assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants, à elle-même et participer à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: A hairstylist by profession, Lawani is 26 years old and the mother of 2 children.  Her husband is a mechanic.  She opened her hair salon in 2007.  She wants to please her numerous clients, which is why she is requesting this loan to purchase hair extensions and pomades.  She buys at the big market of Lomé and resells in her hair salon in Novissi (a neighborhood not very far from the city of Lomé).  She wants to ensure a bright future for her children and herself, as well as participate in the care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and pomades.

loans.name: Victoria Eugenia

texts.es:
La habilidad para las manualidades ha sido una de las bendiciones que ha recibido Victoria Eugenia G. L. quien desde pequeña supo que este podría ser su oficio en el futuro. Después de que se casó esta emprendedora mujer consciente de la necesidad de aportar a cubrir los gastos del hogar, esta emprendedora decidió hacer de su arte su propio negocio, el cual ahora es fuente de ingresos para ella sus dos hijos y su esposo. 

A sus 29 años de edad es una luchadora incansable y aunque en ocasiones debido a los pedidos debe trabajar largas jornadas, esto la motiva porque sabe que así logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

En el futuro Victoria sueña con tener un local propio, pues por ahora, realiza las labores en su casa y las ofrece a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido e insumos que le permitan aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
A skill for making handicrafts is one of the blessings that Victoria Eugenia G. L. enjoys.  When she was a young girl, she knew that this could be her job in the future.  After she married, she was aware of the need to contribute towards covering her household expenses and so this enterprising woman decided to turn her art into her own business.  It is now a source of income for herself, her two children and her husband.

At 29 years old, Victoria is a determined, untiring lady and, in spite of the fact that she occasionally has to work long days due to the orders she has, this motivates her because she knows that it will enable her to improve her own quality of life and that of her family.

In the future, Victoria dreams of owning her own business premises.  Right now, she carries out her work at home and sells her products to her neighbors, friends and family members.  She needs this loan to buy stock and supplies which will allow her to increase her inventory and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy stock and supplies

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es: Aquiles de 42 años, natural del distrito de Quimbiri; convive con Gabriela de 33 años y tienen 01 hijo llamado Breyner de 01 y juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la paz. Aquiles, es el sostén de su familia, desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, hoy es campesino y cuenta con 20 hectáreas de terreno en donde cultiva cacao y café plantas nativas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurímac. Han transcurrido 25 años trabajando en esta actividad, y manifiesta que le gusta mucho, además cuenta con el apoyo de sus familias, además de los jornaleros que contrata, para así terminar rápido el trabajo de siembra, poda de maleza y cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su faena es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco y Quimbiri; puesto que es muy pesado y le resulta difícil el transporte. Asimismo el no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo en la cosecha y desmonte de maleza; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café y cacao ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en las cosechas.
texts.en:
Aquiles is 42 years old and from Quimbiri district.  He lives with 33 year-old Gabriela and they have one son called Breyner who is 1 year old.  Together they live in their own home where peace reigns.

Aquiles is his family's means of support.  His parents taught him to work on the farm since he was a very young boy.  He is now a farmer and has 20 hectares of land where he grows cacao and coffee which are both native plants of the rainforest area of the Apurímac River Valley.  He has worked in this business for 25 years and he says that he likes it a lot.  He also has the support of his familiy, in addition to the laborers that he hires so that he can finish his sowing, weeding and harvesting quickly.

What Aquiles most enjoys about his work is harvesting the fruit from his plants since that is when he feels that the months of hard work are providing him with their reward in the quality of the fruit.  He considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products from the farm to the warehouses, which are located in the city of San Francisco and Quimbiri, as it is very heavy and difficult to transport.  Another difficulty is that he doesn't have enough money to pay in advance for the laborers who support him in his harvesting and weeding.  This is why he takes loans offered by MFP.

Right now, Aquiles' priority is sowing his coffee and cacao plants since he has enough space for this.  This is his 12th loan from MFP and he feels that the loan money will help him a lot in making progress in his work.  Aquiles is very well liked by the other members of his community bank.  He will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to hire laborers to support him in his harvesting work.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help him with his harvest

loans.name: Chini Maya

texts.en:
Mrs. Chini Maya K., a resident of Sainbu-Bhaishipati, lives with her husband and a daughter.  Sainbu-Bhaishipati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.  Her husband works in a private office. 

Mrs. K. is engaged in goat farming.  Now she has two goats on her farm.  She sells the goats in the local market.  This business helps her to contribute something to improve the living standard of her family.  Now she is requesting a third loan of 10,000 NPR to buy a few more goats and grains to feed them.

loans.use: to buys baby goats for her business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime N. de 45 años vive con su cónyuge y su hija de 14 años  en el barro Carrizal, al sur de la ciudad, caracterizado por la alegría, el activismo en el trabajo independiente y la solidaridad  de la mayor parte de sus habitantes. En este ambiente dinámico y productivo,Jaime se dedica a la fabricación de bolsos, maletines y morrales,  oficio que aprendió desde hace 29 años, después de trabajar como empleado desde que cumplió sus 11 años de edad, pues era muy usual el desarrollo de esta actividad en la comunidad donde habitaba;  así fue que para ayudar con sus propios gastos, desde niño se sintió muy independiente y capaz de hacerle frente al trabajo, de tal manera que con él respondió  cuando surgió  la necesidad de ingresos familiares.   El mercado de Jaime   está ubicado en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde distribuye en locales ubicados en el centro de la ciudad, la zona más comercial y en los municipios del departamento del Atlántico como Sabanagrande, Repelón y también tiene una clientela en algunas poblaciones del departamento del Magdalena.  En el proceso productivo Jaime está apoyado por su esposa y su hija que forman parte de la tarea de acabado final. 
Actualmente Jaime está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el  comprará materias primas e insumos para fabricar nuevos y modernos diseños, que lo ayudan a mantenerse competitivo, pues necesita aumentar sus ventas que en la actualidad se encuentran en $ 2.000.000 COP, con un margen de utilidad promedia de un 40%.  Su sueño es apoyar la educación de su hija para verla convertida en una profesional exitosa, y respecto a su negocio ampliar su cobertura hacia otras poblaciones para lograr sus propòsitos como el de tener su propia casa y generar oportunidades de ingresos a muchas familias  de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jaime N. is 45 years old. He lives with his spouse and 14 year old daughter in the Carrizal neighborhood in the southern part of town. It is characterized by its cheerfulness, its activism and independent work, and the solidarity of most of its residents. In this dynamic and productive enviroment, Jaime makes bags, briefcases and backpacks. He learned this trade 29 years ago, after working as an employee since the age of 11. This activity was very normal in the communit where he lived. That is how, in order to help with his own expenses, he felt very independen and capable of working, so he responded when the need for family income arose. Jaime's market is located in the city of Barranquilla, where he distributes to locales located in the center of town, the most commercial area. He also distributes in the towns in the departament of Atlántico, such as Sabanagrande and Repelón. He also has clientele in some towns of the departament of Magdalena. During the productive process, Jaime is supported by his wife and daughter, who do part of the finishing work.  
 
At this time, Jaime is applying for his first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy raw materials to make new and modern designs, which will help him stay competitive. He needs to increase his sales, which at this time are at $ 2.000.000 COP, with an average profit margin of 40%. His dream is to support his daughter's education so that she can become a successful teacher. In regards to his business, he wants to expand his coverage to other towns to meet his goals such as having his own house and generating income opportunities for a lot of families in his community.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make bags, briefcases and backpacks.

loans.name: Grp 110 Gbenonkpo Ab Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe "Grp 110 GBENONKPO AB" est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent toutes à la même famille. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Virginie, est celle dont le doigt est levé sur la photo. Ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. 
Virginie est mariée à un certain Bernard. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Virginie habite au quartier Adjégounlè à Cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin) avec ses enfants et son mari depuis une vingtaine d’année. Le couple se partage les diverses charges familiales. Virginie  n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a près de vingt cinq ans que Virginie prépare de la bouille faite à base d’amidon de maïs (« Akpan » et « Tapioca ») près de chez elle. De façon secondaire, Virginie  vend des fruits  qu’elle achète à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Virginie désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: The group "Grp 110 Gbenonkpo AB" is made up of three people who all come from the same family.  The representative of the group, named Virginie, is the one whose finger is raised in the photo.  The group is seeking ALIDé's financial support in order to raise their level of business.  Virginie is married to a man named Bernard.  The couple has six children, all educated, of which three are in their care.  Virginie has lived in the Adjégounlè in Cotonou (the economic capital of Benin) with her children and husband for some twenty years.  The couple shares the various familial responsibilities.  Virginie never went to school.  For almost 25 years, Virginie has prepared porridge, with corn starch as the base ("corn patties" and "tapioca"), near her home.  As a secondary business, Virginie sells fruit that she buys in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  With the goal of increasing her stock of products and better responding to the demand of her customer base, Virginie would like to receive a loan, along with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, manioc flour, and tapioca.

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Babita A. is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  In 2000, she established her cow raising business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  Babita has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy young dairy cows.  In the future, Babita plans to raise the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for thiee milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and fuel for fires and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates at BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: to purchase young dairy cows

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es:
A sus 45 años de edad y como padre de familia responsable de sus dos hijos y de su esposa, Gustavo Antonio P. C. ha sido un gran emprendedor toda su vida. Inicialmente tuvo una carnicería la cual se quebró debido a la competencia, después para empezar de nuevo se desplazó hacia el municipio de Betania al suroeste de Antioquia con la ilusión de empezar de nuevo y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia. 

Fue entonces cuando con lo poco que tenía compró un coche para realizar acarreos en el municipio y las afueras del mismo, debido a la difícil situación económica que enfrentaba se vio en la necesidad de innovar y convertir su coche en una legumbrería ambulante, lo que le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos y así cubrir los gastos familiares. 

Actualmente, Gustavo necesita realizarle algunas adecuaciones a su coche para mejorarlo, aunque sus aspiraciones son el furo son comprar una moto de carga para transportarse hasta otros municipios, por ahora va creciendo en la medida de sus posibilidades y sabe que su perseverancia harán que su sueño sea una realidad.
texts.en:
At 45 years of age and as a responsible husband and father to two children, Gustavo Antonio P. C. has been a great entrepreneur all his life. He originally had a butcher's shop which went bankrupt due to the competition. Afterwards he moved to the municipality of Betania in the south east of Antioquia with the idea of starting over and offering his family a better future.  

It was then that he purchased a car to provide a transport service in the municipality and the outlying areas. Due to the difficult financial situation he was faced with, he saw it necessary to innovate and turn his car into a travelling vegetable cart which helped him to improve his income and cover the family's cost of living. 

Gustavo currently needs to make some repairs to his car, even though his future aspirations are to purchase a motorbike which he can use to travel to other municipalities. For now he is concentrated on expanding the possibilities of his business and he knows that his perseverance will turn his dreams into reality.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward would like a loan to purchase spare parts for resale in his retail shop that he has owned for 5 years. He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his five children and two other dependants as his wife is not employed and they live in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Edward dreams of building a permanent residential house and growing his business to start selling motorcycles and bicycles, although he has challenges of limited capital and high fuel prices that have raised transport fares.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a Ugandan male, aged 29 years, who needs a loan to buy sugar to sell in his retail shop. He hails from Kyenjojo district and is a father of two children, ages 5 and 2 years, dreaming of educating his children. Emmanuel has been in business for two years. He started in agriculture where he accumulated his start up capital. He wants to open a wholesale shop in the future despite challenges of high transport costs and fluctuating prices.

loans.use: to buy sugar for retail sale

loans.name: Fayossey

texts.fr: Agé de 26ans, Mr Fayossey est  couturier de profession. Sa femme est revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités (lait, sucre, riz..) et est père de 01 enfant.  Il a crée son atelier  depuis 2002 et a plusieurs clients.  Il  fait de la broderie et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter  de la machine de broderie pour satisfaire ses clients nombreux afin de d’avoir plus d’argent pour  assurer  l’avenir de ses enfants, sa femme et son propre avenir. Il a une ambition : devenir un couturier de renom.
texts.en: At 26 years old, Mr. Fayossey is a dressmaker by profession.  His wife is a reseller of high necessity products (milk, sugar, rice, etc.) and he is the father of one child.  He created his workshop in 2002 and has several clients.  He embroiders and is requesting this loan to buy an embroidery machine to meet the needs of his numerous clients in order to have more money to ensure the future of his children, his wife and himself.  He has one ambition: to become a renowned dressmaker.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for embroidering.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a Ugandan man, age 30, who needs a loan to buy cattle to slaughter for his butcher shop that he has operated for 3 years. He hails from Kyenjojo district, and is a father of three children. Charles has a wife who deals in agriculture in the same area. He lives in a semi-permanent house with 5 people that he takes care of. His dream is to educate his children. He acquired his initial capital from farming from which he accumulated his savings to start up the butcher shop. He faces the problem of high cattle prices in his business.

loans.use: buy cattle to slaughter for his butcher shop

loans.name: Bendiara Group

texts.fr:
Mme Amsétou est la responsable du groupe BENDIARA. Elle est mariée, mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. Tous les 04 enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 07 personnes à sa charge.

Amsétou vend du savon, comme activités connexes des cartes de recharge et un secrétariat public. Elle mène cette activité depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du  secteur 08 en ville. Ses clients sont les voisins et les passagers.

Mme veut s’acheter 04 cartons de savon et des fournitures de bureau pour sa secrétariat.

Elle veut utiliser ses économies pour pouvoir fabriquer elle-même son savon. Elle a pour ambition de créer sa propre entreprise de savon, surtout fabriquer les savons antiseptiques et d’employer des gens pour l’aider. Mme veut payer  la scolarité de ses enfants et subvenir au besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amsétou is in charge of the BENDIARA group. She is married with four children. The eldest is 23 and the youngest 14. All four children go to school. She is supporting seven people. 

Mrs. Amsétou sells soap and also rechargeable phone cards and office supplies. She has been in this business for 12 years. She buys her inventory in the marketplace in Sector 8 of the town. Her customers are neighbors and passers-by. 

Amsétou wants to buy four cartons of soap and office supplies for resale. 

She wants to use her savings to manufacture her own soap. Her ambition is to create her own soap factory, in particular to make antiseptic soap and hire some people to help her. She wants to pay her children's school fees and be able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy four cartons of soap and some office supplies for resale.

loans.name: Yenny Cecilia

texts.es:
La sala de la casa de Yenny Cecilia C. M. es el lugar donde esta emprendedora de 27 años de edad tiene su negocio de video juegos desde hace un año, el cual se ha convertido en fuente de sustento importante para su ella y su familia, pues aunque su esposo trabaja en algunas oportunidades debe pasar algunos días en la casa por la falta de oportunidades. 

Yenny se siente orgullosa de contribuir en su hogar y espera en el futuro crecer su negocio para poder brindarle a su hija un mejor futuro. 

Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para construir un local y así empezar a ampliarse para hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
The living room of Yenny Cecilia C. M.' home is the place where this 27 year-old entrepreneur has been running her video games business for one year.  It has become an important source of support for herself and her family because, although her husband works, he sometimes has to spend  days at home when there is a lack of opportunities.

Yenny feels proud that she is able to contribute to her household and hopes, in the future, to grow her business so that she can provide her daughter with a better future.

Right now, Yenny needs a loan to build business premises so that she can start expanding her business and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to build business premises

loans.name: Blas

texts.es: Blas, de 47 años, es un hombre muy alegre y luchador, vive en su propia casa  junto a su esposa Gloria de 39 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Blas, es un hombre muy trabajador, su actividad consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 15 hectáreas de terreno; espacio donde cultiva, plátano, cacao y café. Ya son 20 años trabajando en la agricultura, y menciona que le gusta mucho, y en tiempo de siembra y cosecha debe contratar jornaleros para que pueda realizar de manera más rápida el trabajo. Una vez extraído el producto los comercializa a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de cada producto. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de San Francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más prioriza es comprar más plantas de café para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar en su producción, para  así darle una buena estabilidad económica a  su  familia. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en el desmonte de malezas que perjudique sus plantas.
texts.en:
Blas is 47 years old.  He is a very cheerful and determined man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 39 year-old Gloria, and his three beloved children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Blas is a very hard-working man.  His business is working the land.  He is a farmer and has 15 hectares of land.  He uses this space to grow bananas, cacao and coffee.  He has been a farmer for 20 years and he mentions that he likes it a lot.  During the sowing and harvesting seasons, he has to hire laborers so that he can do his work more quickly.  Once he has harvested his produce, he sells it to traders who pay him very well for every kilogram of produce.

Blas considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his produce from the farm to the warehouses which are located in the city of San Francisco.  This is where they offer him the best prices for his products.  Blas' main priority right now is to buy more coffee plants so that he expand his sown fields and increase his production which will, in turn, enable him to provide his family with good financial stability.

This is Blas' 12th loan from MFP and he is prepared to make all his repayments on time since he would like to be able to access another loan in the future.  Blas is a very active member of his community bank.  He will use the loan he has requested to hire laborers to support him in getting rid of the weeds that damage his plants.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help him weed his plantations

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard wants a loan to buy salt, sugar, batteries, matches and other general merchandise for sale in his mobile retail shop. He operates in markets, a business he has done for 8 years. Richard is 29 years old and lives in a two-room rented house in the Disrict of Kyenjojo together with his wife and their five-year-old child. Richard started off by selling passion fruits. He now wants to start up a wholesale shop in the future. He dreams of educating his children and becoming a prominent business man.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, batteries, matches and other general merchandise

loans.name: Vallecito Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLECITO”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma: es conviviente y tiene 34 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la realización de bisutería, ella elabora a mano y los vende, la socia trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de bisutería desde hace 4 años, la socia realiza trabajos como collares, aretes de cuarzo y piedras, pulseras de colores y con acabados lindos y bien decorados. L a socia desea el crédito para poder comprar materiales para la elaboración de sus trabajos ella compra desde hilos, alambres, mostacillas, piedras, ganchitos, cadenetas, y mucho más para realizar los diferentes trabajos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar sus trabajos y continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.
 
Los otros socios del banco comunal se dedican a la venta de comidas caceras; movilidad escolar; albañiles, taxista; carpintero; tienda abarrotes; bazar- librería. 


La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Vilma is a member of the Communal Bank “Vallecito” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 34 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Vilma earns her living by producing trinkets by hand and selling them. She has been selling all kinds of trinkets for four years. Her work involves making necklaces, earrings of quartz and stones, and colorful bracelets with bright finishes and ornate decorations. Vilma needs a loan to buy materials for making her creations such as thread, wire, beads, stones, hooks, miniature chains, and other supplies. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of these materials for her work so that she can continue to grow her business.

The other members of the Communal Bank engage in selling homemade meals, school tranportation, masonry, providing taxi services, carpentry, selling groceries, and operating a bazaar and bookstore.

Sra. Vilma is extremely grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase materials for producing handmade trinkets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags, purses, footwear, clothes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Claudia Liliana

texts.es:
La tradicional arepa se convirtió en el negocio de Claudia Liliana R. de 37 años, quien con unos ahorros, la ilusión de salir adelante con su esposo y su hija, sus manos y dos hornos que les prestaron le dio vida a Rikarepa, un negocio familiar en el que trabaja ella su esposo y además genera empleo a dos mujeres cabeza de familia. 

La ilusión de progrsar, brindarle una buena educación a su hija y mejorar su calidad de vida son el motor que día a día impulsa a Claudia a trabajar desde las 3:00 de la mañana, hora en la que se levanta para empezar las labores propias del negocio. 

Actualmente Claudia está atravesando por una dificultad, pues uno de sus hornos se dañó y requiere ser reparado para que siga funcionando y puedan continuar respondiendo a sus clientes. 

En el futuro esta emprendedora espera ampliar su negocio, comprar más hornos, generar empleo y comprar un carro que le permita distribuir sus arepas a diferentes municipios del suroesteste de Antioquia.
texts.en:
The traditional 'arepa' (cornmeal roll) turned into a business for 37 year-old Claudia Liliana R..  With some savings, the desire to get ahead in life together with her husband and daughter, her two hands and two ovens that somebody loaned her, she started Rikarepa, a family business in which both she and her husband work.  In addition, they provide work to two women who are heads of their respective families.

The desire to make progress, provide her daughter with a good education and improve her quality of life are the driving forces which compel Claudia to start work at 3 o'clock in the morning.  This is the time that she gets up in order to start her work.

Claudia is currently having a difficult time because one of her ovens became damaged and needs to be fixed so that it can continue working and so that she can continue responding to her customers.

In the future, this entrepreneur hopes to expand her business, buy more ovens, create more jobs and buy a car which will allow her to distribute her arepas to different towns in the south-west of Antioquia.

loans.use: to fix her oven
